loans.name: Juan Victor

texts.es:
Juan de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra mango, productos que se comercializan diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para compra de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y jabas para transportar la fruta que vende, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida.  Juan es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante y se supere.
texts.en:
Juan, 41, lives with his wife and children in his own house which does not have basic utilities and is located in a rural part of Tambogrande District which belongs to Piura Department, a zone noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

Juan is a farmer.  He owns farmland where he grows mangoes that he sells daily.  Once he harvests his products he sells them in various markets in Piura and is thus able to earn income to cover daily family expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy fertilizer to improve the soil and his products and crates to transport the fruit he sells so that he can get better prices for them and earn higher income improving his quality of life.  

Juan is a hardworking, very responsible person.  All he wants is that his family gets ahead and improves.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and crates.

loans.name: Lissy

texts.es: Lissy tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy joven y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. EL trabajo de Lissy consiste en la venta de ropa, siendo su forma de pago a crédito. Al cabo de 15 días visita a sus clientes para realizar la cobranza. Es la la primera vez que realiza este trabajo, y tiene puesta todas las ganas posibles, además de tener muchas expectativas, pues le ayudará a tener un ingreso adicional en su casa. Espera poder ganar bien, ya que  analizó el mercado por lo que espera que le irá bien en el negocio. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, la primera vez le fue muy bien y mostró ser muy puntual en los pagos. Asimisma se siente agradecida con la oportunidad y la confianza que le dieron para poder realizar nuevos retos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería en la ciudad de Lima, y traerá modelos de vanguardia en ropa femenina.
texts.en:
Lissy, 27, is a very young woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She lives with her partner and they have two children who are 8 and 4 years old.  They live together in their own house.  Lissy works selling clothes on credit.  After two weeks pass by she visits her customers to collect payment.  This is the first time she’s done this work and she’s putting all her efforts into it because she has high expectations for it in that it will help her have an additional source of income for her household. She hopes to make good profits since she analyzed the marked and expects she’ll do well in the business.

This will be the second MFP loan.  She did well the first time and she was very punctual with her payments.  She feels very grateful for the opportunity and for the trust given her to reach her new goals.  She will use the amount requested to buy merchandise in the city of Lima and bring cutting edge women’s wear.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Juan, de 67 años de edad, originario de la comarca llamad Los Jovos ubicada en las afueras de Estelí , es casado, tiene un hijo, ya es mayor de edad es independiente. Don Juan es agricultor y ganadero, el aprendió estas actividades rurales a través de su familia ya que ello se levantar desde horas muy tempranas a preparar el terreno para siembra, a ordeñar a los animales, cultivar hortalizas y granos básicos es una de las  actividades que mas disfruta en su tareas diarias. Cuando se caso le regalo un pedazo de tierra que es donde hoy en día tiene su caso y siembra , después se dedico a la ganadería como ingresos secundarios que le ayudan a sustentar sus gastos cuando esta baja la siembra de hortalizas. El realizo el crédito para comprar 2 vacas para producir leche. Esto le ayudara a mejorar su negocio de producción de leche, ayudara también a la reproducción de sus vacas ya que en lo futuro quiere tener una finca productora de leche pues es una actividad que genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, 67, is from an area called Los Jovos located in the outskirts of Estelí.  He’s married and has an adult son who is independent.  Juan is a farmer and raises livestock.  He learned these rural skills through his family since that’s what they did.  He rises very early in the morning to prepare the soil for planting and to milk the cows. To farm vegetables and basic grains is one of his favorite daily chores.

When he got married he received a plot of land as a gift and that’s where he now has his house and his crops.  He went into raising livestock later as a way of earning supplemental income that helps him cover household expenses when crops are small.  He took out the loan to buy two dairy cows to produce milk.  This will help him improve his milk producing business and will also help him breed the cows because in the future he’d like to have a dairy farm because this is a very profitable business.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 62 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace varios años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio.  Con esta actividad él solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda  su familia.

Daniel observa que va creciendo favorablemente su negocio, desea seguir ampliándolo con la compra de más mercadería como productos comestibles y abarrotes en general.  Al comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades le ayuda en bajar el precio que paga a su proveedor. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles. Daniel es muy trabajador y dedicado frente a su negocio. Desea lograr mayores ingresos para brindarle mejores opciones en la vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel, 62, lives with his wife and son in his own house that has all basic utilities and is located in an urban part of Cayaltí District which belongs to Chiclayo Province.  This zone is noted for farming and animal husbandry.

He’s had a home-based grocery store for several years.  He stocks various daily consumption staples and groceries in general to sell to his neighbors and customers from the zone.  He has an established clientele and no other nearby competition.  He is able to cover expenses and help his family with this activity.

Daniel has been noticing favorable growth in his business so he wants to continue to expand it buying more merchandise like foodstuffs and groceries in general.  Buying products in large amounts will help him lower the price for the consumer.  Because of this, he’s felt it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan.  Daniel is very hardworking and dedicated to his business.  He wants to attain higher income to provide the best life options for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Amigas De Puerto Perez Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE PUERTO PEREZ” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosmery. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de pescado, pesca

La señora Rosmery  indica es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio caza y venta de pescados que viene trabajando desde años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de red (para la caza) la misma será adquirida de ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente o usará en la caza como herramienta de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada.
texts.en:
The “Amigas de Puerto Pérez” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board headed by Rosmery.  The members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: food sales, fish sales and fishing.

Rosmery indicates that this is the first time she’s worked with Pro Mujer having joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She currently works fishing and selling fish, a business she’s been working at for many years having learned it from her family.

The loan she’s taking out is to buy a fishing net that she’ll buy in the city of La Paz and then use as a work tool fishing.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family the best way possible since she’s married.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando de 21 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Armando desde hace un años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, una vez que cosecha cuenta con otro ingreso para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado y de fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, con las ganancias que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Armando es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia para que logren su objetivo trazado.
texts.en:
Armando, 21, lives with his family in his own house that lacks basic utilities and is located in a rural part of Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  It’s a zone noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

For a few years now Armando has been raising sheep.  His corral, which is apt for this purpose, is located in his back yard.  He feeds his animals nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses so that they will reach optimal growth and be sold at various local markets earning good profits to cover household expenses.  He also has land where he grows lemons which when harvested represent an additional source of household income.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed and fertilizer to improve his farmland.  With profits obtained from both activities he’ll be able to repay the loan as well as have a better quality of life.  Armando is a person who through much effort and dedication has managed to move his family forward toward attaining their set goals.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fátima De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Fátima es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio su negocio con la producción de nacatamales comida típica que generalmente se hace los fines de semana. En la actualidad también vende ropa de todo tipo de estilos.
Ella con el crédito comprara mercadería para aprovechar la temporada alta que es en diciembre.
texts.en: Fátima is a hardworking, enterprising woman who started her business making Nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales], a traditional food usually consumed on weekends.  At present, she also sells clothes in all styles.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to take advantage of high season which is December.

loans.use: to buy summer seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snacks.

loans.name: Calle Cordova (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Calle Córdova. Esta linda ciudad se la conoce por el nombre de la Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos.

Este es un grupo de personas decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, servicios, venta de comida entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Ana tiene 37 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijas de 17, 12 y 8 años de edad  que estudia una en escuela y las dos mayores en colegio.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida desde hace varios años trabaja en una hostería de la ciudad, allí realiza trabajos de limpieza y otros arreglos del lugar, pero para ganar un dinero extra también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo el cual lo realiza puerta a puerta en sus ratos libres, tiene muchos clientes que le compran su mercadería además su hija mayor también le ayuda con sus ventas ya que les ofrece a sus compañeras de clases. Ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva dos años en esta actividad y le va bastante bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Es su primer crédito en el banco y espera seguir por mucho tiempo.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijas terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the “Calle Córdova” communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo.  This pretty city is known as the “City of the Royal Tamarinds.”

This is a group of people that decided to join together into this communal bank which will be very useful because with the loans they will be able to improve their small businesses.  They carry out a variety of activities like general commerce, services and food sales, among other activities.

We met Ana, 37, here.  She’s a single mother of three daughters who are 17, 12 and 8 years old; the youngest goes to elementary school and the two oldest go to secondary school.

To earn a living she’s been working for several years in an inn in the city.  She does cleaning and other tasks there.  But to earn a little extra money she also sells all types of clothes door to door in her free time.  She has many customers that buy her merchandise and her oldest daughter also helps her out selling clothes to her classmates.  She sells on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She’s been in this business two years and does quite well.  

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  It’s her first loan in the communal bank and she hopes to continue for a long time.  Her dream is that her daughters finish their schooling and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Francis Janethe

texts.es:
La señora Francis Janethe es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene dos negocios tiene un pequeño bar en un colegio donde vende chiverías, gaseosa, jugos, emparedados, tajadas con queso y vende ropa interior. Ella invertirá en ambos negocios pero principalmente en la ropa porque es época de temporada alta.
Francis tiene tres niños de 21, 13 y 10 años que están en la escuela. El mayor de sus hijos le ayuda en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Francis Janethe is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has two businesses. She has a small stand at a school where she sells snacks, soda, juice, sandwiches, and plantain slices with cheese. She also sells undergarments. She will invest in both businesses, but mainly in the clothing business because it is the high season.

Francis has three children, ages 21, 13 and 10, who are in school. Her oldest helps her with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business selling undergarments.

loans.name: Santos Elida

texts.es:
Santos de 39 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijo, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Santos desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y caprino (ovejas y cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un peso y una talla ideal para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar animales de otras especies y su alimento respectivo, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Santos es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es poderle brindar comodidades a su familia y que tenga mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Santos, 39, lives in her own house with her husband and son. The only service her house receives is electricity. It is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district in Piura department. This area is characterized by its agriculture, cattle-raising and handicrafts.

For some years now, Santos has been raising sheep and goats. Her corral is located behind her house and is suitable and spacious. She feeds her livestock a balanced diet and provides natural pastures so that they reach an optimal level of growth and she is able to sell them in the different markets in the area and make a good profit. This enables her to meet her daily household expenses.  

She has requested a loan of 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy other types of animals and their respective feed. With the income she receives from her sales she can cover her loan and improve her quality of life. Santos is a very hardworking and responsible person who wants only to be able to provide amenities and economic improvements for her family.

loans.use: to buy other kinds of animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 57 años de edad, reside con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas de varios años, el suele sembrar maiz en un terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, el cual una vez que cosecha lo ofrece en el mercado de la zona a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus obligaciones de su casa.

Roberto desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.  Al tener mejoras económicas podra brindarle más comodidades a su esposa.
texts.en:
Roberto is 57 years old, and resides with his wife in their own house where the only basic service they have is electricity. He lives in the rural agricultural and cattle farming zone in the Paijan district of La Libertad department. He has done agricultural work for many years, usually planting corn in his field. Once he harvests the corn, he offers it for sale to his customers in the market. With the income he makes, he can meet his obligations for his home. 

Roberto wants to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for maintaining his corn crop, and he hopes this will enable him to get a good harvest. Therefore he has seen the need for requesting a loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With an improved economic situation, he will be able to offer his wife more comforts and conveniences.

loans.use: to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to help maintain his corn crop

loans.name: Herminda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Herminda, sigue administrando su pulperia, en donde ha introducido mas productos, que ha aumentado sus ventas, mejorando sus ganancias, de las cuales ha venido hacer mejora a su vivienda.
Su esposo labora como conductor, siempre apoyando a la familia, de sus tres hijos, dos trabajan uno es cadete de taxi, el otro vende cd, y el menor estudia. Lo que para ella es de gran sastifaccion tener a su familia unida con el objetivo de apoyo mutuo para cubrir las necesidades en vivienda, alimentos, vestimenta,estudio,salud.
Con este nuevo prestamo hara compra de productos de granos basicos, productos de coca cola, golosinas, carne, pollo, productos lacteos, caja de jabon de lavar, de lavar traste, de baño, shampoo, entre otros que son lo mas demandado por el cliente.
texts.en:
Herminda is still running her grocery store; she’s introduced additional products that has led to increased sales and improved profits that she’s been using to do home improvements.

Her husband works as a driver, always supporting the family.  Of her three children, two work one as a taxi driver and the other selling CDs; the youngest is still in school.  For her it’s a great satisfaction to have her family together with the mutual goal of covering their housing, food, clothing, education and health needs.

She will use this new loan to buy basic grains, Coca-Cola products, snacks, meat, chicken, dairy products, a box of detergent, dishwashing soap and bath soap and shampoo, among others which are the items most requested by customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Pablo Sexto Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pablo Sexo está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Beatriz de los Ángeles de 56 años quien es propietaria de una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio en 1981 con unos ahorros y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Ella tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad y el crédito lo invertirá en mercadería para el negocio.

Las otras integrantes son Greysel de 24 años es una mujer trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de productos Avon y María Paulina  de 31años es comerciante de ropa.
texts.en:
The Pablo Sexto group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Beatriz de los Ángeles, 56, who is the proprietor of a grocery store. She started this business in 1981 with some savings, and little by little, it has grown. She has three grown children, and she will invest her part of the loan in merchandise for her store. 

The other members are Greysel, 24, a hardworking woman who sells Avon products, and María Paulina, 31, who deals in clothing.

loans.use: to purchase basic dry grains

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 41 años, es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, ella esta casada y es madre de una hija de 14 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, además de la compañía de su mamá. Lucy es dueña junto a su esposo de una botica ubicada en una zona muy concurrida de un asentamiento humano, ahí ella tiene todo tipo de medicamentos legales y permitidos según el estado, además tiene la asesoría de un químico farmacéutico. Esta botica esta en su casa y en ocasiones atiende su hija. Lleva ya cuatro años en este actividad, y le esta yendo muy bien. Por otro lado tiene un trabajo adicional en el consultorio de su cuñado, como asistente; y ya por las tardes se dedica a su botica. Su plan es tener otra sucursal en el distrito de Yarinacocha. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, puesto que amigas le propusieron ingresar al grupo, puesto que así logrará mejorar su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará medicamentos legales para su botica.
texts.en: Lucy is 41 years old. She is a responsible and very hard-working woman. She is married and the mother of a 14-year-old daughter. Together they live in their own house, along with her mother. Together with her husband, Lucy is the owner of a pharmacy located in a busy area of a settlement. There she has all kinds of legal, state-permitted medicines, and she also has a pharmaceutical chemist consultant.  This pharmacy is in her house, and her daughter watches it on occasion. She has been doing this for four years, and it is going well for her. She also has another job in her brother-in-law's practice, as an assistant; in the afternoons, she runs her pharmacy. Her plan is to have another branch in the Yarinacocha district. This will be her first loan with MFP. Her friends invited her to join the group, since through it she will be able to improve her business. With the amount requested, she will buy legal medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase medicines permitted by the health ministry.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: La sra. Lilia de 59 años es una mujer emprendedora; hace 15 años afuera de su domicilio puso una pequeña mesa con dulces, frituras, galletas, panes y helados para vender a ella siempre le ha gustado el trato con la gente y gracias a su amabilidad al poco tiendo la mesita en la que ella vendió se convirtió en una tienda de abarrotes grande en la que ella vende, productos enlatados, refrescos, frutas, verduras, lácteos, botanas, galletas, dulces y un poco de papelería como lo son lápices, cuadernos, borradores, sacapuntas pegamentos y mas.  Para la Sra. Lilia su mayor logro en la vida es no depender económicamente de sus hijos ya que ella sabe que ellos han formado una familia es esa quien tienen la obligación de velar día con día, es por ello que solicita el apoyo para compra de mercancía y así poder surtir mas su negocio y que este le siga dejando ganancias para sus necesidades básicas y al mismo tiempo para ir surtiendo mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Lilia, 59, is an enterprising woman.  Fifteen years ago she set up a small table outside her house with candy, fried fast food, cookies, bread and ice-cream to sell.  She’s always enjoyed dealing with people and thanks to her kindness the little table she used for sales gradually became a large grocery store where she sells canned goods, soft-drinks, fruit, vegetables, snacks, cookies, candy and some stationery supplies like pencils, notebooks, erasers, pencil sharpeners, glue and more. 

For Lilia, her greatest accomplishment has been not having to depend economically on her children since she knows that they have formed their own families and that’s where they should focus their efforts towards their wellbeing every day.  

This is why she’s asking for support to purchase merchandise to better stock her store so that it will continue to produce profits for her to meet her basic needs while at the same time continue to increase her store’s stock.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Edudocia

texts.es: La profe Mari, así la llaman de cariño sus alumnos, es una señora de 61 años, madre soltera , tiene 4 hijos todos independientes, ella es profesora de español , da clases a jóvenes de primaria y secundaria, también enseña español a extranjeros que desean hablar en idioma español. Ella es originaria del departamento de Jinotega pero habita en a cuidad de Estelí. Al jubilarse ella decide dar clases de español  de manera privada, logro poner una pequeña escuela donde enseña español. La enseñanza es una vocación que según nos cuenta le nace por espontaneidad, y le gusta es por ello que quiere seguir enseñando hasta donde sus huesos aguanten, pues gracias a ello que logro que sus hijos estudiaran. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar una impresora y una computadora laptop pues la tecnología va avanzando y no quiere quedarse atrás y es una herramienta que le ayudan a realizar su trabajo, y es de mucha utilidad y necesidad en su pequeña escuela. Ella desea continuar al frente de su escuela, hacerle mejoras para mantenerla funcionando en optimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Profe Mari, as her students affectionately call her, is a 61-year-old, single mother; she has four children who are all now independent.  She’s a Spanish teacher.  She imparts classes to elementary and secondary school youngsters and also teaches Spanish to foreigners who wish to speak the Spanish language.  She is originally from Jinotega Department but lives in the city of Estelí.  When she retired she decided to give private Spanish classes.  She set up a small school where she teaches Spanish.

According to her, teaching is a vocation that springs spontaneously from her; she likes it and expects to continue teaching for as long as her bones can bear it for thanks to it she managed to provide her children with an education.

She needs the loan to buy a printer and a laptop computer because technology keeps moving forward and she does not want to be left behind and it’s a tool that will help her do her work and which is of much use and much needed in her small school.  She wants to continue at the helm of her school and to make improvements to it to keep it functioning in optimal condition.

loans.use: to buy a printer and a laptop computer.

loans.name: El Futuro Del Peru - Huancayo Group

texts.es: Milber Raúl de 20 años de edad, casado con 1 hijos menores de edad, en la actualidad vive en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica al transporte de vehículos  como chofer realiza el servicio de fletero de traslado de mercadería en el mercado mayorista. El préstamo solicitado invertirá en la compra de accesorios para el mantenimiento de su vehículo  como la compra de llantas nuevas, aceite de frenos. cambio de espejos retrovisores Etc.  Ya que en el futuro desea comprarse una camioneta nueva. Está ubicado en el centro de la fotografía
texts.en: Milber Raúl, 20, is married and has one minor son.  At present, he’s living in his parents’ house.  He works as a vehicle driver.  He transports merchandise in the wholesale market.  He is asking for the loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle like new tires, brake fluid and to replace the rearview mirrors, etc.  In the future he’d like to buy a new pickup truck.  He appears in the center of the photograph.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts and to service his car.

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Senderos está formado por 10 socias quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su clima frió, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde diciembre de 1999, cuenta con varios lugares turísticos, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía la que cautiva el paladar de quienes los visitan, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Las socias son señoras amables, gentiles y trabajadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Martha, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Paccha en Cuenca, tiene 29 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos hijos pequeños en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Martha labora como empleada domestica, esta actividad la que realiza hace 3 años, trabaja todo el día de lunes a viernes. En su casa cría y vende gallinas y cuyes, también tiene una pequeña tienda hace un año.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir compra gallinas y productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.

Su meta es  agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
The “Nuevos Senderos” (New Paths) communal bank has ten members living in various parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is noted for its cold climate.  It’s been a World Heritage Site since 1999.  It has many tourist attractions, a varied cuisine that captivates the palates of all who visit and its residents keep the culture and traditions of its peoples.  The members are kind, agreeable and hardworking; they carry out various activities that allow them to cover household expenses and support their families.

One of the members is Martha.  She lives in Paccha Parish in Cuenca.  She’s 29 years old, married and has had three children who are 12, 10 and 8 years old.  Her oldest son is in secondary school and the two little ones go to a local little elementary school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  The house she lives in is hers.

Martha’s works as a domestic employee; she’s had this job for three years and works all day Monday through Friday.  At home she raises chickens and guinea pigs and also has had a small store for the last year.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy chickens and basic staples to stock her store.  Her goal is to enlarge the store.

loans.use: to buy chickens and basic staple items.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Gabino le esta haciendo falta las escalera para los cuartos que esta construyendo en la planta alta de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el materia que es (Block, cemento, arena y barrilla), ya que el se encargar de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su empleo. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio y que tengo un mejor lugar donde vivir, los cuartos que esta construyendo serán las recamaras de sus dos hijos, necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
Don Gabino planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleado de un centro comercial, ya que su esposa la señora Bertha Alicia se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares, con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de elaboración y venta de platillos Mexicanos.
texts.en:
Gabino’s house needs a stairway up to the rooms he’s building on the second story of the house.  He’s asking for the loan just to buy building materials (concrete blocks, cement, sand and rebar) because he’ll do the work himself in his free time from work.

He wants to improve his assets and have a better place to live.  The rooms he’s building will be bedrooms for his two children who need their own space in the house.

Gabino plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns as an employee at a shopping center since his wife, Bertha Alicia, will take care of family and school expenses with the profits she earns in her business making and selling traditional Mexican food.

loans.use: to build a wall and a stairway up to the second story.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 25 años, es una mujer joven y muy trabajadora, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene tres hijos. Juntos habitan en casa de su suegra. El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de productos de belleza, ella hace pedidos para sus clientes y gana un porcentaje por cada cosmético. Paralelo a ello, se dedica tambien en la crianza de pollos, y cada 21 días, que es el tiempo promedio, sale a vender estos animales. Tiene un pequeño galpón en su casa y lleva recién ocho meses haciendo este trabajo sola. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo, además que le proporciona ganancias, por tanto espera intesificarse en este negocio y ampliar la cantidad de pollos que tiene. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de ustedes. Hasta el momento el grupo le ha dado una cálida bienvenida y la confianza para poder integrarse y convertirse en una socia buena. Con el monto solicitado, comprará cosméticos para tener en stock, además alimentos para pollo para seguir con la crianza de estos animales.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 25, is a hardworking young woman who lives with her husband, with whom she has three children.  They live together in her mother-in-law’s house. 

Rosa is engaged in the sale of beauty products.  She takes orders from her customers and earns a percentage of each sale.  Along with this, she is also involved with raising chickens.  On average, she sells the chickens she has raised every 21 days.  She has a small shed at her house and has spent 8 months doing this work.  She enjoys her work a lot, and it provides her with profits.  She hopes to enlarge this business and increase the number of chickens she has.  

This will be her first loan with MFP, which is why she hopes to have the support from you.  Until now, the group has given her a warm welcome and the confidence to be able to integrate herself and become a good member.  With the amount applied for she will buy beauty products in order to have them in stock.  She will also buy feed so that she can continue raising chickens.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed as well as cosmetics for her second business.

loans.name: Sector Los Olivos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sector los Olivos está formado por nueve socias y un socio quienes son personas trabajadoras, amables y solidarias ya que en el banco comunal se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante, trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten apoyar económicamente a sus familias. Viven por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia Turi de Cuenca, este lugar es considerado el balcón de la ciudad ya que desde allí se observa gran parte de la ciudad. Su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, son personas que mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Elvia, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su sobrina. Tiene 37 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 14, 9 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio y los dos últimos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es un profesional en la mecánica y laborando en su taller propio.

Doña Elvia se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y también cría animales pequeños como conejos, cuyes y chanchos a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de conejos, cuyes, chanchos y en alimento para animales.

Su meta es  criar más animales para la venta.
texts.en:
In Los Olivos Community Bank there are ten members, nine of them women, and one man. They are hardworking people, friendly and committed to helping each other get ahead. They have a variety of ways of earning a living so as to support their families financially. Their community is part of Cuenca’s Turi parish and has a view over a large part of the city. The local people have businesses, raise animals, or are famers. They are people who maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Sra Elvia is one of the members of this group. This is her first loan with the community bank; she was invited to join by her niece. Elvia is 37 years old, married, and has four children aged 16, 14, 9, and 7. The two oldest attend high school, and the two youngest go to a school in the city. Elvia’s husband is a trained mechanic and has his own workshop.

Elvia grows vegetables and also raises young animals such as rabbits, guinea pigs, and pigs which she sells whenever the family needs some money.

The loan will be used to buy rabbits, guinea pigs, pigs and food for them. Elvia’s goal is to raise more animals to sell.

loans.use: to buy rabbits, guinea pigs, pigs, and animal feed

loans.name: Todo Lo Puede En Cristo - Huancayo Group

texts.es: María Elena  D. 43 años D. edad casada, con un hija D. 14 años D. edad se caracteriza por ser muy alegre y ocurrente, ella es presidenta D. la Alcancía comunal “ TODO LO PUED. EN CRISTO”, elegida por ser carismática y tratable, ella tiene su bodeguita en su casa, el cual reparte a pedido D. sus clientes por su zona, ella usara el préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para su bodega y así satisfacer mejor los pedidos D. sus clientes, ella sueña con hacer crecer su negocio D. la bodega. Está ubicada en la segunda fila lado derecha con chompa negra y al lado D. ella esta su hija menor D. edad.
texts.en:
43-year old María Elena is married and has a 14-year old daughter. She is a lively and clever woman, and also the president of the Todo lo PueD. en Cristo Community Bank. She was chosen because she is charismatic and easy to get on with.

María Elena runs a small store out of her house and also delivers items to customers who live in her neighbourhood. She plans to use the loan money to buy more merchandise for her store so that she can better fulfill the requests of her customers. Her dream is to have a bigger business one day.

in the photo María Elena is second on the right wearing a black sweater. Her daughter is next to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy disposable items like plates and forks, and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres es un joven D. 24 años es casado y tiene 2 hijos, D. los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad D. vida. El y su esposa trabajan 10 horas diarias en una maquiladora D. L. ciudad que se encuentra a varios kilómetros lo que les lleva más tiempo. Al Joven Andrés es un beneficio por que es L. forma que paga su casa vía nomina, ya que es muy importante tener al corriente ya que será el patrimonio que le dará a sus pequeños. Pero para el, no es suficiente depender del ingreso D. L. maquiladora por tal motivo hace 4 años trabajo con su papa como ayudante D. soldador, para luego instalar su negocio en su propia casa y ser propietario D. esta manera el obtendría mayores ingresos. Aparte el quiere poner un negocio D. abarrotes en su casa en L. que atendería su esposa para que se queD. al cuidado D. sus pequeños. Para esto necesita comprar lácteos, refrescos, botanas, comida D. lata, sopas, jabón y mas.
texts.en: Andrés is a young man who is 24 years old.  He is married and has two children who he would like to offer a better quality of life.  He and his wife work 10 hours a day in a cross-border assembly plant in the town.  It is several kilometers away which adds time to their working day.  It is a benefit to young Andrés because he pays for his home through his wages.  It is very important for him to keep up to date with this as his home constitutes the assets that he will leave to his little ones.  However, for Andrés it is not enough to depend on the income from the assembly plant so, four years ago, he started working with his dad as an assistant welder.  He then set up his business in his own home and would make more income as the owner.  In addition, he would like to set up a grocery store in his home which his wife will work in so that she can also look after their children.  For this reason, he needs to buy dairy products, soft drinks, snacks, canned food, soups, soap, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to start a grocery store business

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por la comunidad de Sayausi en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado por montañas las mismas que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su clima es frió, su gente es amable y mantienen la  cultura y tradiciones de su pueblo, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades regresando a sus hogares en la noche.

Doña María tiene 53 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos de los que tres de ellos son casados e independientes, cuatro de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, tiene una casita propia pero en el campo y por su trabajo ahora vive arrendando.

La Señora. María se dedica a la cría de ganado y la leche que obtiene la vende, con este trabajo lleva 2 años, también se dedica a la venta de carne la cual obtiene del ganado que sacrifica. Otra de sus ocupaciones es la cría  de pollos, cuyes y chanchos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es ampliar más sus negocios y ponerse una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the El Arenal community bank in Sayausi, a neighborhood of Cuenca.  The city is surrounded by mountains, the outstanding feature of an already-beautiful countryside.  The climate is cold. The local people are friendly and committed to preserving their culture and traditions.  Most earn their livings from commerce, raising animals and farming.  Some work in the city and live in the country.

Our member, Dona Maria, 53, is married and has 8 children, three of whom are married and living away.  Four others work and help Maria with household expenses and the youngest is still in school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  They own a small house in the country, but they're renting in the city because that's where they work.  

Maria owns cows and sells their milk.  She has operated the business for 2 years.  She also butchers cows and sells their meat.  Along with cattle, she raises chickens, cuyes and pigs.  

Maria has been a member of the community bank for a year and she will use this loan to buy feed for her animals.

Her goals are to expand her animal business and open a corner shop.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her livestock business.

loans.name: Norah Esther

texts.es:
La señorita Norah Esther tiene 18 años y actualmente vive en Cochabamba en la zona sur, en una Zona conocida como Aziru marca. Ella es soltera y vive actualmente con su mama. 

Norah es productora de leche cruda, la cual después vende a una empresa que elabora diferentes productos lácteos. Norah se dedica a la producción de leche cruda hace mas de 2 años, en realidad ella se hace cargo también porque su mama ya es mayor de edad y no puede manejar el ganado lechero.

Norah solicita el crédito para poder comprar más vacas lecheras y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y poder agrandar el número de vacas de su madre. El mayor sueño de Norah es poder incrementar su producción de leche y sus ingresos de forma que pueda ayudar a su mama a vivir mejor y ella poder mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Srta. Norah, 18, now lives in an area of Cochabamba called Aziru Marca.  She is single and lives with her mother.  

Norah operates a dairy business.  She sells milk to buyers who use it to make different products.  She has worked at the business for 2 years and, in truth, she is in charge of the business because her mother is old and can't manage the cattle.  

Norah is applying for a loan to buy more milk cows.  She wants to grow the business her mother started and increase her earnings.  Norah's goal is to increase her milk production and, in turn, her income so that she can provide for her mother and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk cows for her dairy business.

loans.name: Rosa Hermelinda

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por la comunidad de San Joaquian en la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su clima es frió, su gente es amable y mantienen la  cultura y tradiciones de su pueblo, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades regresando a sus hogares en la noche.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 53 años, es casada y en su matrimonio ha concebido 7 hijos de los que cuatro son casados e independientes, sus hijos solteros son de 25, 18 y 17 años de edad, su hijo de 25 años trabaja y estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo es carpintero y labora en su negocio propio, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad. 

Doña Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, ella  siembra verduras y cría animales como  pollos y cerdos, sus productos son para su consumo y para la venta.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas y abono para continuar con sus cultivos.

Su meta es crecer en la cría de animales y tener más cultivos.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the El Arenal community bank in Sayausi, a neighborhood of Cuenca.  The city is surrounded by mountains, the outstanding feature of an already-beautiful countryside.  The climate is cold. The local people are friendly and committed to preserving their culture and traditions.  Most earn their livings from commerce, raising animals and farming.  Some work in the city and live in the country.

Our member, Dona Rosa, 53, is married and has 7 children, four of whom are married and living away.  Her other children are 25-, 18- and 17-years old, respectively.  Her 25-year old son works and goes to the local university.  Her two youngest children are still in high school.  Her husband is a carpenter and owns his own business.  They own the house where they live.  

Rosa makes a living growing vegetables and raising chickens and pigs.  She uses some of what she produces and sells the rest.

Rosa has borrowed from the community bank twice before and she will use this loan to buy sees and manure for her next vegetable crop.

Her goal is expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her vegetable-growing business.

loans.name: Ligia Elena

texts.es:
La Señorita Ligia es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por el sector de Medio Ejido en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió pero su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido, mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan. Esta ciudad es hermosa ya que es mezcla lo colonial y lo moderno, cuenta con varios lugares para visitar y admirar.

La Señorita. Ligia  tiene 20 años de edad, es madre soltera de un bebé de un mes de nacido, vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, sus padres son comerciantes, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Ella al igual que sus padres se dedica al comercio, vende variedad de artículos como gafas, correas, gorras, etc. lleva un año en el negocio y trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y fue invitada a la banca por su mamá, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como gorras, gafas, correas, etc. para tener más variedad.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio como un bazar.
texts.en:
Ligia is a member of the “El Arenal” (The Beach) communal bank.  She lives in the Medio Ejido sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate, but its people have a very warm heart.  They maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. The delicious cuisine captivates the palates of the locals and foreign visitors.  This city is beautiful because it is a mix of the colonial and the modern.  It has various places to visit and admire.

Ligia, age 20, is a single mother with a one month old baby.  She lives with her parents and shares the household expenses.  Her parents are merchants.  They do not have their own house; they rent where they live.  Like her parents, she is a merchant.  She sells a variety of items like glasses, belts, and hats, etc.  She has had the business for one year, and she works from Monday through Friday without a fixed schedule.

This is her second loan with her communal bank.  She was invited to join the bank by her mother.  She will use the new loan to buy merchandise like hats, glasses, and belts, etc. in order to have a greater variety.

Her goal is to have a business like a bazaar.

loans.use: to buy hats, glasses, and belts, etc.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is married and has three children. Jerry is 30 years old, residing in Segatic Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Jerry plants bananas and does buko (young coconut) vending to earn a living. He's been two years in this business. Each month, he earns PHP 15,000 doing this business. 

Jerry has been a member of GDMPC for a year. He requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase fertilizer. 

In the future, Jerry wants to expand his banana and buko business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Chreub

texts.en: Chreub is married with four children. She is a 41-year-old rice farmer and her husband is a construction worker. She has been a farmer for about 10 years. This is her first loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers for her rice field and for plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and sell for a good price, so that she can increase her income, save for her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 51 years old.  She is married and has 3 children. Jenny works very hard to provide for them.

Jenny runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

In the future, Jenny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 33 years old.  She is married and has 2 children. With both children in school, Eden works very hard to provide for them.

Eden runs a mobile vending business selling electrical supplies in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years.  Eden has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials to repair her vehicle and buy additional electrical supplies.

In the future, Eden would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: repair her vehicle and buy electrical supplies

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy, who is 58 years old, is a farmer and earns $2 per day. She lives with her sister. Soy is a single mother, but none of her children live at home with her, because they are all married and live with their own families. Every month, she has to spend $37 on food, $2 on electricity, $5 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses.

Soy would like to request a loan of $1200 to support her daughter’s career of selling groceries and food. The loan will help her daughter to have enough money to extend her career, and all payment is responded to by her daughter.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods and food for her daughter to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 64 years old, married, and has 10 children.  Juanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has done for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from a bakery and trisikad (pedicab) transport. 

Juanita is requesting a loan for 22,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more stock to sell.  Juanita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF. Juanita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 60 years old and is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Julia has an electronics repair business in the Philippines. Julia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more tools for her electronics repair services.

Julia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Julia would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more tools for her electronics repair services.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Saroeun, who is 55 years old, is a farmer and sells food. She earns $3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and earns $3 per day. They have two children; one is studying and the other is a worker who earns $3 per day. Every month, Saroeun has to spend $66 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $12 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike with a cart attachment for her husband to provide an additional transportation service so that he can make a better income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a cart attachment for her husband's career.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 65 years old and is married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Edwina is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock and feed.

Edwina has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and a welding shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and feed.

loans.name: Awen Indah Group

texts.en:
Awen Indah group received a second loan of Rp 13,500,000. Nothing has changed in the membership and composition of the board. The loan in this period is used to buy piglets and sows.

Ni Komang, head of the group, is using part of the loan to buy two piglets and the rest to fix the cage. She plans to keep sows and become a piglet seller. Currently, the price is quite expensive for piglets, Rp 450,000 per piglet. Ni Komang has a dream that this business will become a major source of family income.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and fix the cage

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Lorna has been in this business for five years.

Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
E. is 48 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

E. is in the agricultural business with a livestock retail business in the Philippines. E. requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

E. has been buying and selling livestock for three years now, and she has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, E. would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Ergie

texts.en:
Ergie is 24 years old and is married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ergie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ergie has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Luzviminda requests a loan of 1,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Luzviminda is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old. She is married and has 10 children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice-retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice-retailing business for 20 years and she also earns an income from a network marketing business.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Chhunlay

texts.en: Chhunlay is 39 years old. She plants and sells vegetables with her husband, earning $6 per day. She has four children; one is a worker who earns $2.50 per day, and the rest stay home because they are too young to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a pumping machine to water the vegetables that she plants with her husband. After the loan, she wants to plant more vegetables because the pumping machine will make it easier to water them.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine to water vegetables.

loans.name: Eva Marie

texts.en:
Eva Marie is 42 years old. She is married and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva Marie is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva Marie has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Houn is 41 years old. She plants and sells vegetables with her husband who earns $5 per day. They have four children: one is studying, two have their own careers and one more is only 3 years old. Every month, she has to spend $54 on food, $4 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her son for traveling to work. She wants to start planting vegetables to sell when her son’s career grows and she will help him.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son for traveling to work.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 29 years old. She is married with three children. With three children in school, Janice works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a charcoal and rice retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal and rice to sell.

Janice has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal and rice to sell.

loans.name: 04.10.08 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hà has a retail business selling food such as candy, cake, and milk. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to resell.

Hà is 46 years old and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the 10.8 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hà has been involved in her business for 3 years. The main harship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more food such as candy, cake, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Yory

texts.en: Yory, 45 years old, is a grocery and food seller who earns $8 per day. Her husband is a pig feeder and he buys wholesale cashews. He earns $9 per day. They have four children: one is studying and the other three are helping their father to buy and sell cashews. Every month, Yory has to spend $83 on food, $16 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1100 to buy wholesale cashews to resell. She wants to buy more kinds of grocery goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cashews to resell.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is 36 years old. She plants vegetables to sell with her husband, earning $6 per day. They have two children; one is studying and the other is working and earns $2.66 per day.

Every month, Lay has to spend $58 on food, $8 on school fee, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds to plant. She hopes that she can make good a profit from her vegetable plantation this year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 46 years old.  She is married and has 3 children who are in school.   She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilou has a business selling home products in the Philippines.  She has been in t his business for 7 years.  Marilou has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more home products to sell to her customers.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy more home products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sunneang

texts.en:
Sunneang, 42 years old, is a grocery and food seller who earns $6 per day. Her husband is motorbike taxi driver who earns $5 per day. They have five children who are all working, two work in the garment factory earning $5 per day.  

Every month, Sunneang has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $900 to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s business. She hopes to get a good profit from her grocery store and will expand her business.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for her husband's transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Navin

texts.en:
Navin is 53 years old.  She is a farmer and also sells cakes.  She earns $2 per day.  Navin is a single mother who lives with one daughter who is studying.  Her other children got married and live with their families.   

Every month, Navin has to spend $37 on food, $2.50 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $3 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy fabric for her daughter, who just got married, to make clothes to sell. She doesn’t want to change her career to do anything else because she only lives with one daughter and her income can support the family well.

loans.use: buy fabric to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Zineth

texts.en:
Zineth is 28 years old.  She is married and has 1 child. 

Zineth runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other miscellaneous items. Zineth has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Zineth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and has one child who is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a carenderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for a year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Jeanne has been in this business for 9 years. She also earns more income from food vending and charcoal and firewood retailing.

Jeanne has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and has 1 child.  Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Maricel has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maricel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
The group received Rp 15,000,000 for the loan and each member will receive Rp 1,500,000.

Jro Ayu is using the loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. Each of the superior piglets now is Rp 450,000. She will maintain the piglets for six months for fattening. She hopes the business will run well and she can earn enough profit at the end.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 55 years old.  She is married and has  7 children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and food vending.

Thelma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Angela works hard to support her family.  She has a banana retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Angela is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 12 years. She earns additional income from selling fermented seashells. Now requesting a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat, Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Marcy

texts.en:
Marcy is 41 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for 9 years and also earns an income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

Marcy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jaya Usaha Baluk Group

texts.en:
Although the group earns enough profit from the last loan, they still need a new loan for their businesses because they have a strong will to become a success at the pig business. The loan will be used to improve their businesses by buying superior piglets or sows.

Ni Nengah is using the loan to buy three superior piglets. She has a plan to raise them to become sows. She wants to become a piglet seller in her village. She hopes MUK and KIVA will always support her and the group, not only for the loan but also for the training.

loans.use: To buy three superior piglets

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 46-year-old lady and a widow. She is a mother of five children. As a widow, the welfare of those children entirely lies on her. She lives in Hoima, Uganda in a rented house. She is employed at one of the tea estates in her area. 

School fees in most schools have become high and most parents are finding it difficult to meet the cost without support of a credit facility. Rose is requesting for a loan to enable her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 45, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is a widow and mother of five children; three are studying, and the eldest is working while the youngest is still at home. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Elvira, who believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Elvira operates a food and barbeque stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals on evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands (food items) cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elvira dreams for her children to find a stable job after finishing college and also for her business to grow more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats and a cow for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats and cattle for sale at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru: Саидмурод житель района Яван. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Зарабатывает путем разведения мелко – рогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа овцы.
texts.en: Saidmurod lives in the Yavan district.  He is 57 years old, married and has six children.  He has a secondary education.  Saidmurod earns a living by breeding small livestock.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward wants a loan to buy more beers, sodas and water for selling at his pub. 

In addition to operating a pub, Edward also is into the saloon business so that he can make ends meet through the diversified sources of income. 

His desire is to start up a guest house in the near future, something he can achieve with the savings from his business ventures and some credit.

Currently, he says his major challenge in his pub business is the unreliable workers who seem not to take work seriously.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer, sodas and water for selling at his pub.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows and goats for sale at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Mrs. Ke is 68 years old and lives in the Baray district of Kampong Tom province, Cambodia. She earns a living by growing vegetable plants, but the profit is barely enough to cover her daily costs. She is a widow woman and a responsible mother of six children. Her elder son, Meas, also works hard to support the family, especially his young brothers and sisters who are in the age of studying.  He uses his buffalo to haul firewood for selling through the village and local markets of the province.

Ke would like to ask for some funds from Kiva, a longstanding partner of HKL, to buy a plot of land to grow more vegetable plants as well as rice crops. She tells us that this loan will help partially satisfy the family’s needs. She is grateful to all contributors to this fund, and she claims that she won’t be late to pay back to lenders.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to grow more vegetable plants as well as rice crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows for sale at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora, 44, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a single parent to a high school student. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to meet her family’s daily needs and expenses.

Flora operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and other foods cost less than raw food. 

Flora also retails electronic cell phone loads (prepaid cell phone credits) and operates a small variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 15, 000 that will help her continue her business.  She will be using the loan to buy raw meat, vegetables, and other products that will help her to meet the demands of her numerous customers. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s educational expenses.  

Flora dreams that her business will continue to grow. She wants her child to finish studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week, as it helps her to be stronger and closer to God with all the Bible studies being conducted. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 25-year-old single mother of two children, aged 2 and 4 years. She lives in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. She operates a produce business in which she sells maize and groundnuts. She has been in this business for four years.
