Anna started with meager capital but has now seen it grow in size, much to her happiness. She has no major hardships in her business. She is requesting a loan to buy maize and groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж пенсионер. Все тяжести семьи лежат на её плечах. Она кормит семью с помощью бизнеса откормом крупного рогатого скота, продажей молока. С детства она занималась уходом за скотом и поэтому она очень хорошо знает все тонкости этого вида бизнеса. Мунира хочет получить займ и приобрести несколько коров. Она надеется получить займ и далее расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Munira is married and has three children. Her husband is retired and all of the difficulties supporting a family fall onto her shoulders. Munira supports them by running a business of fattening large cattle and selling milk. She's been looking after cattle since her childhood and is very experienced. 
She's asking for a loan in order to purchase some cows. Munira hopes she'll receive the loan and will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a widow and takes care of three children. 

She wants a loan to buy a digital satellite television for her cinema business. This seems like a good business venture, as people like watching international football and other sports. In her area there are few venues to show such programs. 

Specioza currently sells spare bicycle parts and also runs a cinema. Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a digital satellite television for her cinema business.

loans.name: Kutbiddin

texts.ru: Кутбиддин житель района Яван. Возраст, 34 года. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Кутбиддин обеспечивает семью.  Он занимается торговлей женской одежды и обуви. Кредит берет для покупки зимней обуви.
texts.en: Kutbiddin lives in the Yavan district.  He is 34 years old, married and has four children.  His children attend a secondary school.  Kutbiddin provides for his family.  He is involved in selling women's clothing and shoes.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of winter shoes.

loans.use: to purchase winter shoes

loans.name: Benadeta

texts.en:
Benadeta is 42 years old and married. She has five children between the ages of 3 and 25 years.  She has three other dependents and her husband also earns some income for the family. She lives in a rented house in Hoima in western Uganda. 

Her business is growing and she is working hard to diversify so she can have multiple sources of income. She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy maize and cassava for resale.

loans.use: to purchase cassava and maize for resale.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and has been operating a retail shop for three years.The business has been profitable despite challenges in limited funds to meet the demands of his customers and dreams of constructing a hotel to enhance his cash inflow. Micheal wants a loan to buy tea leaves and cooking oil for sell.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves and cooking oil for sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats and cows to sell at his butcher shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 to 12 years and all are currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Rose has operated a rental house for the past 10 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Rose's other source of income includes side jobs operating a water kiosk and charcoal stand. Her highest monthly expenses are school fees, food, and electricity.

Rose will use the KES 100,000 loan to purchase cement, sand and plywood to construct another rental house. Rose aspires to buy more plots to build rental homes in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand and plywood to construct another rental house.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Cheam is a resident of Anlong Veng district, Siem Reap province, which is most well-known for the Angkor Wat temple. Cheam is now 57 years old, farming rice crops, vegetables, potatoes and soy beans on his own farmland. There is so much work to do on his farm that he cannot run this business well without any help from his family. His wife and his two children are the main forces to process this business smoothly. There are some challenges from insects and pests while his crops are growing.

He is applying for a loan in the sum of $500 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides which can protect and enable the fast growth of his crops. Cheam is planning to expand his farmland in the next few years and make more income through this business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 33-year-old married woman. She has six children – one boy and five girls, with ages ranging from 7 months to 15 years. Four of them are currently enrolled in school. Mwanajuma operates a food kiosk and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 13 years and was previously employed as a farmer. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expenses are school fees, food, and clothing. 

Mwanajuma will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil. Mwanajuma aspires to open another grocery business in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура замужем и у нее 3 детей. Она продает женские одежды в одном из местных рынков на протяжении более 20 лет. Ее уникальная возможность предоставить свой товар и удовлетворение потребностей клиентов являются сильными сторонами способствующее быстрому росту ее бизнеса. Тем не менее, Манзура считает, что ее бизнес только начинает расти, и до сих пор имеет большой потенциал для дальнейшего расширения. Она хотела бы открыть еще один точку для продажи своих товаров. Ее стратегия на данный момент заключается в увеличении разновидности товаров к предстоявшему зимнему сезону. Вот почему Манзура просит займ в размере $3000 долларов США.
texts.en: Manzura is married and has three children.  She has been selling women's clothing at one of the local markets for over 20 years.  Her unique ability to offer merchandise and satisfy customer demands are some of the strongest qualities conducive to the quick growth of her business.  Despite this, Manzura thinks that her business is just beginning to grow and still has a lot of potential for further growth.  She wants to open another retail outlet to sell her merchandise.  Her current strategy is to expand the variety of merchandise for the upcoming winter season.  This is why Manzura is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for the upcoming winter season

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азиза более пяти лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Азиза берет кредит для закупа коровы и теленка.
texts.en: Aziza has been involved in animal husbandry for over five years.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  Aziza is married and has five children.  Her husband is working abroad.  Aziza is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow and a calf.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 5 boys all under the age of 10 and her husband runs a rental house. Hadija sells hot meals from her home. She's worked in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transporting supplies from the market and her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and clothing.

Hadija will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil. Hadija aspires to operate her own rental houses in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 42 years of age, married, and has three children. Two of her children are still studying and the youngest is still an infant. Thelma works hard to support her family. 

She is engaged in a retail store business that she has been operating since 1998. She would like to maintain and to buy stock merchandise so that she can minimize her fare expenses in going to and from the market, but she doesn't have enough funds. 

In this regard, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of PHP15,000. With this requested loan amount she will be able to offer all her customers' demands. She believes that her effort and additional capital could really help her in realizing the goal she wants.

loans.use: to purchase stock merchandise for her retail store business.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is a married woman. She has six children – two boys and four girls – with one currently enrolled in school. Hasina has operated a food kiosk for the past 15 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Hasina’s highest monthly expenses are food, clothing, and school fees. 

Hasina will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase potatoes, rice, and beans. Hasina aspires to open an additional charcoal business in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en:
The Sari Makmur Group  and it's members received the same amount of loan as the last time.

Ni Komang is using this loan to buy three superior piglets. She decided to choose the superior quality piglets because she receives a high price when she sells them and it's easier to find a big buyer. She hopes the business can run smoothly and give her enough profit to support her life.

loans.use: To buy three superior piglets

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a responsible and kind parent. She is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She is thankful because her husband is also supporting her in managing their business.  Josephine has been operating her retail shop at the public market of Santiago. She has been running her business for almost 15 years. With the help of her husband, they are able to increase their profit. She hopes that her vending activity will be more profitable, allowing her to support her children until they finish their studies. 

One major challenge to Josephine is that she suffers from a shortage of income nowadays due to the increase in the prices of basic commodities. Another challenge is paying the allowance of her children and the house rent. 

For these reasons, Josephine would like to ask for an additional capital amount of PHP25,000, allowing her to buy a stock of bananas and spices for her retailing business. She hopes that she will obtain the loan amount in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bananas and spices for her retailing business.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат житель района Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Замужем. У нее 8 детей. Она зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области она 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух бычков, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Muhabbat lives in the Yavan district.  She is 30 years old, married and has eight children.  She earns a living by breeding cattle and has been involved in this business for 15 years.  Muhabbat is requesting this loan for the purchase of two bulls in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 24 years and also earns an income from fish vending. Mila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 43 years old and married with 2 children. With 2 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soft drinks, spices, etc. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.ru: Акбарали женат. Ему 55 лет. Его жена преподаватель. У них трое детей. Его старший сын находится в России. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Akbarali is 55 years old and married.  His wife is a teacher, and together they have three children.  Akbarali's oldest son is in Russia.  Akbarali earns a living by breeding cattle.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a widow with four children and all of them currently enrolled in school. Mwanamkuu operates a grocer business and sells her goods from home and door-to-door. She's worked in this business for four years and her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Mwanamkuu's other source of income includes family contributions. She describes her greatest business challenge to be reaching customers during the rainy season and her highest monthly expense is food.

Mwanamkuu will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more onions, potatoes and tomatoes. Mwanamkuu aspires to open her own grocery store in the future. She joined Yehu because they provide small loans that suit her needs.

loans.use: To buy more onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more onions, potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда занимается бизнесом купля продажей продуктов питания и детских игрушек. Ее место бизнеса расположено рядом с ее домом. Она этим видом бизнеса занимается уже более 5 лет. Учитывая многолетний опыт в данном бизнесе а также не имея сильной конкуренции в своем селе ее бизнес идет очень хорошо. Она запрашивает 5000 сомони для приобретения новых товаров для увеличения разновидности продаваемых товаров. Умеда благодарит всех за поддержку и обещает быть аккуратной с погашениями займа.
texts.en: Umeda is involved in a business of selling food products and children's toys.  Her place of business is located near her home.  Umeda has been in this business for over five years.  Considering her multi-year experience in this business and also having little competition in her village, Umeda's business is going very well.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 5000 somoni for the purchase of new merchandise in order to expand the selection of sold products.  Umeda thanks everyone for the support and promises to be diligent with the loan repayment.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise for resale

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with 4 young children and all of them are currently enrolled in school. Emily operates a grocery business and sells her goods from home and door-to-door. She's worked in this business for 5 years and her primary customers are households and institutions. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be reaching customers during the rainy season and her highest monthly expense is school fees. 

Emily will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more onions, carrots, tomatoes and other vegetables. Emily aspires to her own grocery store in the future. She joined Yehu because they provide small loans that suit her needs.

loans.use: To buy more onions, carrots, tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Mulya Sari Group

texts.en:
This is the second loan for the Mulya Sari group. For this new loan, they received Rp 18,000,000, an increase of Rp 3,000,000 from the last loan.
Ni Ketut received Rp 1,500,000, which she is using to purchase two piglets and feed. Ni Ketut has two children who are still in school. Her husband works as an entrepreneur. She hopes with the business, she can support her life, especially her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sunflowers and supplies for her side businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins needed for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy saws and screws.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal and order wood planks

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 45 years old and married with three children. To generate income, he works as a farmer in the Philippines, planting rice in their field. He can suffer with the heat of the sun, or the cold under the rain, just to take care of his crops in the field in order to feed his family.

He is proud to be a farmer. He has been running a rice field business for almost 21 years. Eduardo practices farming in order to provide the needs of his family. He has been getting farm supplies from the traders with a high interest rate. Now, Eduardo thinks that he can earn a higher income if he can find other lenders that will give him a minimal interest rate. 

He decided to borrow a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and insecticides to use in farming. The loan will be a big help for him to stop borrowing from the traders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Kiet

texts.en:
Mrs. Kiet, 45, is in the business of farming rice. It’s a kind of annual crop and she can generate an average of about $3.75 a day from this activity. She lives with her husband and 3 single children in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap. This couple cooperates to earn profits and raise their children, all of whom are studying in a local public school. 

Kiet is a wise mother who always educates and takes care of her children to pursue the right principle of living. She wants to sustain her children’s education and lift her family out of poverty. Thus, she would like to ask for some funds from Kiva’s lenders to buy some pigs for raising. She hopes this new business will provide her family a good profit.

loans.use: to buy some pigs for raising.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hard-working person and lives in San Jose, Baggao, Cagayan together with her family. She has four children. She is 47 years old and has been operating her business for almost three years. She offers sewing services. She sews school and office uniforms, curtains and pillow cases for the people in her community, especially school uniforms for students.

She is now asking for a loan of P35,000 to buy thread, needles and fabrics to use in her sewing workshop. She needs to improve her services to acquire more customers and earn more profits, too.

In the future, she wants to continuously send her children to school. She wants them to finish their education to seek good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and fabrics to use in her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Defina

texts.en:
Defina is 39 years old and married. Her spouse is a farmer who provides additional income. They have been blessed with five children, ages 14, 12, 10, 7, and 5. For the past 17 years, she has run a retail shop, which currently provides a monthly income of 28,000 KES.

She is borrowing a loan of 70,000 KES, which she intends to use to add inventory for her business: cooking oil, bags of sugar, maize flour, bathing soap, and crates of soda. With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees and to re-invest in her business.

This is her sixth loan. She successfully repaid her previous loans well. Her hopes and dreams are to give her children a better life and to build a home.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for his rental house

loans.name: Sari Ayu Group

texts.en:
The SA. Ayu group have received their new loan, but there’s a change in the group. In this second loan, two of the members resigned and started businesses with their own capital.

Ni Nengah, head of the group, will use this loan to purchase a sow. She has plans to sell the piglets to all the pig breeders in her village. She hopes the sow can breed a lot of piglets and than she can earn a lot of profit. Her profit will be used to buy a new sow and make a new cage.

loans.use: to purchase a sow

loans.name: Enimisia

texts.en:
Enimisia is 49 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Enimisia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Enimisia has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from banana retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 21 год. Живет вместе с родителями. Его мать занимается бизнесом, а отец находится в России. Сам Хусейн раньше помогал своей маме в торговле. Сейчас он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает ковры и одеяло. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для приобретения детских игрушек и одеял.
texts.en: Huseyn lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 21 years old and lives together with his parents.  His mother is involved in business, and his father is in Russia.  Huseyn previously helped his mother with retail sales.  Currently, he leases a retail outlet, where he sells rugs and blankets.  He has been in this business for two years.  Huseyn is requesting this loan for the purchase of children's toys and blankets.

loans.use: to purchase children's toys and blankets

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 57 and owns and manages a variety store in their village. She has four adult children and they are already married. She aims to improve her business and earns income to support her grandchildren and save for future emergencies. While managing the business, she also experiences problems and difficulties due to competitors and calamities. Through her faith and determination, she continues managing the business and she aims to make an improvement in it.

She is requesting an additional capital of P23,000 to buy soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She believes that this loan will help her to increase her product offering and satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes that she will make her business grow and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: 06.07.04 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ operates a food stall selling noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

Huệ is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 4 Đông Vệ solidarity group. Huệ lives with three dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to build a new house. She also hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make noodles

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has four children, all of whom are currently enrolled in school. Mwanamisi has run a stand selling juice and ice pops for the past six years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenges to be transportation and low demand during rainy seasons. Her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water.

Mwanamisi will use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase more flavors, sugar, and a sealing machine. Mwanamisi aspires to open her own juice parlor in the future. She joined Yehu because of the many small-scale loans they have available.

loans.use: To purchase more flavors, sugar, and a sealing machine.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalie works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending and motorcycle transport. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 51-year-old widow, working in selling men's, women's and children's underwear and sleeping suits since 2009, to make her own living. Hiyam insisted to improve her living since her husband passed away. She is a hard-working woman with a very good reputation. Her shop is attracting customers, since she presents her merchandise in a talented way. Hiyam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner "Al Majmoua" in order to increase her autumn/winter sleeping suit collection highly requested at this time from her customers. Hiyam  is experiencing micro credit for the first time and hopes that it will help in expanding her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To increase her autumn/winter collection

loans.name: 06.07.08 Đông Vệ Tp Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Điệp operates a food stall selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to process and sell. She is 29 years old and married with 2 children. Điệp is the group leader of the 08 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Điệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Điệp hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motobike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to process andsell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman with 2 children, both currently enrolled in school. Florence has operated a local café for the past 4 years and her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be fire outbreaks and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Florence will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase wheat flour, oil, salt and other cooking supplies for her cafe. Florence aspires to invest more in her business and eventually purchase a plot to build her own house. She joined Yehu because of the many small-scale loans they have available.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, oil, salt and other cooking supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Charito

texts.en:
Ma. Charito is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Charito has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for five years and also earns income from coconut wine retailing.

Ma. Charito aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, 39, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Roger, who is self-employed. She is a mother of five children, two are now in high school, one in elementary and two are not yet of school age. She’s doing business while attending to the needs of her family. This is her way of helping her husband with their daily expenses.

Ana owns a variety store selling groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also does some tailoring and repairs as an additional source of income. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community.  She earns 550 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 24,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more groceries that will accommodate the demands of her customers. She believes that having more display items will definitely attract more customers which means more profit. She will save her profit for the educational expenses of her children.  

Ana hopes that her variety store will soon become a full-scale grocery. She dreams all her children will be able to finish their studies and strives hard to meet the huge amount of their daily expenses. The weekly fellowship* allows her to understand the value of having time in reading and understanding God’s Word.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Letecia is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Letecia has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of used clothing to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 52 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Leonora has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling firewood.

Leonora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Sheirel

texts.en:
Sheirel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a Sari-sari (variety) Store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell.

Sheirel has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Rangua

texts.en:
Rangua is 28 years old married to Yiasi and together they are blessed with three school-going children. Rangua operates a motorcycle business and also an Agrovet (animal care) business at Kajiando. He has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES.10,000 per month.

He was introduced to KADET  LTD by KADET staff. He has a good credit history and is applying for his second loan of KES.60,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use KES.40,000 to expand the motocycle business, and the next KES.20,000 to expand his Agrovet and phone charging businesses. He will use the anticipated profit to open another Agrovet outlet at Bissil.

Rangua hopes to become the best transport provider along the Kajiando to Bissil road. He is very hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: To expand his motorcycle business as well as his Agrovet (animal care) and phone charging businesses.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow raising one small child on her own. She has run a salon for 3 years and her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Her biggest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Elizabeth will use the 40,000 KES loan to open a cosmetics shop. Elizabeth aspires to open another shop in the future. She joined Yehu because they invest in small businesses.

loans.use: to open a cosmetics shop

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma, 60, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Judencio, who works with her in the business, and is the mother of their children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Norma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Norma hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business

loans.name: Dino

texts.en:
Dino has been running a minivan business since 1999. Prior to engaging in this business, Dino used to work as a minivan driver for three years. Dino spent his savings to purchase two used minivans to help him generate income. Dino usually operates his minivan business from 6 am to 7 pm. He also employs someone to assist him driving the minivan. He parks the minivan in front of a building materials store seeking customers hauling building materials. Unfortunately, one of his minivans is damaged, and he cannot repair it because of the limited money that he has. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of  3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM to purchase spare parts, tires, etc. 

Dino is a 38-year-old man who is married to Mariana, a 32-year-old lady. They are blessed with five children; they are: Deby 14, studying in junior high school; Orland, 11; Nadia, 9 and Glenn, 6, studying in primary school; and Dede, 1 year old.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, tires, etc

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 47 years old, married to Joel and they are blessed with six children who are school-going.

Juliana operates a business of selling dressmaking materials to the ladies of Kathiani-Machakos, where there is potential for growth. She has been in this business for the last six months and gets an income of 6,000 KES per month.

Juliana is applying for her first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET Ltd., which she plans to use to buy kitenges cloth material (a traditional batiked cloth) to sell. She will use the extra profit to educate her children.

Juliana hopes to have a business that has expanded to a greater heights. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy kitenge material (traditional fabric) to sell to ladies.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Mrs. On is 41 years old and married with four children. One of her children has started a new family, living independently, while the other three are single and school-aged. She works as a farmer. She grows rice, potatoes and some seasonal crops that provide her a good profit in the marketplace. However, the main source of her income is from her husband, Mr. Kong, who acts as a liquor distiller as well as a pig raiser. The people in the community know very well that his liquor that is made hygienically and is of good quality. He has run these two businesses confidently for many years. He typically earns around 5 USD per day and works hard to support the family.

Mrs. On is a new client of HKL and this is her first loan with Kiva, which will enable her to sustain her husband's businesses and fix her present house partially. Mrs. On hopes that she’ll be able to expand the businesses more successfully in the future.

loans.use: to buy some pigs to raise, buy raw materials for a distilling business, and fix her house partially.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy  used her first loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale in her grocery business. She was able to sell them and it was very profitable.

This is her second loan and she plans to use the loan amount to boost her business by buying more fruits.

In the future, Lucy hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 29 years old, married to Elizabeth and together they are blessed with two children who go to school.

Elijah offers transport to the residents of Githurai 44 area and he also sells CDs. He has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of 15,000 KES per month. He is applying for his first loan of 16,500 KES from KADET Ltd. which he plans to use to purchase spare parts and expand the CD selling business. He will use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike.

Elijah hopes to own many motorbikes for hiring out, raise his family and educate his children. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and expand his CD selling business.

loans.name: Feninia

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Feninia is engaged in making candies and sells them on the school campus  and to their community. She is 43 years old and has two school-aged children. They need to increase their income to support the education of their children. She aims to improve her business and make it a viable source of income.

She aims to make and produce more of her products to sell to other communities. But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy flour, sugar, eggs, plastics and sticks needed in making candies. She mentioned that this loan will help a lot to work out her plan. She hopes that her patience and hard work will make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, plastics and sticks needed in making candies.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haidar is a 33-year-old married man and the father of three precious children.  Haidar is a hard working man.  He started working when he was 13 years old.  His 20 years of experience has given him a stable base to improve his business in a smart way.  Haidar's main goal is to provide his children with the best education; one he couldn't have because his parent's financial situation forced him to struggle in business in his early childhood.  He hopes to see them highly educated.  That is why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua.  He wants to pay for his children's primary school costs.  This is Haidar's forth cycle with Al Majmoua.  He is a good standing borrower with a very good reputation. Haidar hopes to improve his business in the future by opening a special facial department upon his customers requests.

loans.use: to pay for his children's primary school costs.

loans.name: Tengku Anita

texts.en: Tengku's business is a beauty salon and bridal shop. She is 53 years old and married with four children. Three of her children have already finished school and the youngest one is still in school. She has been in her business for 27 years. Starting from a hobby, now she has a lot of customers. She works out of her house. Her business is going well and she helps her husband send their children to school. The main challenge that she faces is not having enough capital to expand her business. With this loan, she wants to renovate her house and increase the space for her business. In the future, she hopes that she can extend her business by providing catering services.

loans.use: to buy materials to extend her business room

loans.name: Belandina

texts.en:
Belandina is a 54-year-old widow. Her husband passed away in an accident three years ago. She has six children from her marriage. They are: Seprianus, 30, studying at a university in another province; Noldi, 29; Sherly, 27 and Roby, 25 (the three of them are married); Noven, 21, graduated from senior high school; and Andre, 16, attending senior high school.

Belandina is taking over the responsibility for supporting her family and paying the educational fees for Noven and Andre. In order to cover their needs, Belandina sells gasoline and pop ice (a kind of instant cold drink with various flavors such as chocolate, melon, strawberry and blueberry). She displays her business products in front of her house. Even though her income is unstable – sometimes it is insufficient to cover their living – Belandina never gives up. She is working hard for her children. Luckily, two of her children, Seprianus and Sherly, often help by giving her some money. However, Belandina does not want to rely on them.

In order to add more stock for her business, Belandina is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. She would like to purchase more gasoline and pop ice. Belandina is hoping that the more stock she offers, the more income she generates.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline and pop ice.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is 46 years old and is married with 6 children. With 4 children in school, Zita works very hard to provide for them.

Zita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Zita has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, soap, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Zita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 36-year-old, married woman with four children. The oldest child is 15 years old.  Wilma's husband is a carpenter.

Wilma provides manicure and pedicure services to the people in her community.  She is happy that she has regular customers now.  Wilma is also an AVON dealer.  She works hard to support her family.  Wilma requested this loan to purchase cuticle remover, nail polish and other materials for manicures and pedicures.  Wilma hopes to have a stable business in the future. She hopes to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cuticle remover, nail polish and other materials for manicures and pedicures.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 25-year-old single man.  He has been the owner of an internet cafe for two years and has three years of experience in this field.  Most of his clients are villagers.  They enjoy spending their time in his shop since he is almost the same age and holds competitions on a certain game which increases enthusiasm among them.  Small children also come to play games suitable for their age, which he recommends to them.  Because such a business recommends a lot of new releases, Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy new PlayStations, game releases, computers and UPS necessary to back up information when the power cuts off suddenly.  Mohamad hopes to expand his business in the future by establishing several departments, each one directed at a certain age group to manage competitions and add new games based upon their requests.

loans.use: to buy PlayStations, games, computers and UPS for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Mr. Sour is a brave and polite man. He has spent most of his life to protect the country, working as a foot soldier. He sometimes takes missions and goes away from his lovely wife and children. He is married to a local farmer, Mrs. Phal (44 years old), and has 5 children. Most of his children are living with him in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. 

With the rainy season this year, Sour is concerned that he won’t be able to help his wife in farming because of the missions. Therefore, Sour is requesting for a loan from Kiva through HKL to hire laborers working on his farm. He says that he is thankful for all lenders who generously help his family that is in need.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: 06.07.02- Đông Vệ Tp Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Viên operates a food stall selling tofu. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell. Viên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Viên is the group leader of the 2 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Viên is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Viên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Viên has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Viên hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and improve the quality of her family life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is a 29-year-old married man with a one-year-old child. His wife, Damaris, works as a housewife. Rogers is currently employed, but hopes to open his own kiosk business. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water and his greatest monthly expense is food. 

Rogers will use the 10,000 KES loan to open a kiosk business and purchase inventory. Rogers aspires to open a retail shop in the future. He joined Yehu because they're responsive to clients' needs.

loans.use: to open a kiosk business and purchase inventory

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes aims to improve her family's status of living and give her children a bright future. She is engaged in a candymaking business to generate additional income. She is 53 years old and has three school-aged children. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, she sacrifices her time by making and selling candies on the school campus to finance the education of the children. She wants them to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy eggs, flour, sugar, sticks, and plastics needed in making candies. She believes that through this loan, she will make and produce more candies to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow and that it becomes viable of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, sugar, sticks, and plastics needed in making candies

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old and his wife, Rehema, is a homemaker. He has 3 children with 2 currently enrolled in school. Samuel has operated his own vegetable kiosk for one year. His primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be low demand during the rainy season and his highest monthly expenses are food and other household items. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Samuel will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase vegetables and potatoes to add to his inventory. Samuel aspires to open a second kiosk to reach a larger number of customers in the future. He joined Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and potatoes to add to his inventory

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 46-year-old divorced man, taking good care of his precious three children. Nabil is a hardworking man who devotes his whole life for his children's living and needs. 

For 6 years, Nabil has worked as a tattoo specialist. His work is mobile upon appointments organized by customers. His business location is at customers' residences. In addition to this highly talented business, Nabil works as a taxi driver to make sure his children's needs are well taken care of because he hates to feel that there might be something he can't afford them. He is a man with a very good reputation, recommended by most of his customers.

Nabil is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his children's primary school costs. This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing history. His previous loan reflected positively on both his social and financial situations.

He hopes to see his children in good positions in the future and to expand his business at the same time.

loans.use: to pay for his children's primary school costs

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is still a married man and a very hardworking farmer. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He is applying for his third loan, which he plans to buy a water pump and a pumping machine.

His monthly income is 7,800 KES, which has actually gone up slightly, but he still hopes that this loan he is taking will help him to improve on his agricultural activity and will give good returns in the future.

With the anticipated profit from the business, Eliud will buy more farmland. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level, buy a pick-up for transporting the bales which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and pumping machine

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kitsao is a 34-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 2 to 12 years and two are currently enrolled in school. His wife, Mwamahamisi, works as a vegetable seller. Kitsao has operated a vegetable kiosk for the past  two years. His primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be low demand during the rainy season and his highest monthly expenses are food and other household items. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kitsao will use the 20,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan to purchase vegetables, potatoes, and onions to add to his inventory. Kitsao aspires to open more kiosks in the future. He joined Yehu because they have many affordable loan products.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, potatoes, and onions to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Navruzchon

texts.ru: Наврузчон молодой перспективный студент. Он является студентом Института экономики Таджикистана. Он умный дальновидный жаждущий в поиске знаний парень. Он старается всегда пополнять свои знания. Он хочет получить займ для оплаты своего обучения. Надеется получить займ и заранее благодарить всех вас за вашу поддержку и понимание. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Navruzchon is a young, promising student.  He is a student at the Tajikistan Economics Institute.  He is a smart, forward-looking young man, who is thirsty in search of knowledge.  Navruzchon always tries to gain more knowledge.  He wants to obtain this loan to pay for his education.  He hopes to get this loan and thanks all of you in advance for your support and understanding.  Thank you very much!

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 27 years old and married to her husband Daniel. They are blessed with one child. Elizabeth is a tailor at Lukenya market, where most of her clients are females. She has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of 4,000 Kenya shillings (KES) per month.

Elizabeth was introduced to KADET LTD by another KADET customer. She is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, with which she plans to add more stock of clothes using the entire amount. She will use the anticipated profit to open another outlet at Kalusya market.

Elizabeth hopes to become a wholesaler of clothes at Lukenya. She is very hard-working.

loans.use: To add more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say, 39, is a married woman who resides in Ornlong Veng, Siem Reap province. She earns a living by operating 2 businesses: farming and owning a general store. She has been engaged in these businesses since 2007. Normally she earns a profit of $4USD a day to cover the household expenses and support her children’s education. She has 3 children who are living under her care and income. 

Say intends to expand and fix her house this year. With a Kiva loan in the sum of 4,000,000 KHR, she’ll use it to buy housing materials and also spend on payment for a laborer harvesting their rice. In the future, she plans to save money to expand her selling business and insure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to buy housing materials and also spend on payment for a laborer harvesting their rice.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 49 years old and a dairy farmer. His wife Mercy is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children, ages 8 and 11 years. He has been in the dairy farming business for the past ten years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan after repaying the previous loan successfully. John will use the loan to buy a bull and animal feeds. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will venture into pig farming. 

His hopes and dreams are to rear pigs in large amounts, to earn money to help educate his children and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy a bull and animal feed.

loans.name: Jacob Njoroge

texts.en:
Jacob used his second loan to employ another person and increased production and also met the demands at his work site. He repaid the loan well and in good time. 

This being his third loan, Jacob plans to buy another small land quarry.

In the future, he hopes to own a bigger parcel of land for his quarry business.

loans.use: To employ another person to increase production and meet customer demand.

loans.name: Alii

texts.en:
Alii is a 35-year-old married man. He has seven children, of whom two are currently enrolled in school. His wife, Mariam, runs a vegetable and fish kiosk. Alii has been employed for the past five years, although he wants to start a meat goat selling business. He states that his highest monthly expenses are food and other household items. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Alii will use the 20,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan to buy goats for his new business. Alii aspires to open his own fish stall in the future. He joined Yehu because they have many affordable loan products.

loans.use: To buy goats for his new business.

loans.name: Boboashur

texts.ru: Бобоашур женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка. На иждивении у него находятся родители и младший брат. Для содержания семьи он занимается откормом скота и бойни. Мясо продает сам на рынке. Ему помогает младший брат. Он  хочет получить займ для закупа скота для бойни. Он надеется получить займ и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Boboashur is married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He also support his parents and younger brother.  In order to provide for his family, Boboashur is involved in fattening up and slaughtering livestock.  He sells the meat at a market.  His younger brother helps him in this business.  Boboashur wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock for slaughter.  He hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for slaughter

loans.name: Vundu

texts.en:
Vundu is 41 years old and a livestock keeper. He and his wife Ann, a housewife, are blessed with eight children aged between 3 and 15 years. He has been rearing and selling livestock for the past eight years with the monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

Vundu is applying for his third loan term with KADET after successfully repaying the previous loans. Vundu will use the loan to buy goats to sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope is to buy some commercial land and build rental houses, which will help him cater to his family needs.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 29-year-old single man. James operates a vegetable kiosk and sells his goods at the market. His primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be low demand during the rainy season and his highest monthly expenses are food and other household items. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

James will use the 5,000 Kenya shilling (KES) loan to purchase vegetables in bulk. James aspires to see the business grow enough to open more stalls in the future. He joined Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 31 years old and a business man. He is single but supports his siblings. He has been selling vehicle spare parts for the past two years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. James will use the loan to buy wheels, oil, and spanners to add to his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand the business. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and be the main distributor around the area, which will help him pay school fees for his siblings.

loans.use: To buy wheels, oil, and spanners to add to his business.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 29 years old and single, and he does not support anybody in the family. He runs a butchery shop and he has been doing this business for six years. His current monthly income is 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES). He requests a loan of 20,000 KES, with which he intends to purchase more meat for sale.

He plans to buy a plot with the anticipated profit from the business.This is his third loan and he successfully paid his previous loans. His hopes and dreams are to purchase a plot.

loans.use: To add stock meat for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 47 years old and is an enterprising business man. He and his wife Mary, a house wife, are blessed with five children ages 18, 16, 14, 10 and 8 years. He has been selling plastic housewares for the past 11 years with the monthly income of 9,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

Joseph is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joseph will use the loan to buy plastic basins to add to his stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop, which will cater to the family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy plastic basins to add to his stock.

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Nansalmaa, age 52, sells building materials in the market called Bumbat. She has been running her business for three years and is always trying to expand it. Nansalmaa is a very hardworking woman for her family and life. She lives with her daughter and husband in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Already she has her own permanent customers and they are always satisfied with what they buy from her. Also she creates financial reports of her companies when she has days off. Now she needs some money to purchase a large number of building materials from her suppliers to increase her working capital. It is beneficial to her business activity and income.

loans.use: To purchase a large number of building materials from her suppliers to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Usmonzhon

texts.ru: Усмонжон  женат. Детей не имеет, жена домохозяйка. На иждивении имеет родителей. Он старается обеспечить в достатке свою семью.  Три года он занимается агробизнесом. Агробизнес приносит хорошие доходы, но и требует тщательного труда. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и бахчевых. Он выращивает арбузы, лук, чеснок, морковь. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений он надеется получить займ и подготовить землю к следующему посеву.
texts.en:
Usmonzhon is married. They have no children and his wife takes care of their house. His parents are dependent on him for support and Usmonzhon tries to provide fully for his whole family.
For three years he has worked as a farmer. It's a profitable business, but requires diligence and hard work. He grows various cultures including: watermelons, onions, garlic and carrots. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase some seeds and mineral fertilizers. He hopes to receive the loan and prepare his land prior to the next sowing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a single mother raising a 9-year-old child. Silvia operates a tea-leaves-selling business and sells her goods door-to-door. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as low demand during the rainy season. Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Silvia will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase tea leaves. Silvia aspires to continue growing her business and supporting her child. She joined Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 28 years old and is married with two children. His spouse is Sally who buys and sells vegetables in the nearby market, thus adding income to the family. Richard owns a retail shop, which has been in operation for a period of one year, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Richard has borrowed loans of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD for his second term loan after he successfully paid the previous one. He wishes to use this loan to purchase more stock of sugar, salt and tea leaves for sale.  

The profits will be used to repay back the loan and improve his business stock. His dream is to excel in business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, salt and tea leaves.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 33-year-old single woman. She has worked as a tailor since 2001. She used to work as a kindergarten teacher, but she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to improve her own business.

Her previous loan was very impressive since she didn't regret leaving her former school employers and was very proud of what she achieved. Zeinab is a hardworking woman. She has a very special reputation and is liked by most of her customers. 

Zeinab is requesting a loan for the second time from Al Majmoua in order to buy new textiles requested by her customers for the coming autumn and winter seasons.

Zeinab is proud of her business and hopes to expand it more in the future through buying extra tailoring machines and being capable of employing women to help in responding to all customer needs.

loans.use: to buy new requested textiles.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Mrs. Tuya, age 44, is a teacher. She has been working in this position for 25 years. She has two sons and two daughters. But now she lives only with her elder daughter in the Kherlen, a remote town of Mongolia. One of her sons runs his own business selling seabuckthorn juice. Lately his business has been running successfully and he has expanded his sales into the nearby towns or provinces. He needs a minivan for distribution and conveyance. Actually he started saving a year ago to buy his minivan, but there is a lack of money. He needs MNT 2100000 to reach the cost. Therefore, his lovely mother, Tuya, is requesting a loan to support her son to buy a minivan for this essential business necessity.

loans.use: to buy a minivan for her son's business.

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
Kenedy has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last seven years. Besides the transport business, he also practices farming. He is 34 years old and married to Shiphirah, they have one child. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to open green grocer a business for his wife. 

In the future, Kenedy hopes to buy another motorcycle for his transport.

loans.use: To open a business for his wife.

loans.name: Milia

texts.en:
Milia is 41 years old. He is married to Sista and they are blessed with three children who are school-going.

Milia is a livestock trader in the area of Bissil, where most of his clients are male. He has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Milia was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He has a good credit history with KADET, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the whole amount to purchase livestock. Milia will use the anticipated profit to purchase more livestock for sale.

Milia hopes to start a ranch. He is very visionary and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase livestock with the whole amount.

loans.name: Lkhagvadorj

texts.en: Lkhagvadorj, 43, a carpenter since 2006 with a steadily increasing clientele, resides with his wife and four children in the slum district of Erdenet, Mongolia's third largest city. Because of the increasing volume of his business, Lkhagvadorj wants to make some renovations to his workshop and purchase some new tools to better meet his customers' needs. His loan will be used for these purposes.

loans.use: to purchase some building materials to renovate his workshop and purchase some new carpentry tools.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira, 34, the treasurer of this group, is a widow raising two teenage children. Having started the business in 2005 with an investment of 5000 soms and the rental of land to sow potatoes and barley, Nazira now owns about 5 hectares of land upon which 4.5 hectares is allotted for wheat cultivation and the remainder for potato production, both crops in high demand. She earns a monthly average of 3000 soms and has been able to purchase all of the needed electrical appliances for her home.

As the end of this year’s farming season approaches, it is time for most farmers to sell their products and repay all debts involved with field work. Nazira plans to spend the loan on paying the tractor driver’s wage and buying fuel. 

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and to pay for the tractor driver’s services.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris has practiced farming in Naivasha for the last four years.  She is 44 years old and married to Daniel, with two school-aged children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by existing clients. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more milk from farmers for resale.

In the future, Damaris hopes to become the top dairy milk and milk product supplier in the Naivasha area.

loans.use: to buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en:
Lizzy is a widow who has raised six grown children. Lizzy operates a coconut and plastic utensil business. She sells her goods from home. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Lizzy's other source of income includes earnings from her adult children. She describes her greatest business challenge as the low demand during the rainy season. Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water.

Lizzy will use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase more coconuts. Lizzy aspires to continue growing her business and supporting her family in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts.

loans.name: Enkhsukh

texts.en:
Enkhsukh is a 22-year-old auto designer. He lives with his daughter and wife in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent located in the Ger district of Mongolia, the capital city of Mongolia. Enkhsukh is very hardworking young man who is trying to build his life.

Recently, he decided to start a taxi business and expects his designer job to allow him to save more money to buy an apartment. He needs 2,000,000 MNT to buy a car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy his a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Sant Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 16 AVRIL 2003. Il  est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Aissatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de couscous, de l'huile de palme et de la patte d'arachide. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on April 16, 2003. It is made up of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is small-scale commerce. 

Madame Aissatou who is on the right in the photo raising her hand is the leader of the group. She is 65. She is married and the mother of 10 children. She is also responsible for three other children whom relatives have confided to her care. 

She sells couscous, palm oil, and peanut butter. She has a good deal of experience in this business which she has been in for several years. 

This loan will permit her to grow her working capital and better develop her business. The profit will permit her to improve family living conditions (health, food, and clothing, etc.) and to add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet, palm oil, and peanut butter.

loans.name: Djissoff Litt Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de treize femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Adama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 68 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 28, 2001. It is made up of 13 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is commerce. 

Madame Adama who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 68 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She is also raising two other children confided to her by her relatives. 

She sells vegetables. She has a good deal of experience in this business since she has been in it for several years. This loan will permit her to grow her working capital and better develop her activity. 

The profit will permit her to improve living conditions for her family (health, food, clothing, etc.) and add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Khadidiatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 66 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 13 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge une partie de sa belle famille.

Elle s’active dans la vente de cacahouette. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité,qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront de rembourser ses prets et d'épargner.
texts.en:
This cooperative group was created on May 28, 2001.  It is made up of eleven women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their primary activity is sales.

Mrs. Khadidiatou, at right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group leader.  She is 66 years old, married, and the mother of 13 children.  She is also responsible for some of her in-laws.  She sells peanuts and has several years of experience in the business.

This loan will allow Mrs. Khadidiatou to increase her capital and better develop her business.  The profits will allow her to repay her loans and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de treize femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Sona qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge la famille da sa coépouse.

Elle s’active dans la vente de bouillie et de légume. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on May 28, 2001. It consists of thirteen women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is commerce. 

Madame Sona is on the right of the photo raising her hand and is the leader of the group. She is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. She also takes care of her co-spouse's family. 

She is active in the sale of porridge and vegetables. She has good experience in this area of business which she has practiced for several years. 

This loan will permit her to build her capital and to better develop her business. 

The profits will permit her to improve the living conditions of her family (health, food, clothing etc...) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet and vegetables

loans.name: Azatkul

texts.en:
Azatkul is 43 years old. For twenty four years, she has lived in a small community of 2,000 residents, in Ananyevo village on the Northern shore of lake Issyk Kul. Being brought up in a family of cattle breeders, she married a farmer and gave birth to four children, two of whom are still financially dependent on their parents. 

Azatkul is used to working hard. She believes it’s the only way to reach success. She works daily on her small land in order to move forward together with her family. Recently she has gathered a rich harvest of pears, apples and potatoes and is looking forward to selling them to local retailers. Her favorite part of the business is having the ability to try new types of cultivation of fruits and vegetables, depending on the consumer’s shifts in taste and demand. Like any farmer, her biggest fear is adverse weather conditions. Azatkul earns 3,000 soms monthly and has applied for this loan in order to try cattle breeding. She hopes to use the loan for the purchase of a bull for further breeding and reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
