loans.use: to purchase a bull for breeding.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro has been a farmer for almost 32 years, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. He is 50 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Since farming is the only source of their living, he works hard and endures hardships to feed his family and support the education of his children. He aims to improve their status of living because he wants to give his family a better life. He wants to educate all his children because he wants them to find a good job someday. 

He wants to plant and produce more vegetables to sell, but he does not have enough capital, therefore, he is asking for an additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides needed in vegetable production. He believes that this loan will be helpful to him to increase his vegetable production.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Jappo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Seynabou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un autre enfant confié par son frére.

Elle s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on May 28, 2001. It consists of 14 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is commerce. 

Madame Seynabou, who is on the right of the photo raising the hand, is the leader of the group. She is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. She also has another child in her care entrusted by her brother. 

She is active in the sale of breakfast. She has good experience in this field of activity, which she has practiced for several years. 

This loan would permit her to build her capital and to better develop her business. 

The profits will permit her to improve the quality of live for her family (health, food, clothing etc....) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy diverse products

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has 5 children, with 1 currently enrolled in school. Her husband, Kombo, works as a businessman. For the past 3 years, Eunice has run her own shop selling water and poultry. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Eunice's other source of income includes earnings from her husband and her adult children. She describes her greatest business challenge to be low demand during the rainy season and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Eunice will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cereals and other goods. Eunice aspires to expand into several businesses in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and other goods.

loans.name: Tobokel's Group

texts.en:
Tobokel, 65, is a leader of this group. She is the proud mother of four grown children. Despite her age, Tobokel remains one of the most active, energetic and motivated farmers in the community of Tup village. 

In her lifetime, Tobokel has achieved many accomplishments, the most significant of which is building the largest household with land, generous for crops, and tens of heads of livestock. Tobokel, together with her husband and one of daughters, is currently gathering crops. She looks forward to selling the harvest at a good deal. Household chores and crop gathering make up her entire day. She is considered to be quite experienced in the financial management of her business, therefore, she  believes in repaying the loan on time, with no violations. The purpose of the loan is to buy livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran is 59 years old with six children. She is a rice farmer and she is also a teacher. She has been farming on her farmland for 19 years. 

Saran has been with VisionFund since 2010. She requested a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield to have more income for her family, so that she can have some savings and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Bat-Orgil

texts.en:
Mr.Bat-Orgil is 38 years old and lives with his family in Darkhan, the second biggest city in the country of Mongolia. His wife owns a small grocery shop in the family yard. She has been doing this business for more than 7 years and is very experienced in this sector. Bat-Orgil’s eldest son is in the Army and will be demobilized from it next year. 

Bat-Orgil owns a car, which he uses for his taxi business. He says it is very good earnings. Unfortunately, his car is out of date and he wants to renew his vehicle. He has just purchased a new car for 6,000,000 tugrik and he has paid off 4,000,000 tugrik. Now, he is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrik loan to finish his car payments.

loans.use: to finish his car payment.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола замужем имеет троих детей. Муж работает водителем. Лола занимается продажей и сушкой сухофруктов. Содержать семью в достатке требует больших усилий.  Полученные доходы идут на образование и содержание детей. Она хочет получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса. Она хочет закупить по оптовым ценам сухофрукты и зимой перепродавать их. Она надеется получить займ и заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и поощрение.
texts.en: Lola is married and has three children.  Her husband works as a driver.  Lola is involved in selling and drying dried fruits.  Providing plenitude for her family requires a lot of effort.  Income, resulting from the business, goes toward education and support for her children.  Lola wants to obtain this loan to expand her business.  She wants to buy dried fruits at wholesale prices and resell them in the winter.  She hopes to receive this loan and thanks you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en:
Lhagvajav is 27 years old. He lives with his wife, son and step-daughter. He fell in love with a woman who is eight years older than he is. He moved to Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia) from the countryside in 2005. He has worked as a massager in a traditional bone-setting hospital. He was doing the job for three years. However, the salary was not enough for his and his family's needs. He decided to quit his job and started his own taxi business. His business is growing well, and the income is increasing lately. He said it is more profitable than the fixed salary. He is a very hardworking and honest person who always cares for his family.  

His wife used to run a small clothing shop, but she closed it due to the pregnancy. Now, she wishes to continue her business. Lhagvajav is requesting a loan to purchase inventory for his wife’s clothing shop.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his wife’s clothing shop.

loans.name: Urumbek's Group

texts.en:
Urumbek, 47, is a member of this group. He is a  construction worker and his wife is a housekeeper. They are raising a son and a daughter. Urumbek owns land which he received in 1996 in his village of Tyup. Every spring he plants various types of vegetables, grains and fruits. This autumn has gifted all local farmers a rich harvest with plenty of sun and water. Currently Urumbek, with the assistance of his son, is gathering all his crops. 

He plans to sell some part of it now, and to save the rest for spring. The later sale will bring him a lot of extra income. The proof of financial success was a purchase of a long-waited automobile, which has made the transportation of products easier. 

A monthly income from harvest is 5 000 soms. Urumbek earns a supplementary income by working in various types of construction. The purpose of his loan is a purchase of seeds of a rare type of potatoes for spring, because the price of the seeds is lower in the fall. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa is 35 years old and the father of three children. He lives with his wife and three children in Mongolian nomadic tent on his own land which he recently purchased. He is a very honest and helpful person. He has been servicing cars for more than 15 years. He has plenty of experience in this sector. His car service shop is located in a very busy street, thus it is more profitable.
 
He is seeking to buy old cars and fix them to sell them at higher prices. He is requesting a loan to purchase old cars to start his new business.

loans.use: To purchase old cars to start his new business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old and married to Elizabeth.  They have four children aged 14,12, 9 and 2.  Peter buys tea leaves from the local suppliers and sells them to the main tea factory.  He has been in operation for a period of four years earning a monthly income of KES.10,000.

He wishes to borrow KES.60,000 from KADET LTD. This is his second loan. He repaid the previous loan successfully.  He hopes to use the money to improve the quantity of the tea he purchases from the farmers and increase the number of bags. The increased profit will be used to repay the loan as well as for his family's welfare.

His dream is to improve his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To pay the suppliers of tea leaves

loans.name: Dashtsermaa

texts.en: Dashtsermaa is requesting a loan to purchase livestock for her parents and also to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and purchase livestock for her parents

loans.name: Ajarkul's Group

texts.en:
Ajarkul, 50, is the leader of this group. She has been working as a nurse in a local hospital for the major part of her life. For the past five years, since her husband’s death, Ajarkul and her oldest son are also raising and reselling cattle. 

She has always seen the high potential of raising livestock in the village of Kyzyl Suu in Issyk Kul province due to its highland pastures. The fresh air and favorable climate create nice living conditions for local livestock. Earning 3000 soms a month assists her with covering major expenses for her youngest son who is a third grade student. 

The expansive household of Ajarkul has attracted a lot of attention from local and foreign wholesale dealers. The process of reselling is intensive this current season and Ajarkul is busy with buying young calves and sending them to pasture. The short term goal is to buy several more young livestock for further fattening and reselling. She is hopeful of future success of her business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ayina

texts.en: Ayina is a 41-year-old single parent. She is living with her children: Elkins, 21, working; Viktomi, 17, only graduated from junior high school; and Via, 16, studying at nursery school. Ayina owns a kiosk business. It is located in a traditional market. She is selling basic needs stock: some vegetables such as spinach, carrots, kangkung (a kind of leafy vegetable), beans, etc., and she rents a coconut grater machine. Ayina usually wakes up at 3 am to buy fresh vegetables at the Oeba market to sell at her kiosk. She operates her business from 5 am to 7 pm. As a single parent as well as the breadwinner, Ayina struggles to meet her family’s needs as well as her children’s educational fees; therefore, she is requesting a loan from TLM for 7,500,000 Indonesian rupiah. She wants to purchase additional stock for her kiosk such as rice, sugar, wheat flour, eggs, cooking spices, etc. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her kiosk such as rice, sugar, wheat flour, eggs, cooking spices, etc

loans.name: Izatbibi

texts.ru: Изатбиби замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Муж работает учителем. В регионе, где живет Иззатбиби, основным видом деятельности является сушка фруктов и продажа сухофруктов. Продажа от сухофруктов приносит немалые доходы. Она занимается этим видом бизнеса 10 лет. Она хочет получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса и увеличить свой товарооборот. Она надеется получить займ и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Izatbibi is married and has two children.  Her husband works as a teacher.  In the region, where Izatbibi lives, drying and selling dried fruits is the primary type of business activity.  Sales of dried fruits brings in good earnings.  Izatbibi has been involved in this business for 10 years.  She wants to obtain this loan to expand her business and increase turnover.  She hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase turnover

loans.name: Duishokan's Group

texts.en:
The village of Kyzyl Suu is located on the southern shore of Lake Issyk Kul and is home to 15,000 people, most of whom make a living by farming, fishing, livestock breeding and tourism. Duishokan and her family have lived here for more than a decade. She has one son and earns a living as a farmer who cultivates a wide variety of crops. Today, she grows mostly potatoes because demand for them in Central Asia is quite high. By applying new technology, she manages to grow more potatoes every year, and this has allowed her to buy new furniture for her house. She earns about 2,000 soms a month and supplements her income by raising livestock. She is applying for this loan to buy fuel, lubricants and hay to feed to her livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy fuel, lubricants and hay to feed to her livestock.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet has benefited from her previous loan from Faulu Kenya because she was able to grow her business. She has also improved her living standards. Her desire is to fully establish her business. She has requested another loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy stones for quarrying.

loans.use: to buy stones for quarrying

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en:
Tsend-Ayush is 27 years old and lives with her husband and four-year-old son. They live in a small house that is in bad condition. She is a loyal client to Credit Mongol and always pays back her loan on time. His husband works as a carpenter at a local shelter.

She was employed as a seller at a supermarket before her current job, which is as a sales manager at a book store. As mentioned earlier, her house is very old and so is the furniture. She is a very caring mother and wife. She is requesting a loan to renew some furniture in her house in order to have healthier and better living conditions.

loans.use: To renew some furniture in her house in order to have healthier and better living conditions.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is in school. Madina has a business of a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Madina sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Madina has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of creams, braids, and hair shampoo. The main business challenges for Madina include theives and the ever increasing prices of braids. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and to own a fully stocked salon. Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and hair shampoo.

loans.name: Denson

texts.en:
Denzon is a responsible father who raised his family in a village. He is 47 and has five school-age children. Farming is the major source of his income; he plants fruits and vegetables for sale. His ambition in life is to improve his family's status of living and provide education for all his children. Despite the hardships of life, he has the strong determination to achieve his goals.

He aims to increase his production of vegetables to increase his income. Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production. He hopes that his loan will help a lot to increase his yields.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Hendrik

texts.en:
Hendrik, a 49-year-old man, is married to Maria, 42 years old. They have nine children namely: Lexi, 23; Mega, 17, who has had autism since she was a child; Noprianus,16; Jeki,14; Eben,12; Fernando,10; and Boni,8. All of them are  attending school.The youngest is Joshua, 4.

Hendrik has a rented house business; he has been running the business for 6 years. He spent his savings and the loans received from TLM (he has been a member of TLM’s Group Lending Program for 2 loan cycles) to build seven rooms to rent. He plans to repair the doors and the windows of each room, therefore he is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000. He is expecting that TLM will approve his application.

loans.use: to repair the doors and the windows of each room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of tea leaves from the farmers for resale.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly, 33, is diligent and a good mother of two school-age children. She lives with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom. She helps her husband to earn a living by raising some pigs behind her house. She works tirelessly in order to raise and encourage her children for a brighter future. She said that she doesn’t want her children to do farming or become pig raisers as she has; she wishes to see them have well-paid jobs after they graduate from the university. 

Ly's husband Mr. Him works as a firewood seller. He uses an old buffalo to haul the firewood for selling through the commune and the market of the province. The family’s main income depends on Ly’s husband’s business, with which he can yield around $5.50 USD per day.

Mrs. Ly is now applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva for 4,000,000 Cambodia riels (KHR) to purchase an additional buffalo to support her husband's business. She is thankful and confident that she will pay her loan back to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional buffalo to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has operated in the transport industry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 3 years. He is 59 years old and married to his wife Esther. They have two school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. Besides his transport business, Francis also operates a second-hand clothing business. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of clothes to sell and also to boost his transport business. 

In the future, Francis hopes to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To boost his transport business and to add more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 46-year-old lady, married to Ignatius, a 59-year-old man. They have five children: Mince, 28; Meri, 26; Diana, 24, all married;  Petrus, 19, graduated from Senior High School and Nikson, 12, studying at Elementary School.

Regina has been running a kiosk business for three years. Even though this business is categorized as a small business, the income generated enables her to help her husband in covering their family needs. She sells daily basic needs such as rice, sugar, coffee, tea, eggs, biscuits, instant noodles, snacks and soft drinks as well. She usually operates the business from early morning. 

Currently, Regina dreams of improving her income. She is thinking to purchase a display window and to add more stock, i.e., rice, snacks and cigarettes, etc. and to sell mobile phone recharges as well. She is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000. She hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase a display window and to add more stock, i.e., rice, snacks and cigarettes, etc. and to sell mobile phone recharges as well.

loans.name: Zaripa's Group

texts.en:
Zaripa, 34, is the leader of this group. She is married with three young children and is involved in livestock breeding and retail of milk products, while her husband, along with thousands of fellow countrymen, is abroad in search of a better source of income. 

Zaripa devotes all her time to taking care of her  livestock by taking it to pastures early in the morning, and watering and feeding it throughout the day. She seeks much support from her mother in taking care of the children while Zaripa is at work. Currently she owns a cow and calf and is actively involved in generating milk worth 200 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) per day. The target customers are small grocery stores located nearby and confectioner’s shops. In fact, Zaripa’s business is a continuation of long-cherished family heritage of livestock that is highly valued in local culture.

Her monthly income is 3,000 soms, with the additional income of 10,000 soms received by her husband, which has helped to make house improvements like renewing all rooms. Zaripa hopes to further develop her business successfully with the help of this loan from Kiva lenders, which she plans to spend on a purchase of food for livestock.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Munkhsanaa

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhsanaa, 31, is a plumber and taxi driver. He has been working as a plumber since 2005 and also runs a taxi service when he has days off because his salary as a plumber does not meet his family's needs. There are three people in his family, including his daughter and wife. They live in a ger (a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent) located in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. 

Last February, he started building a new house on his land, but it is still not finished in due to the lack of money for purchasing some necessary building materials. The building is approximately 70% complete, especially the wall insulation materials such as tapestry bricks, bead and steam-heated floor. Adding insulation to the walls is important to reduce the harm from coal fuel use. Otherwise he will use the electric-heating system in his house instead of the coal used chimney. According his plan, he will finish his house building before this winter if possible.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary building materials to add insulation to his house.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 38 years old and is married with five children aged between 1 and 10 years old. Venuste owns a business selling various produts like soap, sugar, rice, and cooking oil. This is his second successful year in this business and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day except on Saturday. He currently employs three people to help him. 

Venuste has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products like cooking oil, sugar, rice, and soap to sell. With additional profits, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more products like cooking oil, sugar, rice, and soap.

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyz, 50, is the leader of this group. She resides in a southern small town of Uzgen with her husband and three children. Jyldyz’s husband is employed as a cab driver and earns up to 6,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) per month, while her oldest son is making a living working in Russia and invests about 10,000 soms in the family budget per month. Jyldyz wants her children to be educated and pursue great careers, so she makes her best to invest as much as possible in their development. 

Jyldyz is currently cultivating and retailing agricultural products like sunflower and corn. The market demand for them is quite high this year, so she receives up to 15,000 soms of profit monthly. She’s already managed to buy electrical supplies for the house and is applying for a loan from Kiva in order to buy sheep for further fattening and reselling. Her biggest wish for the future is to buy a good land and build the house of her dreams.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock for his shop.

loans.name: Roselida

texts.en:
Roselida is 35 years old, and married with four children. To earn a living, she runs a salon. She has been in the business for almost two years. She also sells shoes to earn extra income. Previously, she sold clothes. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access business loans and save money. This has helped her to boost her business.

Roselida hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy hair weaves and hair treatment.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves and hair treatment.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.ru: Хуршеда замужем имеет троих детей. Муж столяр. Для содержания семьи она занимается сушкой фруктов. Сухофрукты очень востребованы их закупают оптом для продажи в Российской Федерации. Прибыль, который она получила от данного бизнеса, она отремонтировала свой дом, а теперь она хотела бы получить займ для расширения бизнеса и пополнения товарооборота. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Khursheda is married and has three children.  Her husband is a carpenter.  In order to support her family, Khursheda is involved in drying fruits.  Dried fruits are in very high demand and bought wholesale for resale in the Russian Federation.  She used the profit that she made from this business to make repairs to her house and now wants to obtain a loan to expand her business and increase turnover.  Khursheda thanks you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase turnover

loans.name: Mirlanbek's Group

texts.en:
Mirlanbek, 40, is a member of this group. He lives with his wife and four children in a village of Kerben, in the Jalal Abad province of Kyrgyzstan. This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock and trade. 

For the past five years, Mirlanbek’s been running a small business of livestock breeding and reselling. The whole family supports this initiative and assists him in taking care of livestock. The pasture is located close to his house and it makes the care more convenient and safe. After spending the whole summer in pastures, the livestock is in good shape. Mirlanbek hopes to sell it on a good deal, cover all his expenses and improve his family’s quality of life. 

He requests a loan for the purchase of more livestock for further fattening and reselling. He believes his earnings will cover his loan and domestic financial obligations. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is single and blessed with two children. She has been selling clothes for the last 14 years to make a living. She describes her business to be busy because her potential customers are passersby. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy shirts and ties for resale. Beatrice expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.

loans.use: To buy shirts and ties.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
The name of Ainura, 39, of Kerben village in the Jalal-Abad province of Kyrgyzstan, is well-known as a most successful progressive farmer of the district. Untiring efforts, strong management skills and patience helped her to attain this status. Being born in a typical farming family, Ainura used to help her father in land cultivation and cattle breeding. 

Ten years ago, she took full control of livestock left as a family heritage and since then has never looked back. 

Ainura invested 15,000 KGS in a purchase of young calves. Step by step she expanded her activities with expected returns and soon saw good economic gains from cattle reselling. Today she is a proud owner of one of the largest households in the district. 

Ainura’s next step in business promotion is dairy. She plans to distribute the generated milk products to local customers. Ainura hopes that the loan from Kiva lenders will allow her buy her first cow for the new business start-up. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty lives in Uganda with her husband and four children, one of whom is old enough to attend school. She also cares for her parents and her late sister's children. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she works seven days a week. Resty is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more items to sell to her customers, including soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil. She supplements the income she earns in her shop by selling second-hand clothing and shoes. Her main challenges are rising prices, slow business during the rainy season and the high cost of transportation. Her goals for the future include owning a wholesale shop and a delivery van. She owns the home she lives in and has access to electricity and piped-in water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en:
Liliane is 30 years old and is married with two child who are 7 and 8 years old. She has owned a small boutique (store) selling soap, sugar, books, pens etc. for the past of 3 years. Her business is well-organized and she works from 6am until 6pm every day, except Saturdays.

Liliane has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more soap, bread, juice, cooking oil, and others. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, bread, juice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is single and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been operating a laundry business for the last eight years to make a living. Previously, she was selling polythene papers. She has employed two people to help her to manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Eunice is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cleaning (washing) machine.

loans.use: To buy a cleaning (washing) machine

loans.name: Khayridin

texts.ru: Хайридин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет 8 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается скотоводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Khayridin lives in the Yavan district.  He is 36 years old, married and has eight children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock for future sale.  Khayridin is requesting this loan for the purchase of bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Более 16 она занимается откормом скота и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном Барно выращивает пшеницу, лук и кукурузу. Барно хочет расширить свой бизнес с целью получения желаемой прибыли. Барно хотела бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота и семена лука.
texts.en: Barno is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She is a smart and hardworking woman.  She has been involved in fattening up livestock and growing agricultural crops for over 16 years.  Barno primarily grows wheat, onions and corn.  She wants to expand her business in order to make a desired profit.  Barno wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of cattle and onion seeds.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and onion seeds

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Uganda with her husband and four children, one of whom is in school. For the last for years, she has earned a living by selling bananas.  She works every day, selling her products in a local market, and is applying for a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. She supplements her income by renting out properties. Her main challenges are the rising cost of bananas and the high cost of transportation. Her goals for the future are to own a delivery van and open up a wholesale business. She lives in a home that she owns but which does not have access to electricity or piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and medicine.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.ru:
Tarana 43 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Tarana yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. 
Ona uje 10 let zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta dlya prodaji. Iz molochnix produktov ona delayet yogurt, Kefir i sir. Yeyo produkt shitayetsya kachestvennim v svazi s etim v yeyo sirye yest bolshaya potrebnost sredi pokupateyley.
texts.en: Tarana is 43 years old, married and has has two children, who attend school.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with her beloved family in the Fuzuli region.  Tarana has been involved in animal husbandry for ten years and breeds cattle.  She currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase the quantity of milk products for sale.  Tarana makes yogurt, kefir and cheese from the milk.  Her products are of good quality and are in high demand among customers.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is 24 years old and married. He runs a grocery store which mainly sells fruit. He started the business in 2002. His business environment is very busy, hence he gets many customers. He has benefited from the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management. This has helped him to improve his business. Frank hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruit for his stall.

loans.use: to buy fruit for his store

loans.name: Naboti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyirere, leader du groupe d’affaire «Naboti », est  une jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 27  ans, mariée, mère de 2 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un enseignant. Elle est  vendeuse de souliers. Il y a  3 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  3eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  25 paires de souliers à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et acheter une parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Nyirere is the leader of the 'Naboti' group.  She is a young 27-year-old entrepreneur who is married and has two young children.  Her husband is a teacher.  Nyirere sells shoes.  She has been in this small income-generating activity for three years and has just received her third loan from Hekima.  She will use this new loan to stock up with 25 pairs of shoes to sell.  In addition, she hopes to see her children grow up comfortably and buy a plot of land.  She thanks Hekima for their actions in favor of poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 25 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru:
Gulnar 28 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Araz-Dilagarda vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Gulnar zamujem no ne imeyet detey. 
Ona uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya uvelicheniya kolichestvo v prodaju.
texts.en:
Gulnar is 28 years old.  She is an IDP (internally displaced person).  She moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region in Araz-Dilagarda village with her family.  Gulnar is married, but does not have children.

For 3 years now she has raised poultry and raises chickens.  Right now she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy chickens to increase the quantity for sale.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Мирзоали женат имеет четверых детей. Его вид бизнеса выращивание сельхозпродуктов и садоводство. Он любит работать на земле. Выращивание лука кукурузы, лимонов требует хорошего ухода за землей. Он хочет получить кредит и приобрести минеральные удобрения. Ядохимикаты и семена для посева. Она надеется получить займ и подготовить землю к весеннему посеву.
texts.en: Mirzoali is married and has four children.  Growing agricultural crops and gardening is his type of business.  He loves working on the land.  Growing onions, corn and lemons requires good care of the land.  Mirzoali wants to obtain this loan and buy mineral fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for sowing.  He hopes to get this loan and prepare the land for the spring sowing.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for sowing

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
El Señor Andrés es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive en su casa propia, tiene 42 años de edad, está casado con la señora Teresita de 39 años de edad.
El señor Andrés tiene una despensa en su casa, en la cual recibe la ayuda de su esposa. Ellos por medio de su esfuerzo está logrando abrirse camino y hacer que sus ingresos crezcan para que de esa forma puedan sustentar su hogar y cubrir los demás gastos.
El se considera un hombre muy trabajador, luchador y emprendedor, quiere que su esposa tenga siempre lo mejor y no tenga que pasar por ningun tipo de privaciones, es por ello que se esfuerza diariamente.
El solicita la ayuda de Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrés is from the city of Santaní.  He lives in his own house, is 42 years old and is married to Teresita, 39.  

Andrés has a grocery store at home that his wife helps him with.  Through their efforts they are making headway and managing to increase their income to support their home and cover other expenses.

He considers himself to be a very hardworking, tenacious, enterprising man who wants his wife to always have the best and not have to go through any privations.  Because of this he strives daily.

He asks for help from Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva to buy foodstuffs, beverages, dairy products, baked goods and others to stock his store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Rosener

texts.en:
Rosener is 43 years old and is married and with three children. To earn a living, she sells mobile phone accessories and offers mobile phone money transfer services. She also owns rental houses which earn her more income.  She was previously employed before she went into business.
Rosener hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy more mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en:
Yasmine, a 59-year-old married mother of three children, has been selling wedding and special occasion dresses since 2001. She loves her business, and her nine previous loans from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, all since repaid, have been of tremendous assistance in improving her enterprise, reflected in her family's social and financial advances.

Now requesting her tenth loan in order to purchase a new collection of dresses to attract new brides and bridesmaids, Yasmine, who helps her husband in their living expenses, hopes to expand her business and open her own factory in the future.

loans.use: to increase her collection of new wedding dresses.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Oñondivepa” es un comité D. 17 mujeres D. excelente estructura, unidas, diligentes y fraternales las unas con las otras. Estas señoras son D. la ciudad D. Villarrica, todas son vecinas y amigas las cuales se reúnen quincenalmente para brindarse apoyo entre ellas y solucionar los problemas en caso D. haberlos. Estas señoras están muy animadas para seguir participando en este programa D. microcrédito, pues mejoran así sus ingresos. Seguirán esforzándose en sus actividades solidarias para seguir creciendo pues tienen puesta todas las ganas D.  sobresalir en el futuro.  
Una D. las integrantes D. este excelente grupo es la señora Ignacia, la cual se dedica a la lavandería. Nos comenta que siempre está con mucho trabajo y eso le gusta mucho pues la ayuda a tener más ingresos. Ella se define como una mujer luchadora y trabajadora, entre sus metas está seguir creciendo cada día más, para que D. esa forna pueda ser D. ayuda no solo a su familia sino también a otras.
La ayuda que solicita es para la compra D. jabones, ya sea en polvo o líquidos, suavizantes y demás insumos necesarios para la lavandería.
texts.en:
The “Oñondivepa” group is a group of 17 women who have excellent structure, are united, diligent and sisterly with each other.  These women are from the city of Villarrica; they are all neighbors and friends.  They meet biweekly to proviD. support for each other and solve problems that may arise.  These women are very excited about continuing to participate in this micro credit program because they improve their income this way.  They will continue striving in their mutually supportive activities to continue to grow because they have placed all their efforts into standing out in the future.

One of the members of this excellent group is Ignacia who has a laundry.  She comments that she always has a lot of work and she likes this because it helps her earn more income.  She defines herself as a hardworking, tenacious woman.  Among her goals is to continue growing more every day so that she can not only help her family but others too.

The help she’s requesting is to buy detergents, both powder and liquid, fabric softeners and other supplies needed in the laundry.

loans.use: to buy detergent, fabric softener and other supplies.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She has been running a grocery business for the last seventeen years to make a living. Her customers are passersby and people living in that area. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Since Lucy joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has operated her dairy business in Naivasha town for the last two years. She is 38 years old, married to Benson, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more milk stock for sale.

In the future, Lydia hopes to package her milk and become the largest milk distributor in the Naivasha area.

loans.use: to buy more milk stock

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 41 years old and single. He runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for over ten years and has one employee.  Despite running his business in a very competitive environment, he has managed to retain his customers because of his good reputation.  
Samuel hopes to buy a vehicle for transporting meat in the future.  He needs 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat for his butcher shop

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и у них трое детей. Её муж плотник, чтобы помогать мужу она начала заниматься торговлей 18 лет назад. Она продает свежие овощи и фрукты, такие как яблоко, виноград, гранат, огурцы, помидоры и т.д. Данный бизнес приносит ей хорошие доходы. С полученной прибили она устроила мероприятие хатнатуй своего сына. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить свой товарооборот. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 4000 Сомони. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a smart and hardworking woman.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is a carpenter, and, in order to help her husband, Gulchehra got involved in sales 18 years ago.  She sells fresh vegetables and fruits, such as apples, grapes, pomegranates, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc.  This business provides her with a good income.  She used her profits to hold a hatnatuy (circumcision) event for her son.  Gulchehra wants to expand her business and increase product turnover.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 4000 Somoni for this purchase.  She thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase product turnover

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 60 years old, widowed, and blessed with two children who are married. She runs three businesses: a posho mill, rental houses and farming. She has been in these businesses for the last five years and gets an income of KES 25,500 per month.

Peris has good credit history in KADET LTD and she is applying for her third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to boost her farming. She will use the anticipated profit to build more rental houses.

She hopes to expand her rental houses and keep over ten dairy cattle. She is very hardworking and is a business-oriented woman.

loans.use: to boost farming

loans.name: Olim

texts.ru: Олим проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 34 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам он 16 лет как занимается растениеводством. У него при доме имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет для приобретения топлива, семян пшеницы и селитры.
texts.en: Olim lives in the Shahrituz region.  He is 34 years old.  He is married.  He has four children.  His wife works on the farm.  He has been growing crops for 16 years.  He has a plot of land next to his house where he grows vegetables and plants wheat.  He is taking out a loan to purchase fuel, wheat seeds and nitrates.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, wheat seeds and nitrates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase paraffin for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 49 years old and a widow. She supports four children aged 16, 15, 14 and 12. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past six years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.


This is Margaret's second loan term with KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use this loan amount to purchase chicken feed and seedlings for planting. 


Anticipated profits will be used to buy more chickens to improve her business. Her dream is to expand and have a stable income to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and seedlings

loans.name: Divine Bonte Group

texts.fr:
Mme Marie Augustine est la représentante du groupe DIVINE BONTE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 32ans et le moins âgé a 19mois. 01 va à l’école et elle a 01personne en charge.

Elle fabrique et vend le savon liquide et en boule depuis 02ans. Mme s’approvisionne à Faso chimie en cité AN III en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes, les gérants de boutique et le voisinage.

Mme veut ajouter de l’argent pour s’acheter 20 litres d’huile de coco, 01 sac de soude, 01 sac de carbonate et 10litres de beure de karité pour la fabrication du savon.

Mme utilise ses économies pour satisfaire ses commandes. Elle ambitionne acheter une deuxième machine de transformation et ouvrir un magasin.
texts.en:
Madame Marie Augustine is the representative of the group "DIVINE BONTE". She is married and the mother of 03 children. The oldest is 32 years old and the youngest is 19 months old. One goes to school and she supports one person. 

She has been making and selling soap (liquid and in balls) for the past 2 years. She gets her supplies at Faso Chimie, in the AN III section of town. Her customers are women, men, shop managers and the neighborhood. 

She wants the additional money to buy 20 liters of coconut oil, 1 sack of lye, 1 sack of carbonate and 10 liters of shea butter to make soap. 

She uses her savings to satisfy the orders. She aims to buy a second processing machine and to open a store.

loans.use: to buy 20 liters of coconut oil, 1 sack of lye, 1 sack of carbonate and 10 liters of shea butter to make soap.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 40 years old, married to Beth, and together they have three children aged between 3 and 24 years. He is a tailor and has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 16,000 from the business.

This is Andrew's second loan term from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan successfully. He will use the loan amount to buy clothing material for sewing. 

He will use the anticipated profits to buy more sewing material to expand his business. His dream is to improve the welfare of his family by improving his income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials for his business

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 23 years old and single. To earn a living, he runs an internet cafe. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business so he gets more income. He has also learned how to manage his finances by saving his money.  
Felix hopes to open an outlet of his business in the town center where he can get more customers.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy computers, internet cables, and switches.

loans.use: to buy computers, internet cables, and switches

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 45 years old and married to John. Together they have six children. She does embroidery and has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This is her ninth loan term from KADET LTD. She has paid all her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase more material for making more clothes. 

She will use the anticipated profits to plough back into her business. Her dream is to increase her income so as to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy more material for sewing

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 13 years. He is 37 years old and married to Jane. They have four school-going children.  

Isaac was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Isaac hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Bramwel

texts.en:
Bramwel is 30 years old and married to Doris. They have two children. He runs a butcher shop, and he has been in business for nine years. Right now, his monthly income from the business is 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is borrowing a loan of 5,000 KES to buy meat to sell.

He plans to use the profit from the business to open another business to be managed by his wife. This is his first loan. His dream is to continue with his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Josiah Mwangi

texts.en:
Josiah used his first loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He planted and harvested, and it was very profitable.

This is his second loan and he plans to use this amount to buy more seeds and fertilizer for the next planting season.

Josiah hopes to become among the top leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Hande Group

texts.fr:
Mme HANGNIDE est la représentante du groupe HANDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 01personne en charge.

Elle vend des habits pagnes et prêt à porter pour enfants depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes de son quartier et les gens des quartiers voisins.

Mme veut s’acheter 08 complets pagnes et 20 complets de prêt à porter pour enfants.

Mme économise pour ouvrir un hangar et aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Elle ambitionne améliorer son activité et acheter un motocycle pour faciliter son déplacement.
texts.en:
Madame HANGNIDE is the representative of the "HANDE" group. She is married and the mother of 02 children. The oldest is 06 years old and the youngest is 03 years old. One goes to school and she takes care of one. 

She has been selling traditional cloth (pagnes) and ready-to-wear clothing for children for 03 years. She gets her supplies in the market in sector 10 in the city. Her customers are women and men in her neighborhood and the people in the neighboring areas. 

She wants to buy 08 whole cloths (pagnes) and 20 complete ready-to-wear sets for children.

She is saving to open a covered stall and to help her husband with the family expenses. She aims to improve her business and to buy a motorcycle to facilitate her travel.

loans.use: to buy 08 whole cloths (pagnes) and 20 complete ready-to-wear sets for children.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 23 years old and single. She is a tailor and has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This is her second loan term in KADET. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her dream is to increase her income for her anticipated family.

loans.use: To buy clothing material for sewing.

loans.name: Mbila Plus Group

texts.en:
Bafuleru is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Mbila Plus,” which is composed of 24 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Bafuleru has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2010. She operates a general store to the east of Kinshasa. She works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a larger store in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that now earns her $10 per day. 

She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar, and milk, and reselling them at a profit. Bafulero is 46 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children, whose ages vary between 10 and 28 years old. Four of the children attend school.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar, and milk.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted spare parts of different phones.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is married and blessed with two children. She has been running a tailoring business for the last five years to support her family. Previously, she was employed. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric and a sewing machine. Gladys dreams of buying a piece of land in the future. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sixto Arnaldo

texts.es:
El señor Sixto es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es solerto, tiene 27 años de edad. Su profesión es Peluquero, en lo cual trabaja hace ya un buen tiempo. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes los cuales siempre van a cortarse el pelo con el y se podría decir que es como un ingreso seguro.
El se define como un hombre trabajador, luchador y emprendedor. Es muy buen peluquero, por lo cual sus clientes siempre regresan a requerir sus servicios. Una de sus metas es poder ampliar su negocio y con eso poder expandirse más y más.
El solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya para la compra de tijeras, gel, peines y demás insumos necesarios para su negocio. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Sixto’s from the city of Curuguaty.  He’s single and 27 years old.  He’s a barber by profession and has been working as such for a long time.  He comments that he has many customers who always go to him for their haircuts and one could say that it’s a secure income.

He defines himself as a hardworking, tenacious and enterprising man.  He’s a very good barber so his customers always return when they need his services.  One of his goals is to be able to enlarge his business and expand more and more.

He is asking Fundación Paraguaya’s help to buy scissors, gel, combs and other supplies needed for his shop.  He is grateful for the opportunity he’s given.

loans.use: to buy scissors, gel, combs and others.

loans.name: C4811 Amizeroyacu Group

texts.en:
Isaie is 22 years old and married with one child who is six months old. Isaie is the leader of a group called "Amizeroyacu" and this group is commonly known for selling Irish potatoes, vegetables, tomato sauce, rice, etc. Isaie has four years of experience and his business hours are from 6 am until 1 pm every day. Isaie is the first person on the right side in the photo.

Isaie and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing more goods (soap, rice, sugar, vegetables, Irish potatoes, tomato sauce) to sell. If successful, Isaie and his team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and improving their family lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like soap, rice, sugar etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a hardworking businesswoman who is 25 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last five years, she been running a cosmetics business to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to establish a wholesale business. Mercy dreams of buying a piece of land to build rental houses. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with the previous loan. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to open another outlet of her business.

loans.use: To open another outlet of her business.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is 28 years old and married with two children between the ages 1 and 8 years old. Janviere owns a business selling various goods such as soap, pads, rice, cosmetics etc. This is her second successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 8 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her.

Janviere has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more goods such as cosmetics, soap, pads, rice etc to sell. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: To purchase more soap, pads, rice, cosmetics etc.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 31 years old and married to Naleng'oyo. They are blessed with two children. She is a livestock trader in the area of the Mlolongo Kitengela slaughter house, Kajiando and other surrounding markets where she supplies livestock. She has  been in this business for the last five years and gets an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a KADET staff member. She has good credit history in KADET, and she is applying for her third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to buy more livestock.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business and become a K.M.C. meat supplier. Hellen hopes to become a K.M.C meat supplier within the next two years. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and six children who are still attending school. He has been working as a taxi driver, transporting students for the past six years. In parallel, he has been working as a farmer since 1996. It is very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs in order to afford the high cost of living. 

Today, he is asking for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his van. He states that he will be able to attract more customers after performing those repairs.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.en:
Olivier is 29 years old and married with a one-year-old child. Olivier owns a business selling shoes. The hours of his business are from 7 am until 6 pm every day and he currently has one person to help him. 

Olivier has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his business by buying more shoes to sell. With any profits, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Damas Trabajadoras” tiene  casi 3 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas son 16 mujeres que se unen con el propósito de servir de ayuda a sus familias, ya que son mujeres de escazos recursos pero con muchas ganas de superación. Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
Un ejemplo de arduo trabajo es la señora Ruth. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, gracias a esto ella puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos diarios y a la vez sostener su negocio. Comenta que ya tiene una clientela definida, es decir, que ellos siempre compran de ella sus verduras. Se define como una señora muy sacrificada y trabajadora.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, cebolla, zapallos y demás con lo que podrá ayudar a su variedad de productos, con lo cual piensa atraer a mas clientes.
texts.en:
The “Damas Trabajadoras” committee has been in operation for almost three years working with Fundación Paraguaya.  It has 16 women members who join together to help their families since they are all women of few resources but with a strong will to get ahead.  They hope for better futures for their children and that’s why they work twice as hard to provide the tools for their development and formation.

One example of hard work is Ruth.  She sells vegetables and thanks to this has been able to help her family with daily expenses while supporting her business.   She comments that she has an established clientele, that is, they always come to her to buy their vegetables.  She defines herself as a very self-sacrificing, hardworking woman.

She requests the loan to buy vegetables like tomatoes, chilies, onions, squash and others to have more variety of products to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and married with two children. He has been operating a retail shop for four years to earn a living. Despite operating his business in a very competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good reputation.
  
Peter hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, soap, and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, and maize flour

loans.name: Mary Wanja

texts.en:
Mary used her first loan to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for her farm. She planted and harvested, and it was very profitable.

She plans to use this second loan to buy more fertilizer and seedlings.

In the future, Mary hopes to become among the top farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat and potatoes

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. She is 34 years old and married to Johnson; they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her farming methods and raise her income in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a hardworking businesswoman who is 39 years old. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been running a cafeteria for the last six years to support her family. She also rents houses to earn extra income. Rhoda has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She has employed one person to help her to manage her business. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to renovate her business premises.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is 43 years old and married with one child who is 14 years old. Anitha owns a business selling cassava flour, cooking oil, vegetables, etc. This is her sixth successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 7 am until 10 pm every day except on Saturday. She currently employs one person to help her. 

Anitha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more cassava flour, vegetables, cooking oil, soap, and sugar to sell. With any profits, she will be able to build a secure future for her business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava flour, cooking oil, soap, sugar, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia is a hardworking businesswoman who is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been running a cafeteria for the last three years to earn a living. Previously, she was selling fruit. In five years, she wants to expand her business. Anastasia dreams of opening a hotel in the future. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more plates, spoons and forks for her business.

loans.use: To buy plates, spoons and forks.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 39 years old and married with four children. He owns a small store selling body lotion, soap, water, tomato sauce, etc to sell. He has 10 years of experience. His business is well organized and he works from 7am until 8 pm every day. Bernard currently employs one person to help him.

Bernard has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more body lotion, soap, water, tomato sauce, etc to sell. He plans to reinvest any profit in his business and to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more body lotion, soap, water, tomato sauce, etc.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married and blessed with one child. For the last three years, he has operated a motorbike transport business to make a living. Over the next five years, he wants to expand his business. 

George is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to service his motorbike. He dreams of becoming more financially stable in future.

loans.use: to service his motorbike.

loans.name: Hilda Natalia

texts.es:
Hilda Natalia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, desde hace 6 meses decidió montar su propio negocio de venta de mazamorra por varios barrios de la ciudad de Medellín.

A sus 29 años de edad es madre soltera de una pequeña niña y vive en compañía de su hermana quien le ayuda con el cuidado de la pequeña mientras ella sale a vender sus productos. Pese a que los lugares en los cuales trabaja son altamente afectados por la violencia, Hilda no ve esto como un impedimento para continuar con su negocio, por el contrario ve que cada día van aumentando poco a poco sus ventas, es por esto que solicita un crédito para adquirir nuevas ollas y utensilios donde preparar y transportar más mazamorra, al mismo tiempo que planea ayudar a su comunidad generando dos empleos más y logrando así crecer su empresa, mejorar las ventas, aumentar los ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y la de los nuevos empleados.
texts.en:
Hilda Natalia is a tenacious and enterprising woman.  Six months ago she decided to start up her own business.  She sells “mazamorra” (corn pudding) in the various neighborhoods in the city of Medellín.

She is the 29 year old single mother of a little girl.  She lives with her sister, who helps take care of the little one when Hilda leaves to sell her products.

Even though the places that she works are greatly affected by violence, Hilda does not see this as an impediment to continue with her business.  To the contrary, she sees her sales slowly increasing every day.

That is why she is requesting a loan to get new pots and utensils to prepare and transport more mazamorra.  At the same time she plans to help her community by generating two more jobs.  That way her business will grow, sales will improve, and income will increase.  That will improve her family’s quality of life and that of her new employees.

loans.use: to buy utensils and raw material to improve her business.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 30 years old and is married with two children between one month and nine years old. He owns a business of transporting people. This is his tenth successful years in this business and is open from 6 am until 11 pm every day.

Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase material (tires)to help him in the business. Jean Pierre hopes to earn more profits. With this profits, he will be able to build a secure future and he will be able to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase another tires to help him in this business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: boost his wife's farming projects

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 31 years old, married, and blessed with three school-going children. She sells snacks in the area of Babadogo in Nairobi and has good flow of customers. She has been in this business for the last eight years and gets an income of KES12,500 per month.

Teresia has a good credit history with KADET LTD.  She is applying for her second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase stock of flour, cooking oil and other materials which are used in making snacks.
