She will use the anticipated profit to uplift the living standard of her family, expand her business, and pay school fees.

Teresia hopes to educate her children and build a home for her family. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: buy materials to make snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy wheat flour, sugar, milk and yeast.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La socia actualmente tiene 56 años D. edad; la socia no ha variado D. actividad en este tiempo ella continua con sus actividades normales y al igual que los últimos meses ella se a estado dedicando a laborar en la municipalidad, y paralelamente a esto cría animales menores como chanchos y aves D. corral, la socia venD. los animales a sus compañeros que viven en otras provincias y desean comprar chancho para algun agazajo u otro evento, la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra D. animales menores ella comprara chanchos tiernos para críar y engordar y vender.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 56 years old at present. This is a successive loan and she has not altered her economic activity -- she continues her normal activities. Just as in recent months, she continues to work for the municipality, and parallel to that, she raises farm animals such as pigs and chickens. 

Maria Isabel sells these animals to her customers who live in other provinces and wish to buy pigs for a major celebration or other event. 

Maria Isabel plans to invest this loan in purchasing animals. She will buy young pigs to raise, fatten, and sell.

loans.use: to invest in young pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: C4832 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 29 years old and is married with two children between the ages of nine and eleven. She is the leader of this group, which is called "Abizeranye." Jacqueline is pictured in the middle. 

Jacqueline has been in her business for about one year. Her business operates from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Jacqueline and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, this team will expand their business by purchasing more clothes. If successful, Jacqueline  and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn would allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. Additionally, they would continue to improve their families' lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items like fish, onions, peanut butter, and tomatoes

loans.name: Akpomè Cécile

texts.fr: Akpomè Cécile est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Théodore. Le couple n’a pas d’enfant. Akpomè Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari. Akpomè Cécile n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu’elle exerce depuis onze ans et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. A côté de cette activité, Akpomè Cécile vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux dans son atelier. Akpomè Cécile s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Akpomè Cécile sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Akpomè Cécile a bien effectué des deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akpomè Cécile is 31 years old and is married to a driver named Theodore. The couple has no children. Akpomè Cécile lives together with her husband. 

She has not attended school, but learned hairdressing, an activity she has carried on for eleven years and which provides her with significant income. Alongside this activity, she sells locks and hair products in her beauty salon. She gets her supplies in Benin.

This is the third time Akpomè Cécile has requested a credit loan from ALIDé. The loan will serve to increase the level of her business to better meet its customers' needs. She has fully reimbursed the two previous loans granted by ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy locks and hair products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 28-year-old business woman. She lives in Juba. She is divorced and has three children between the ages of 3 and 8. All of them go to school.

Christine runs a grocery business and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach of Finance Sudan‘s loan officers. She is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to buy food items for sale like onions, tomatoes, and green vegetables. Other than her business, she has no other source of income.

In five years' time, she is hoping to build a good house and pay for her children to school. 

Her major challenges include high commodity prices and the lack of some items in the market.

Christine says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support.

loans.use: to buy food items for sale like onions, tomatoes, and green vegetables

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; es  viuda; la socia tiene 58 años D. edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos, la socia sigue teniendo un kiosco D. venta D. golosinas y pasteles,ella trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y luego lo venD. en un colegio del distrito D. Oropesa,la socia sigue elbarando pasteles,tortas y sandwichs,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. pasteles y golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas y pasteles al por mayor.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en: Guillermina, 58, is a widow and has four children.  She still has her snack and cake kiosk and works from 8am until 9pm and also sells at a school in Oropesa District.  She is still baking cakes and making sandwiches.  She wants to expand and improve the snack and cake business and is asking for a loan to buy snacks and cakes at wholesale.  She is very grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments for this loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy snacks and cakes at wholesale.

loans.name: C4817 Urukundo Group

texts.en:
Christine, a 24-year-old single businesswoman and leader of this group, called "Urukundo" in the local language, has been selling charcoal for about a year, and has one employee to help her. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day. She is the first woman on the left in the picture.

Christine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. With the new profits arising from the loan, they hope to satisfy their customers and save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Los hijos de la socia tienen 8, 3 y 11 meses; la socia desea ahora comprar animales menores como cuyes, chanchos, gallinas y también comprar productos secos como maiz, moraya, chuño, y la socia vende a las diferentes tiendas y a los mercados en lso cuales tiene sus clientes, la socia comprara 300 kilos en productos secos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos como maíz, moraya, chuño, ella comprara 300 kilos en productos secos.
texts.en: The borrower’s children are 8 and 3 years and 11 months of age.  She wants to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs, pigs and chickens and also to buy dry goods like corn and dehydrated potato.  She sells to various stores and markets in Iso where she has her customers.  She will buy 300 kilograms of dry goods.  She is asking for the loan to buy dry goods like corn and dehydrated potato; she will buy 300 kilos of dry goods.

loans.use: to purchase dried products.

loans.name: C4708 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Olivier, 29 and single, is the leader of a group called "Twisungane", and this group is commonly known for selling Irish potatoes, vegetables, tomato sauce, rice, etc. Olivier has five years' experience, and his business hours are from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day. Olivier is shown in the middle of the photo with his hand raised.

Olivier and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing more goods (vegetables, Irish potatoes, etc.) to sell. If successful, Olivier and his team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and the ongoing improvement of their families' lifestyles.

loans.use: to purchase more Irish potatoes, tomatoes sauce, rice, sugar etc.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano se conformó con mucho esfuerzo de las integrantes. Ellas se encuentran en el 2 ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Señora Amada quien se dedica a la venta de verduras. Nos comenta que mediante el crédito anterior pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico . Además de eso nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que ella mantiene a su padre anciano y a sus 3 hijos.
Solicita de nuevo la ayuda de Fundación Paraguaya para al compra de verduras, para abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano” women’s committee was formed with much effort from the members.  They are in the second cycle working together and in a mutually supportive way in the program.  Besides the individual work of each one of them, they also carry out joint activities to raise funds to have group capital; they also help each other reach their objective which is to work to help their families economically.

A moving story is Amada’s who sells vegetables.  She comments that the previous loan made it possible for her to improve her business, her standard of living and her income quite a bit.  She also comments that through this business the family’s economy improved quite a bit since she also supports her elderly father and her three children.

She is once again asking help from Fundación Paraguaya to buy vegetables to stock up and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Sourou

texts.fr: Sourou est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Louis. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Sourou assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Sourou n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Sourou vend depuis une dizaine d’année des céréales et de l’huile à moteur de façon secondaire. Sourou s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Sourou sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Son point fort en tant qu’entrepreneur est le bon accueil réservé à sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Sourou is 54 years old and is married to a driver named Louis. The couple has four children, all attending (or having attended) school, and of whom one is still dependent on them. The family lives together, and Sourou ensures together with her ​​husband the various family expenses.

Sourou has not attended school. To meet her diverse needs, Sourou has been selling grain for about ten years, and also motor oil as a secondary source of income. Sourou gets her supplies from a city in Benin.

Sourou is seeking financial support from ALIDé to further strengthen her business by increasing her stock supply and so better meet customer demand. Her strong point as an entrepreneur is the warm welcome she gives her customers.

loans.use: Buy grain and motor oil.

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es:
A sus 51 años de edad Elvia Rosa es una microempresaria luchadora, dedicada a la venta de Aceites y Lubricantes para Vehículos, que nunca se ha dejado vencer por las dificultades, por el contrario se ha dedicado a su negocio.

Años atrás cuando su esposo murió pese al dolor y la tristeza, tomo la decisión de mudarse a vivir con sus padres que son personas ya de avanzada edad, con el fin de ayudarles con sus gastos, cuidar de ellos y al mismo tiempo contar con su colaboración. Por eso con la ilusión de seguir progresando, Elvia solicita un préstamo para comprar mas insumos ó inventario necesarios para aumentar sus ventas y proporcionalmente mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de sus padres ya que dejándolos trabajar en su negocio, los ayuda a sentirse útiles y felices.
texts.en:
At the age of 51 Elvia Rosa is a tenacious micro businesswoman who works selling oil and lubricants for vehicles.  She’s never let herself be defeated by difficulties; on the contrary, she’s dedicated herself to her business.

When her husband died years ago despite the sadness and pain she made the decision to move in with her parents who are of an advanced age in order to help them financially and take care of them while at the same time having their cooperation.  

Because of this and with the hope of continuing to make progress, Elvia is asking for a loan to buy more stock merchandise for her inventory to increase sales and improve her and her parents’ quality of life proportionately because allowing them to work in her business helps them to feel useful and happy.

loans.use: to buy oil and lubricant.

loans.name: Flor De Rosas Marisacal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSAS MARISCAL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Paulina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado, tejido de aguayos, tejido de chompas y mantas, venta de coca.

La señora Paulina,  indica que hace es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescados que viene trabajando hace seis años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pescados) que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo venderá en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Rosas Mariscal” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes focal center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Paulina.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have fish sales, multicolored cloth weaving, blanket and sweater weaving and coca leaf sales.

Paulina indicates that this is the first time she works with Pro Mujer and that she joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She has been selling fish for the last six years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She’ll buy fish in the local markets and then sell it in her sales point.  This way of working makes it possible for her to earn resources to support her family since she’s married and has six children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: C18516 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Flavie, a 33-year-old widow with four children between the ages of 5 and 12 years, is the leader of this group which is called "Dufatanye." Flavie is the first woman on the left in the photo. The operator of a retail shoe business for about six years experience, she works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day.

Flavie and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing more shoes to sell. They will reinvest the additional profits into their enterprises and pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more quantity of shoes.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is 34 years old and is married with two children ages 5 and 10. Zakayo owns a business selling various body lotions, soaps and powders. This is his fourth successful year in this business. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m until 7 p.m every day except on Saturday.

Zakayo has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more cooking oil, sugar, rice, soap, etc. to sell. With his profits, he will be able to build a secure future for his business, and he will be able to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, sugar, rice, soap, etc.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 34 years old and is married with two children who are 6 and 9 years old. She is commonly known for selling body lotion, rice, sugar, etc.  Her business hours are from 7 am until 6 pm every day, and she has four years of experience in this business. 

Monique has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more body lotion, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and cooking oil. Monique will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, and she will keep providing all the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more body lotion, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es: Doña Juana esta contenta con su anterior credikiva con el cual compró una parte en materias primas como algodón, franela, madera y cepilleria y la otra parte la invirtió en la adecuación de su pequeña bodega donde ahora puede almacenar sus materias primas y productos acabados de manera protegida y ordenada. En la actualidad está preparandose para responder a una gran demanda de cepillos y traperos y esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, pues planea con el, comprar materiales para producir y aumentar su capital. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores : " Muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido de ustedes para seguir creciendo."
texts.en: Juana is very happy with her previous Kiva loan that she used part of to buy raw materials like cotton, flannel, wood and brushes and part to furnish her small warehouse where she’s now able to store her raw materials and finished products in a secure and orderly way.  She is currently getting ready to respond to a large demand for brushes and mops and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan once again.  She plans to use it to buy supplies to produce and increase her capital.  She sends the following message to her lenders: “I’m very grateful for the support I got from you to continue growing.”

loans.use: to buy supplies to make mops and brooms.

loans.name: C18517 Imbereheza Group

texts.en:
Edissa is 39 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 16 years old. She is the leader of this group, which is called "Imbereheza". Edissa is the first person of this group. She has been in this business for about five years and employs two persons to help her. The business hours are from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day.

Edissa and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing more clothes. If successful, Edissa and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn would allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. Additionally, they would continue to improve their families' lifestyles.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maria, es casada; la socia tiene 50 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bordados para los santos y virgenes,ella borda capas,estandartes y banderas,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de bordados,santos y estandares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hilos,agujas y telas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: María, 50, is married and has three children.  She makes embroidered items for statues of saints and virgins to sell.  She embroiders capes, pennants and flags.  She works from 9am until 6pm.  She wants to expand the saints’ items embroidery business and is asking for a loan to buy materials like thread, needles and fabric.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for making her embroidered products to order.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es: Melida, D. 58 años, es una mujer muy responsable y A., es viuda y madre D. cuatro hijos a quienes le dio educación y hoy ya son mayores e independientes. Tiene una casa propia en donD. vive a lado D. uno D. sus hijos quien la ayuda en los gastos del hogar. El trabajo D. Melida consiste en la venta D. golosinas a los niños y adolescentes, su negocio esta en su casa y esta cerca D. un colegio D. educación primaria. Lleva realizando esta actividad durante doce años, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola, pero hay ocasiones en que sus hijos la apoyan. Manifiesta que le agrada tener su negocio porque pueD. recibir ingresos además que se da tiempo para atender a su familia. Pero su plan es ampliar su negocio para vender comida. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, le esta yendo bien hasta ahora con el grupo, se siente cómoda y espera seguir siendo la socia puntual y muy responsable como hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales, ingredientes e insumos para poder empezar a vender menú en su casa y algunas golosinas más.
texts.en:
Melida, 58, is a responsible, very cheerful woman.  She’s a widow and the mother of four children who she provided with an education and who are now all independent adults.  She has a house of her own where she lives with one of her sons who helps her with household expenses.  

Melida’s work consists in selling snacks to children and adolescents.  Her business is home-based and near an elementary school.  She’s been in business for 12 years and to date has worked alone but sometimes her children help her.  She states that she it pleases her to have her own business because she can earn income while having time to dedicate to her family.  But her plan is to expand the business to start selling food.

This will be her 4th MFP loan.  She’s been doing well so far with the group; she feels comfortable and hopes to continue being a punctual, very responsible member like she’s been to date.  She will use the requested amount to buy supplies and ingredients to start to be able to sell meals at home and to buy some additional snacks.

loans.use: to buy snacks and ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: C18006 Abahuje Group

texts.en:
Marie Golette is 45 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 16 years old. She is the leader of this group, which is called "Abahuje". Marie Golette is the first person of this group. She has been in this business for about two years and employs two persons to help her. The business hours are from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day.

Marie Golette and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing more clothes. If successful, Marie Golette and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn would allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. Additionally, they would continue to improve their families' lifestyles.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à Mathias un coiffeur. Le couple a un  enfant, qui n’est pas encore en âge de scolarisation et qui est à leur charge. Marie et son mari vivent dans la même maison avec leur enfant.  Marie a très peu fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu’elle exerce depuis neuf ans environs. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les diverses charges de sa famille, parallèlement à son métier de coiffure, Marie vend des mèches  et des produits pour cheveux dans son atelier et par le système de la distribution. Marie s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits à l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, Marie sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers crédits reçus par Marie ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Marie is twenty-five years old and is married to Mathias, a hairdresser. The couple has a child who has not yet reached school age and is in their care. Marie and her husband live in the same house with their child. Marie did not attend much school, but learned hairdressing, an occupation that she has practiced for around nine years. To meet her needs and see to the various needs of her family, at the same time as her profession as a hairdresser, Marie sells hair extensions and hair products in her shop and through a distribution system. Marie stocks up in one of Benin's markets. With the goal of increasing her activity by augmenting the stock of her products as the end of the year festivals approach, Marie seeks a third loan through Alidé. The first two loans received by Marie have been paid back.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair products

loans.name: Yurani Andrea

texts.es:
A sus 23 años de edad Yurani es una madre luchadora quien decidió comenzar su propio negocio debido a su embarazo,  desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de remate de ropa a sus amigos, allegados y vecinos, poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo pues ya adecuó un espacio en su casa para exhibir la mercancía y tener un lugar donde surtir y ofrecer sus productos. En vista de que cada vez las ventas mejoran y sus clientes son más Yurani quiere comprar un surtido de mayor cantidad, de buena calidad, y gran variedad pues así las utilidades se aumentarán y proporcionalmente sus ingresos serán mas prometedores, sin embargo, actualmente Yurani no cuenta con esa cantidad de dinero para comprar la mercancía, por lo cual solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar ropa de todo tipo, buscando la satisfacción de todos sus clientes al encontrar la prenda que quieren o que buscan. Adicional a esto Yurani también quiere hacerle adecuaciones locativas al espacio donde tiene la mercancía para darle más apariencia a almacén y así posicionar su negocio.

Yurani sueña con un mejor futuro para su hijo, por lo que trabaja día a día con esmero con la ilusión de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
At the age of 23, Yurani is a tenacious mother who decided to start her own business due to her pregnancy.  She’s been selling bargain clothes for the past 7 years to her friends, acquaintances and neighbors.  Gradually the business has grown and she’s furnished a space in her house to exhibit her merchandise and to have a place to sort and sell her wares.

Seeing that sales improve each time and the number of customers increases, Yurani wants to buy a larger assortment of clothes of good quality and in a wide variety so that profits will incrase proportionately.  However, at the moment Yurani does not have sufficient money to buy the merchandise so she’s asking for a loan to buy all sorts of clothes seeking to meet customer demand so that they will find everything they are looking for or desire.  In addition, Yurani also wants to make some adjustments to her locale where she keeps her merchandise to give it a more attractive appearance so that her business will be better situated.  Yurani dreams with a better future for her son which is why she works so hard every day with dedication hoping to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and to make some improvements to her locale.

loans.name: Quince Mas Uno Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Quince más Uno”, lo conforman17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, artesanía, comercio, corte y confección, peluquería, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago. 
Mónica integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas, ubicada en el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, usando lentes de sol. Ella se dedica a bordar ropa, desde hace 1 año y medio.
Su trabajo lo denomina “bordado con sentimiento”, ya que escribe poemas, nombres, dedicatorias en diferentes prendas, según lo requiera cada cliente. Algunos de estos productos son mantas y poleras.
Sin embargo comenta que la demanda de sus productos y/o servicios es relativa, por lo que no resulta conveniente tener solo ese negocio, de esta manera incorporó a sus servicios la creación y hechura de logos corporativos en empresas, ya que estos se realizan al por mayor y resulta más conveniente económicamente.  
Mónica realiza publicidad de su trabajo mediante un Blog que tiene en internet, además de dar datos a sus conocidos y amigos. 
Sus materiales los compra en las comunas de Independencia y Estación Central. 
Con el crédito comprará poleras, telas de polar y toallas para bordar.
Sus metas son expandir su negocio y prosperar con su negocio. 
Mónica vive junto a sus dos hijos de 18 y 13 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar son que sus hijos puedan concretar sus proyectos, su hija anhela estudiar odontología en una Universidad Estatal. Por lo tanto Mónica se esfuerza a diario para generar nuevos y mejores ingresos, para también brindarles a sus hijos un mejor bienestar económico. 
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida del crédito entregado por Fondo esperanza, ya que éste le permitirá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal al cual participa está muy afiatado y sus anhelos son similares de construir proyectos en grande y poder concretarlos. 
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Quince más Uno” (Fifteen plus One).   It has 17 members who are in a variety of businesses.  Among them are crafts making, commerce, dressmaking, barber shop, among others.  They all live in the city of Santiago’s Independencia Commune.

Mónica is a member of the communal bank and she’s squatting in the photo, first from left to right and wearing sunglasses.  She has been working embroidering clothes for the last year and a half.

Her business is called “Bordado con Sentimiento” (Embroidery with Feeling) because she writes poems, names and dedications on various articles of clothing according to the customer’s wishes.  Some of these products are t-shirts and blankets.

However, she comments that demand for her products and/or services is irregular so it’s not a good idea to only have this single business.  Therefore, she added to her services creating and making corporate logos for firms since these are produced at wholesale and are economically more convenient for her. Mónica publicizes her work through a blog she has on the Internet as well as providing her data to acquaintances and friends.  She buys her supplies in the Independencia and Estación Central Communes. This loan is to buy t-shirts, thermal fabric and towels to embroider.  Her goal is to expand the business and to make progress with it.

Mónica lives with her two children who are 18 and 13 years old.  Her dreams on a family level is that her children are able to make their projects reality.  Her daughter hopes to go to dental school at a state university so Mónica strives daily to generate new and better income to provide her children with the best possible economic wellbeing.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan provided by Fondo Esperanza because it will make it possible for her to invest in her business and generate higher profits.  She comments that the group in the communal bank she participates in is very strong and they share similar goals of building projects on a large scale and to be able to make them happen.

Independencia is one of the 34 communes that make up the city of Santiago (Capital of Chile) and is located in the center-north sector.  It arose at the end of the 19th-century as a traditional part of the city.  Its main axis is Independencia Avenue which used to be the ancient Road of the Inca which was the northern gate of the city of Santiago.  Because of its extensive indigenous population the Chilean Indigenous Cultural Center is found in Independencia.  It also has important historical buildings among which are six historical Chilean monuments.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, thermal fabric and towels to embroider.

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores De Quello Quello Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Señor D. los Temblores D. Quello Quello” y se reúnen  cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Quello Quello del distrito D. Pisaq D. la provincia del Cusco. El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora, artesanos y comerciantes. El grupo está conformado por once integrantes y son varias vez que solicitan un préstamo D. la Asociación Arariwa y el dinero lo invertirán para mejorar sus negocios. 

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Lourdes, ella tiene 29 años D. edad y tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica  a la crianza D. animales menores, a la agricultura y también se dedica a la artesanía. DesD. joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable y amable y por ese motivo sus vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. 

Lourdes en sus horas libres se dedica a pintar cerámica, ella realiza estos trabajos en su domicilio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo pinturas y pinceles. (En la fotografía la socia Lourdes está levantando la mano).
texts.en:
This group is called “Señor D. los Temblores D. Quello Quello” and they meet every thirty days in the city of Quello Quello in Pisaq District, Cusco Province.  The communal bank is notable for being composed of hardworking artisans and merchants.  The group has 11 members and they’ve requested several loans from Asociación Arariwa; they will invest the money in their businesses.

We met Lourdes, 29, at this meeting.  She has two children and raises small farm animals, farms and is a craftswoman.  Since a young age she stood out as being a responsible, kind person.  Because of that her neighbors invited her to participate in the communal bank.

In her free time Lourdes paints ceramics.  She does all her jobs at home and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more supplies like paint and paint brushes, for example.

(In the photo, Lourdes is raising her hand.)

loans.use: to buy more supplies like paint and brushes.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un hombre de 31 años de edad, que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al trabajo de la tierra en el municipio de Santuario del departamento de Antioquia. Sin embargo, debido a la temporada invernal que ha presenciado el país, estas actividades se han visto gravemente afectadas porque se les inundan los cultivos.

Actualmente debido a las dificultades, Gustavo Adolfo con sus ganas de Salir adelante y progresar, desea generar nuevos ingresos mediante una iniciativa de emprendimiento que se trata del montaje de una caseta rodante, donde anhela vender gran variedad de surtido, como chicles, mecato, cigarrillos, juguitos entre otros, para lograr esto, solicita un préstamo que le permitirá preparar su caseta y comprar el surtido inicial, para lograr mejorar sus ingresos y adicional mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 31, has dedicated much of his life to working in the fields of Santuario, Antioquia department.  Nevertheless due to the damaging summer weather that has hit the countryside, his work has been severely affected because the crops have flooded.

Now because of the problems, but with a desire to get ahead, Gustavo Adolfo wants to generate income by starting a business by outfitting a  cart where he wants to sell a great variety of products such as: gum, box lunches, cigarettes, juices, etc.  For this, he is requesting a loan that will help him set up the cart and buy the initial supplies so that he can improve his earnings, and also improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to set up a cart and buy the initial supplies to start his business

loans.name: Alodokpo Sozin Elise

texts.fr: Alodokpo Sozin Elise est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Bienvenu. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Alodokpo Sozin Elise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Alodokpo Sozin Elise n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu’elle exerce depuis douze ans et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. A côté de cette activité, Alodokpo Sozin Elise vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux dans son atelier. Alodokpo Sozin Elise s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Alodokpo Sozin Elise sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Alodokpo Sozin Elise a bien effectué le remboursement des deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé.
texts.en: Alodokpo Sozin Elise is thirty-two years old and is married to a driver named Bienvenu. The couple has four children, some of whom are in school. Alodokpo Sozin Elise lives together with her husband and children. The couple provides for the various needs of their family. Alodokpo Sozin Elise didn't attend school but learned hairdressing, an occupation that she has practiced for twelve years and that brings her considerable income. Aside from this occupation, Alodokpo Sozin Elise sells hair extensions and other hair products in her shop. Alodokpo Sozin Elise stocks up in one of Benin's markets. This is the third time that Alodokpo Sozin Elise is asking for a loan from Alidé, a loan which will help her to raise the level of her activity in order to better respond to the demands of her clients. Alodokpo Sozin Elise completed the reimbursement of the two loans that she received from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair products.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Victoria, es casada; la socia tiene 54 años D. edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes,ella venD. arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabja desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas al por mayor para implementar la tienda D. abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old and is married with 3 children.  She continues to devote her time to her grocery store business, where she sells rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  She works from 9am until 10pm, and she wants to expand and improve her grocery store business.  She requests a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale to stock up her grocery store.

Victoria is happy to have this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale for her grocery store

loans.name: Ella

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Ella  est mariée à Germain un pâtissier. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Ella vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Ella a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Ella mène comme activité la vente des plateaux d’œufs et des objets en plastiques. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Ella vend des tissus. Ella  exerce cette activité  depuis treize ans  environs. Ella s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo son Etat voisin. C’est la première fois que Ella sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce crédit lui servira certainement à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ella is 37 years old and is married to a baker named Germain. The couple has three children under their care. Some of the children attend school. Ella lives together with her ​​husband and children.

Ella left school at primary level. To support herself and her children, she is in the business of selling trays of eggs and plastic objects. This activity allows her to support herself and her children. Ella also sells clothing fabrics as a secondary activity. She has been performing these activities for the past thirteen years. Ella gets her supplies from Benin and from Togo, a neighboring state.

This is the first time Ella has requested a credit loan from ALIDé. The loan will certainly raise the level of her business to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: Buy trays of eggs and clothing fabric.

loans.name: Miguelito De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MIGUELITO DE COLLPANI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pamela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, taller de llantería, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, comerciante de frazadas.

La señora Pamela,  indica que hace es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de un familiar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de edredones y lámparas que viene trabajando hace cinco años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de edredones y lámparas) que adquirirá de las ferias y posteriormente lo venderá en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The "Miguelito de Collampi" communal association will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Collpani office.  It is composed of six members, and is run by a board headed by Pamela. 

The businesses run by the members of the communal association are varied. They include clothing sales, a tire shop, a neighborhood store, and selling blankets. 

Pamela says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the institution at the invitation of a family member. Currently, she has a business selling quilts and lamps, that she has been working on for five years.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase her capital, by buying  quilts and lamps. She will buy these at markets, and sell them later at her sales location. 

This activity allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is single.  When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the skill development.

loans.use: To buy lamps and quilts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfumes, and articles for the home.

loans.name: Dina  Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dina; La socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 11, 9 años de edad, la socia trabaja vendiendo tejidos en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia teje a mano chompas para bebes, ella compra al por mayor lanas y botones para la elaboración de los diferentes tejidos como chompas, chompones, ropones, botones, babuchas y otros en lanas, gruesas y delgadas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas al por mayor delgadas y gruesas, y en todos los colores, también comprara botones en motivos animados.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Dina belongs to the "Los Triunfadoras" communal bank, located in Andahuaylillas district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department. She is 34, lives with her partner, and has two children, ages eleven and nine. 

She sells woven articles in the city of Cusco. She knits baby sweaters by hand. She buys wool and buttons at wholesale, for making different woven articles such as sweaters, long sweaters, baby gowns, buttons, slippers, and other woolen articles, fine and coarse.

She is applying for the loan to buy wool at wholesale; both fine and coarse gauge, and in all colors. She will also buy cartoon character buttons. 

Dina is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay her instalments in accordance with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: To buy wool at wholesale; fine and coarse, in all colors, and also cartoon character buttons

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maribel, es conviviente; la socia tiene 32 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos,la socia sigue teniendo sus negocios de venta de salchipapas y venta de ceviche,ella tiene un carreta donde vende estos platos,ella lo realiza en forma ambulatoria,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el ngeocio de venta de salchipapas y ceviche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar salchipapas y ceviche como pescados,papas,salchichas y verduras al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel is 32, lives with her partner, and has two children. She continues to have her business selling salchipapas (sliced fried sausage and potatoes), and ceviche (fish marinated in citrus juice). 

She has a cart which she uses to sell these dishes in the street. She works from 8:00am to 9:00pm. She wants to expand and improve her business selling salchipapas and ceviche.

She is applying for the loan to buy ingredients at wholesale for making salchipapas and ceviche, such as fish, potatoes, sausages and vegetables. Maribel is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy ingredients at wholesale for making salchipapas (sliced fried sausage and potatoes)  and ceviche (fish marinated in citrus juice), such as fish, potatoes, sausages and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital to buy large quantities of food (beans, rice, flour, etc.) to re-sell

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 años; vive con su familia en Otavalo en la provincia de Imbabura que está ubicado al Norte de Ecuador. Martha se describe como una persona de caracter fuerte y muy decidida, es también una mujer emprendedora que todos los días tiene el deseo de superación buscando el bienestar de su familia.

Martha trabaja sola en la elaboración y venta de helados en el terminal terrestre de Otavalo. Es el cuarto crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de un congelador ya que el actual está en malas condiciones lo que no permite que los helados estén a la temperatura optima. Esta inversión le ayudará a que sus helados estén a la temperatura optima y que sus helados se mantengan en buenas condiciones durante el día de ventas.

Su sueño es poder tener un local propio donde pueda contratar a personal que necesite de trabajo y así obtener buenos ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 36, married, and has two children ages four and one.  She lives with her family in Otavalo in the province of Imbabura, which is located in  northern Ecuador. 

Martha describes herself as a person with a strong personality, and very determined. She is also an enterprising woman, who every day has the desire to improve herself for the well-being of her family. 

Martha works on her own, making and selling ice cream in Otavalo's bus terminal.  This is the fourth loan she is applying for at Fodemi.  She will invest it in the purchase of a freezer, since her current one is in poor condition, which doesn't allow the ice cream to be kept at optimal temperature. This investment will help her ensure that her ice cream is kept at optimal temperature, and is in good condition during the day of sale. 

Her dream is to have her own shop, where she can hire staff who need work, and in this way get good income, and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy a new freezer for her business.

loans.name: Utama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UTAMA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mery. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de gomas, venta de jugos de papaya, venta de repuestos de auto, venta de papa, venta de comida, costura de ropa de bebe.

La señora Mery,  indica que hace es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de repuesto de autos que viene trabajando hace dos años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de repuestos de auto) que adquirirá de Oruro y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el apoyo para aumentar capital.
texts.en:
The Utama communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani communal bank.  There are six members in the group, which is run by a board of directors headed by Mery.  The businesses that the members of the communal association conduct are varied and among them we have tire sales, papaya juice sales, spare auto parts sales, potato sales, food sales, and sewing of baby clothes.

Mery indicates that this is the first time she is working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution on the invitation of a friend.  Currently she has a business selling spare auto parts that she has been working on for two years.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital buying spare parts, which she will get from Oruro and later sell in the markets.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has one child.

When you ask Mery what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the support to increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts.

loans.name: Akouègnon Antoine

texts.fr: Akouègnon Antoine est âgé de 33 ans et est marié à Béatrice. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Akouègnon Antoine a très peu fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure ; activité qu’il exerce depuis seize ans et qui lui permet de satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle et d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Parallèlement à cette activité, Akouègnon Antoine vend de l’huile de palme,des lubrifiants et de la glace dans sa région. Akouègnon Antoine s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Akouègnon Antoine désire  augmenter le stock de ses produits afin d’accroître sa clientèle et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Pour ce faire, Akouègnon Antoine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Akouègnon Antoine is 33 years old and is married to Beatrice. They have two children who are attending school. In addition to their own, they have two other children under their care. The various family expenses are borne by the couple.

Akouègnon Antoine has had very little schooling, but learned the hairdressing trade, a business activity he has practiced for sixteen years. This allows him to meet his customers requirements and to deal with various family expenses. Alongside this activity, Akouègnon Antoine also sells palm oil, lubricants and ice throughout the area. He gets his supplies from Nigeria, Benin's neighboring state.

Akouègnon Antoine wants to increase his stock supply to expand his customer base and increase his turnover. To do this, Antoine Akouègnon is requesting a third credit loan from ALIDé. The first two loans have been fully reimbursed..

loans.use: Buy lubricants, a freezer, palm oil and "Pure Water".

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy large quantities of flour for making a lot of doughnuts to sell

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila es una joven de 26 años de edad, tiene 1 pequeña hija y es madre soltera, pero todo esto no ha sido impedimento para salir adelante. Desde que estaba en el colegio, le ha gustado el diseño de moda, por eso ella se diseñaba sus camisas y buscaba quien se las confeccionara, así poco a poco con la acogida de sus productos por amigas y vecinas, tomo la decisión de emprender y dedicarse de lleno a diseñar y producir ropa.

Actualmente, vive junto con su hija en la casa de sus padres y hermanos, y por medio de la venta de sus vestidos de baño, línea de producción en la que se enfocó,  ayuda a su madre en el sustento del hogar y a dar estudio a su hija y hermana, ya que su padre se encuentra desempleado. Dalila sueña con posicionar su marca dentro y fuera del país, e igualmente diversificar sus diseños y líneas de productos, por esta razón solicitó un préstamo para fabricar un aproximado de 320 unidades de vestidos de baño, para un lograr una oferta de negocio en Miami (EEUU), logrando así comenzar con el posicionamiento internacional, aumentar sus ingresos y proporcionalmente mejorar la calidad de vida y los beneficios para ella, su hija y su familia.
texts.en:
Dalila is a 26 year-old woman who has one small daughter and is a single mother, but none of this has kept her from getting ahead. Ever since she was in high school, she has enjoyed fashion design. She would design her shirts and look for someone to sew them. Little by little, as her friends and neighbors welcomed her products, she decided to learn and to dedicate herself to designing and producing clothing.

She currently lives with her daughter in the same house as her parents and siblings. She focuses on producing a line of bathing suits, and through their sale she helps her mother support the household and provide her daughter and sister with an education, as her father is currently unemployed. Dalila dreams of positioning her brand both within and outside the country, and also of diversifying her designs and product lines. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to produce approximately 320 bathing suits, in order to land a business offer in Miami (United States). This will allow her to start positioning internationally, to increase her income, and to proportionally improve the quality of life and benefits for her, her daughter, and her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and to pay for the production of 320 bathing suits to be sold abroad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large scale for her scrap metal business.

loans.name: Maravilla 2011 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARAVILLA 2011” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Alejandra es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa usada, artesanía en títeres, venta dulces, comercio de condimentos, venta de verduras.

La señora Alejandra,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias del mercado y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Maravilla 2011” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Alejandra, who is the president. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling used clothing, making puppets, selling candy, selling condiments, and selling vegetables.

Sra. Alejandra says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation from a local promoter. Alejandra currently has a business selling vegetables and has worked for several years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy vegetables. She acquires her inventory at the market fairs and then sells at other fairs. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Alejandra is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Alejandra said that she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es: La socia tiene 4 hijos de 12, 9, 8, 3 años de edad, la socia se dedica  aún a la compra y venta de ganados vacunos en especial vacas, ella compra las vacas tiernas y las engorda y luego de ello la socia las lleva a vender a la feria del poblado de Combapata. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de vacas tiernas para la venta.
texts.en:
This member has four children (ages 12, 9, 8, and 3). She buys and sells livestock, especially cows. The member buys young cows for fattening and eventually sells them at the village fair in Combapata.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of young cows that she can sell later.

loans.use: to purchase young cows for eventual resale.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian tiene 34 años es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 7, 5, 4, 2 años de edad, vive con su familia en la ciudad de Otavalo que se encuentra en la provincia de Imbabura al norte de Ecuador. Julian se describe como una persona emprendedora que lucha por ser mejor cada día para poder salir adelante con su familia.

Julian trabaja solo en la elaboración de artesanías (instrumentos musicales). Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de tubos de madera (tunda) y de un motor de dos caballos de fuerza; esta inversión le ayudará bastante ya que puede optimizar tiempo con el motor y obtener muy buena productividad teniendo buenos resultados en cuanto a las ventas e ingresos.

Su sueño es viajar al extranjero para poder demostrar su cultura con los instrumentos musicales y abrirse mercado internacional.
texts.en:
Julian is 34 years old, married, and has four children (ages 7, 5, 4, and 2). He and his family live in the city of Otavalo, which is located in the province of Imbabura in northern Ecuador. Julian describes himself as an enterprising person who strives to get better each day so that he and his family can move forward.

Julian works alone in his business of making handcrafted musical instruments. This is the second loan he is requesting from FODEMI and he will invest in the purchase of wooden tubes and a two-horsepower motor. This investment will be of a great help since the motor will allow him to optimize his time. As a result, Julian will be able to achieve good productivity that will lead to excellent results in his sales and his income.

His dream is to travel abroad in order to conduct cultural demonstrations with his musical instruments and to open an international market.

loans.use: to buy wooden tubes and a motor for making musical instruments.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Esmeralda;  La socia tiene 25 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, la socia trabaja vendiendo carne de vacuno, la socia lleva a la Convención Quillabamaba la carne de primera, ella tiene a sus clientes y para esto viaja 8 horas para llegar allá, la socia  vende cordero y res al por mayor, y repartiendo en el poblado de Quillabamba ella vuelve y nuevamente en 2 semanas realiza el largo viaje para llevar otro grupo de carne de vacuno y cordero. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vacunos y cordero para la venta de carne y los gastos de viaje al poblado de Quillabamaba.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Esmeralda is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trinufadoras” (The Winners) which is located in the District of Andahuaylillas, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 25 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a six-year-old son. Esmeralda has a job selling beef. She carries her merchandise from Convención to Quillabamba, since she has customers who live there. It takes eight hours for her to reach her destination. Esmeralda sells mutton and beef in bulk. She distributes her products in the village of Quillabamba and returns every two weeks with another large shipment of mutton and beef.

Esmeralda is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of cattle and sheep so that she can sell the meat. She will also pay for her travel expenses to the village of Quillabamba. Esmeralda is grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep so that she can sell the meat and to pay for her travel expenses to the village of Quillabamba.

loans.name: Nounassou Anatole

texts.fr: Nounassou Anatole est âgé de 56 ans et est marié à Akpoton. Le couple a quatre enfants,tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. La famille vit ensemble dans une ville du Bénin. Nounassou Anatole n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis une trentaine d’année, Nounassou Anatole mène comme activité la vente des céréales et du charbon de bois dans sa région ; ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille et d’assurer ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Nounassou Anatole fait de l’agriculture.  Nounassou Anatole achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Nounassou Anatole sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. Ce crédit lui servira à rehausser le niveau de son activité en augmentant ses stocks de produits et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Nounassou Anatole is 56 years old and is married to Akpoton. The couple has four children, all attending school. In addition to their children, the couple has another dependant child. The family lives together in a city in Benin. Nounassou Anatole never attended school.

For the past thirty years, Anatole Nounassou has been in business selling grain and charcoal throughout the region enabling him to meet his needs and those of his family. As a second source of income, Anatole Nounassou is also a crop farmer. He buys his supplies in Benin.

This is the second time Nounassou Anatole has requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve to increase the level of his business activity by increasing his stock supply and by improving customer satisfaction.

loans.use: Buy grain and charcoal.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery es una mujer emprendedora quien desde hace varios años tiene un negocio en el garaje de  su casa, allí vende ropa, accesorios, productos de papelería, y artículos para el hogar, pues debido a su situación económica se vio obligada a generar ingresos para las necesidades de su familia, y con la ilusión de ir incrementando esos ingresos actualmente vende comidas rápidas los fines de semana a las afueras de su miscelánea.

A sus 53 años de edad Luz Mery sueña con un mejor futuro por lo que quiere ampliar su negocio, comprando un surtido de mayor cantidad en accesorios, ropa y papelería, logrando un aumento de las utilidades, sin embargo no cuenta con el monto de dinero necesario para hacer estas compras, es por tal motivo que hoy solicita un préstamo que le permita mejorar las ventas, satisfacer mas clientes y aumentar sus ingresos, así su calidad de vida mejorará notablemente y su sueño de tener un futuro mas tranquilo y estable comenzará a cumplirse poco a poco.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is an enterprising woman who has operated a business out of the garage of her home for several years. There she sells clothing, accessories, stationery, and household goods. Due to her financial situation, she was obligated to generate income for her family’s needs. In order to increase her income, she currently sells fast food on the weekends outside of her variety store.

At 53 years of age, Luz Mery dreams of having a better future, so she wants to expand her business. She plans to buy a large stock of accessories, clothing, and stationery so that she can increase her profits. However, she does not have the necessary funds to make these purchases. For this reason, she is requesting a loan today that will help to improve her sales, satisfy more customers, and increase her income. As a result, her quality of life will improve considerably and her dream of having a more peaceful and stable future will start to take shape a little bit at a time.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, and stationery.

loans.name: Flor De Retama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE RETAMAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Domitila. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de leche, costura de mantas, venta de papa, bordados, tienda, artesanía en chompas y mantas.

La señora Domitila,  indica que hace es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de papa por carga) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Flor de Retamas" is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Domitila. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as selling milk, selling blankets, selling potatoes, making embroideries, managing a store, and making handcrafted sweaters and blankets.

Sra. Domitila says that this is the first time she has worked Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation from a promoter. At the moment, she has a business selling potatoes and has been working for several years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy potatoes that have been ordered. She acquires her inventory in La Ceja and later sells her products at the fairs. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Domitila is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Domitila said that she enjoys the health seminars and the loans.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Houénagnon Grégoire

texts.fr: Houénagnon Grégoire est âgé de 39 ans et est marié à Suzanne. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Houénagnon Grégoire vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Houénagnon Grégoire a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Houénagnon Grégoire exerce comme activité la charcuterie (vente de sauce faite de viandes de porc accompagné de pâte de maïs, etc.). De façon  secondaire, Houénagnon Grégoire vend des boissons dans son restaurant. Houénagnon Grégoire s’approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à assurer les diverses charges de sa famille et à subvenir à ses besoins. La clientèle de Houénagnon Grégoire s’agrandit de plus en plus, et compte tenu de peu de ressources dont dispose Houénagnon Grégoire, ce dernier sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Houénagnon Gregory is 39 years old and is married to Suzanne. The couple has four children, all attending school and living under their care. Houénagnon Gregory lives together with his wife and children. He left school at primary level.

For the past ten years, he has been running a business selling food preparations (pork-based sauces accompanied by corn dough, etc.). Secondarily, Houénagnon Gregory sells beverages in his restaurant. He gets his supplies in Benin. This activity provides him with income that helps him to meet his own needs and those of his family.

The number of Houénagnon Gregory's customers is steadily increasing. Given his limited resources he is now seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to enhance his business and better serve his customers.

loans.use: Buy pigs and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ana Argelia

texts.es: Doña  Ana , una mujer trabajadora de  28  años de edad, vive en un Barrio marginal de San Pedro Sula junto a su pareja y su hija de 4 años y medio y se ayudan mutuamente,  el   trabaja de jornalero en una empresa de baterías y con sus ahorros le apoyo  para que iniciara un negocio, al ver  la oportunidad de que enfrente de su casa hay un plantel donde sacan grava y los empleados no encuentran donde comer, es allí donde ella inicia ofreciéndoles  desayunos y almuerzos,  ahora con ODEF  a solicitado un préstamo para ampliar sus servicios y vender también refrescos, churros, dulces etc. Además invertir en arroz, papas, carne todos los insumos para la venta de comida  y de esta manera hacer rendir mas el negocio, surtir de otros productos para su clientela y que le generen mas ingresos para el sostenimiento económico del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard-working 28 year old woman.  She lives in a marginal neighborhood of San Pedro Sula with her life partner and her four and a half year old daughter.  They help each other.  He works as a day laborer for a battery company.  He supported her with his savings so that she could start a business. 

She saw the opportunity in front of her house.  There is an establishment there that works with gravel, and there is no place for the employees to eat.  That is where she started selling breakfasts and lunches.

Now she has requested a loan from ODEF to expand her services.  She will also sell soft drinks, churros, and sweets, etc.  Additionally she will buy rice, potatoes, meat, and all of the ingredients for selling food.  This way she will make her business more productive.  She will stock other products for her customers.  This will generate more income for the financial support of her household.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food and to expand her sweets sales.

loans.name: Santos Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio de 58 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía.

Eusebio desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un peso y una talla ideal para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar animales de otras especies y su alimento respectivo, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta de sus animales puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Eusebio es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es poderle brindar comodidades a su familia y que tenga mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 58 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. They do not receive basic services. Eusebio resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Eusebio has been raising domesticated animals (sheep and goats) for five years. The pens are located in an area behind his house and are spacious and of the appropriate size. His animals are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses. When they have reached the ideal size and weight, the animals are offered at different markets in the area. This allows Eusebio to earn a very good income so that he can cover his daily household expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that he can buy other types of animals and the appropriate feed. The income he generates from the sale of these animals will be used to repay his loan and improve his quality of life. Eusebio is a hardworking and responsible person whose only wish is to provide comforts for his family and to have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy different types of animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Sabrositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SABROSITAS” iniciará el decimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por once integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Miriam.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de repuesto, albañil, venta de flores, venta de verduras, venta de pastillas para toz, venta de ropa americana, pensión, venta de mantas, comidera.
 
La señora Miriam indica que hace seis meses que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, arroz, aceite, etc.) que compra de la Ceja y posteriormente  a la elaboración lo comercializará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sabrositas” is starting its 12th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. This group consists of 11 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Miriam. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as selling spare parts, bricklaying, selling flowers, selling vegetables, selling cough lozenges, selling American clothes, managing a boarding house, selling blankets, and operating a diner.

Sra. Miriam says that she joined a Communal Bank and Pro Mujer six months ago after receiving an invitation from another group member. She currently has a business selling food and has been working for five months. Miriam learned this trade from her mother.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy noodles, rice, oil, and other products. She buys her supplies in La Ceja and then prepares and sells her dishes from her shop. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Miriam is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Miriam says she enjoys the health services at the clinic.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь занимается торговлей женской одеждой на рынке «Малоимущих» в городе Бердянске, где она проживает со своим взрослым сыном. Любовь продает носки, трусы, колготы и т.п. Такой товар всегда быстро реализуется, долго не залеживается и пользуется постоянным спросом. Любовь работает в этой сфере бизнеса уже 10 лет. Ее оборотный капитал составляет 15 000 гривен.  

Любовь планирует использовать кредит в 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара и пополнить оборотные средства. Любовь хочет закупить товар по низкой закупочной цене и удачно его реализовать, предоставив себе самой возможность расширять бизнес дальше. Любовь можно охарактеризовать как постоянного и последовательного предпринимателя. Она всегда вежливо относится к покупателям, находит к ним правильный подход и это неизменно располагает людей приобретать вышеуказанный товар

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Lubov is involved in sales of women's clothing at the "Maloimuschikh" market in the town of Berdyansk, where she lives with her adult son.  Lubov sells socks, underwear, stockings and such.  This merchandise is always sold fast, never sits on the shelf and is in constant demand.  Lubov has been working in this business field for ten years.  Her revolving capital amounts to 15,000 hryvnia.  Lubov plans to use the 12,000 hryvnia loan to expand the merchandise assortment and to refill her revolving funds.  She wants to buy the merchandise at a low price and successfully sell it, thus, providing herself with an opportunity to expand her business further.  Lubov can be characterized as a consistent and thorough entrepreneur.  She always treats her customers politely, finds the right approach to them, and this undoubtedly makes people more likely to buy the above-mentioned merchandise.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of merchandise and refill revolving capital

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила живет и работает в городе Новомосковске. Она – рыночный торговец. Людмила занимается торговлей женской одеждой на одном из местных рынков города, а именно на Славянском рынке.
