Она продает костюмы для женщин, платья, юбки, блузы, свитера. Точка Людмилы расположена очень выгодно, у нее есть свои постоянные клиенты. В этом бизнесе Людмила находится уже более 6 лет. На данный момент у нее в товаре уже 30 000 гривен. 

Людмила планирует закупить на 10 000 гривен женскую одежду на осень-зиму, а именно купить классические женские свитера, платья и пальто для сезонной реализации. Кредит КИВА позволит ей обновить модный ассортимент и увеличить объем продаж.  Людмила знает потребности женщин, она наработала своих клиентов. Она всегда старается учитывать предпочтения и запросы как стройных, так и полных женщин, поэтому предоставляет в своем киоске разные модели для клиенток разной комплекции и с разными вкусами. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Ludmila lives and works in the town of Novomoskovsk.  She is a market salesperson.  Ludmila is involved in selling women's clothing at one of the town's local markets, specifically at the Slavyanskiy market.  She sells suits for women, dresses, skirts, blouses and sweaters.  Ludmila's retail outlet has a good location, and she has her own loyal customers.  Ludmila has been in this business for over six years.  She currently has 30,000 hryvnia invested in her merchandise.  Ludmila plans to use the 10,000 hryvnia loan to buy women's clothing for the autumn-winter, specifically to buy women's sweaters, dresses and coats for seasonal sales.  Kiva's loan will allow her to update the contemporary merchandise and increase sales volume.  Ludmila knows what women want since she was able to attain her customer base.  She always tries to consider preferences and requests from both slim and heavy women and provides various models for clients with different body compositions and taste in her store.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for the autumn-winter, specifically to buy women's classic sweaters, dresses and coats for seasonal sales

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, reside en su casa propia con su espsosa e hijos, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande del departamento de Piura.  Se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

José se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga de Tambogrande a Piura y viceversa, una zona donde predomina la agricultura. Para realizar su actividad cuenta con un camión, el cuales propio y sus principales clientes son los pobladores de la zona donde vive. El ya tiene varios años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

El desea realizar mantenimiento,cambio de algunos repuestos y llantas de su camión ya que está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas, con la finalidad que al tener su carro en buenas condiciones podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.  José es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de seguir saliendo adelante para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old.  He owns the home where he lives with his wife and children.  His home has water and electricity and is located in the urban area of the Tambogrande District in the department of Piura.  He is known for his work in farming, ranching, and craftsmanship.

For a living, José transports cargo from Tambogrande to Piura and vice versa.  This area is mainly used for agriculture.  In order to do his work, he relies on his truck, which he owns.  His main customers are the people who live in his neighborhood.  He has been doing this work for several years now and thanks to it he is able to pay for his family's expenses.

He wants to do maintenance on his truck by changing some parts and the tires because it has been having mechanical problems.  Because he will be able to offer his customers better service with his car in good condition, he thought it would be a good idea to ask for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles.  José is well known and respected by his coworkers who consider him to be a responsible person with the drive to keep moving forward to help his family financially.

loans.use: to change some parts and the tires of his cargo truck

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – из Павлограда. Она занимается торговлей на центральном рынке своего города, реализует постельное белье и покрывала. За счет бизнеса Ирина имеет возможность содержать всю свою семью, помогать детям и постепенно развивать бизнес все дальше. 

Ирина планирует вложить заемные средства в размере 10 000 гривен в закупку разнообразного постельного белья, теплых одеял и пледов для последующей реализации в своем киоске. Имея богатый опыт торговли этим товаром, Ирина понимает, что скоро начнутся праздники и именно поэтому она хочет поменять товар и пополнить свои запасы. Со временем Ирина планирует открыть вторую торговую точку и тем самым расширить свой бизнес. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Irina is from Pavlograd.  She is involved in sales at her town's central market and sells bedding and bed covers.  This business allows Irina to support her family, help her children and gradually develop the business further.  Irina plans to invest the 10,000 hryvnia loan into a purchase of bedding, warm blankets and flannel covers for subsequent sale at her kiosk.  Having a rich experience in sales of these products, Irina understands that due to approaching holidays, she needs to update her merchandise and refill her inventories.  With time, Irina plans to open a second retail outlet and thus, expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bedding, warm blankets and flannel covers for subsequent sale at her kiosk

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina de 32 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace varios años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y no tiene otra competencia cerca de su negocio.  Con esta actividad solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda su familia.

Martina observa que va creciendo favorablemente su negocio, desea seguir ampliándolo con la compra de más mercadería como productos comestibles y abarrotes en general.  Al comprar sus productos en grandes cantidades le ayuda en bajar el precio que paga a su proveedor. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. Martina es muy trabajadora, empeñosa y dedicado frente a su negocio. Desea lograr mayores ingresos para brindarle mejores opciones en la vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Martina is 32 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in her own home.  Her house only has electricity and is located in the rural district of Tambogrande, which is in the department of Piura.  This area is known for farming, ranching, and craftwork.

For several years now, she has had a small grocery store in her home.  There she offers her neighbors and customers from the area everyday products, from basic necessities to groceries in general.  She has an established clientele and no competition close to her business.  This business allows her to pay for her family's expenses.

Martina notes that her business has been growing well and she wants to keep expanding it by buying more merchandise, such as food products and groceries in general.  Buying her products in large quantities helps her lower the price she pays her supplier.  For that reason, she decided it would be a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles.  Martina is very hardworking, determined, and dedicated to her business.  She wants to earn more to be able to offer her family more options in life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as food products and groceries in general, to stock her store

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир - бизнесмен из Белой Церкви.Он торгует мужской обувью на центральном рынке уже 5 лет. Обувь, которую он предлагает покупателям - всегда качественная, наценка у него небольшая. Не так давно Владимир приобрел киоск и теперь ему больше не нужно тратить лишние средства на аренду помещения. Было время, когда Владимир ездил на заработки в Россию, но потом понял, что лучше работать в своей стране и стал заниматься развитием своего собственного бизнеса.     

Владимир надеется использовать кредит КИВА в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести 40-60 пар зимней обуви и разнообразить ассортимент своего товара перед тем, как покупатели придут на рынок в поисках добротной и качественной обуви. Владимир хочет и дальше заниматься этим бизнесом, зарабатывая себе на жизнь и обеспечивая свою семью всем необходимым. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Vladimir is an entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov.  He has been selling men's shoes at the central market for five years.  Shoes that he offers to customers is always of high quality, and his add-on is not high.  Recently, Vladimir bought a kiosk and now no longer needs to spend extra money on leasing a space.  There was a time when Vladimir traveled to work in Russia, but then realized that it is better to work in this country and focused on developing his own business.  He hopes to use the Kiva loan of 20 000 hryvnia to buy 40-50 pairs of winter shoes and expand his merchandise selection prior to customers coming to the market in search of durable and quality shoes.  Vladimir wants to continue running this business, earn a living and provide his family with all of the necessities.

loans.use: to buy 40-50 pairs of winter shoes and vary the merchandise assortment

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitilda, de 47 años, es una mujer buena y alegre, convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Solo uno de ellos vive con ella, ya aún estudia. Juntos habitan en casa de su  Madre. El trabajo de Domitilda, consiste en la venta de frutas regionales, pues diariamente sale a la vereda de su casa y ahí exhibe las deliciosas frutas seleccionadas por ella misma, cuando son comprados en el mercado mayorista regional. Y durante la noche expende comida regional, desde las 5pm empieza con la preparación de sus alimentos, como: patasca, pollo a la parrilla, chorizo ahumado, tacacho, Juanes, comida que solo en esa región se consume. Tiene diez años realizando este trabajo, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Disfruta mucho cocinar además que recibe ingresos que eso la convierte en una mujer independiente. Solo espera ampliar mas adelante su negocio y montar un espacio para vender golosinas. Este será el crédito número 18 con MFP, ella es socia fundadora de este banco comunal y creció mucho desde el primer préstamo recibido. Por ello se siente agradecida con ustedes por la confianza que le han dado. y ahora espera de su apoyo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará golosinas en general ya que esta empezando a montar este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Domitilda is 47 years old and is a good and happy woman who lives with her partner and they have three children who are older and independent. Only one of them lives with her as he is still in school. They live in her mother’s house.
 
Domitilda sells regional fruit. Every day she goes to the path outside her house and there she displays her delicious fruit, which she selected herself when she bought them at the local wholesale market.

In the evening she sells local food. She begins at 5:00 PM with the preparation of the food such as pork stew with corn, grilled chicken, smoked sausage, grilled banana and bacon balls, Juanas (chicken, rice, spices, olives, and boiled eggs, wrapped in a bijao leaf and boiled)—food that is only eaten locally. 

She has been doing this work for ten years and up until now has done it alone. She enjoys cooking very much and she also likes earning income that gives her independence. She wants to enlarge her business and to put together a space for selling sweets. This will be her 18th loan with MFP. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she has grown a lot since receiving her first loan. She feels grateful to you for the trust you have placed in her, and now waits for her help. She will use the money from the loan by and large to buy sweets and is already beginning to try out this new activity.

loans.use: to buy sweets

loans.name: Araceli Veronica

texts.es:
Araceli de 30 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la zona urbana del distrito de Paijan, una zona agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra situada en el departamento de La Libertad.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio ubicado en su domicilio de la zona donde vive desde hace un año. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, como productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brindan. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar en el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Araceli desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio teniendo en cuento la creciente demanda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, comprando más productos comestibles para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Araceli is 30 years old, married, and lives together with her husband and three children in the urban area of Paijan district.  This is an area where people farm and raise livestock, in La Libertad department.

Araceli has had a small business located in her home for one year.  There she offers her customers a range of products that they use every day such as basic household products and groceries.  Her business is very popular owing to the good quality of the products that she sells and the good customer service that she provides.  She uses the income from her business to help financially support her family.

Araceli would like to acquire more products to expand her business, bearing in mind her current demand.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she plans to use to meet her customer demand, buying more food products with which to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy more food products and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Juan desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas, cerdos y aves), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de alimento balanceado y sanidad de sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Juan es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar a su familia adelante y brindarle otras oportunidades en la vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 46 years old, lives with his wife and children in their own house. The house, which does not have basic services (utilities), is located in the rural zone of the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the Piura department.  In this zone people work in agriculture, livestock-raising, and handicrafts.

For several years Juan has raised and sold barnyard animals (sheep, pigs, and poultry). His pens are located behind his house, and they are suitable and big enough. He feeds the animals with balanced feed and natural grains so that they have an ideal growth and he can offer them for sale at the different markets in the zone and thus obtain good earnings to pay his family obligations.

He has applied to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 PEN for the purchase of balanced feed to produce healthy animals. With the earnings that he will obtain from the sale of his animals, he will be able to cover his loan as well as have a better quality of life. Juan is a person who with effort and much determination has known how to raise his family and offer his children other opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and raise healthy animals.

loans.name: Nonvignon 9 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON 9 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amis et qui exercent le même métier. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le représentant du groupe du nom de Michel Sounwin est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Michel Sounwin est âgé de 26 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Yénoukoumè. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Michel Sounwin a arrêté l’école au cours primaire et a appris la coiffure, activité qu’il exerce depuis quatre ans et qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges familiales et de répondre à ses besoins. Dans l’optique de mieux équiper leur salon de coiffure par l’acquisition de nouveaux matériels de coiffure, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, Michel Sounwin  et les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 9 sollicitent un deuxième prêt auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit permettra certainement à l’ensemble du groupe d’accroître leur chiffre d’affaires et leur revenu.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON 9 is a group composed of three persons who are friends and all practice the same trade. It's the second time that this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to expand their businesses and better meet the demand of their clientele. The leader of the group, Michel Sounwin, is the one raising his hand in the photo. 

Michel Sounwin is 26 and is married to a small-scale retailer named Yénoukoumè. The couple are raising three children, of whom two are their biological children. Some of the children are enrolled in school. 

Michel Sounwin stopped school at the primary level and learned hairdressing, a trade he has been practicing for four years and which allows him to support his family and address his own needs. In view of better equipping their hairdressing salon by buying new hairdressing equipment so as to better respond to the needs of their clientele, Michel Sounwin  and the other members of the group called NONVIGNON 9 are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will certainly permit the group to grow their receipts and their income.

loans.use: to buy clippers, wheeled chairs, and a mirror.

loans.name: Yissegnon 1 Group

texts.fr: YISSEGNON 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même  quartier. La représentante du groupe, Laure (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un couturier nommé Pascal. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge. L’un des enfants n’est pas scolarisé.Laure vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Laure a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs cinq  ans, Laure mène comme activité la vente des savons et des conserves. Laure s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin.C’est la troisième fois que Laure et les autres membres du groupe YISSEGNON 1 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
YISSEGNON 1 is a group of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Laure, who is raising her hand in the photo, is 29 and married to a tailor named Pascal. The couple are raising two children. One of the children doesn't attend school. 

Laure lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting the family. Laure went to school for only a short time. For about five years, she has been selling soap and tinned foods. She buys her supplies in a market in Bénin. It is the third time that Laure and the other members of her group called YISSEGNON 1 are requesting a loan from ALIDé in view of growing their working capital and their businesses so as to better respond to the needs of their clientele. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy soap and tinned food.

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es: Eldith, de 51 años, es una mujer buena y muy responsable, ella crió y educo a sus hijos siendo madre soltera, ahora tiene a sus hijos mayores e independientes. Tiene una casa propia el cual comparte a lado de sus dos hijos y la familia de uno de ellos. El trabajo de Eldith consiste en la venta de ropa y cosméticos por catálogo, su especialidad son las colonias y perfumes. Ella sale a la calle en busca de amigos, vecinos y familiares para vender alguna prenda, además aprovecha para vender cosméticos y perfume en general. Tiene 10 años realizando esta actividad, y lo hace sola,  ya que ella ahora solo vee por sus gastos, puesto que sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Por ahroa le esta yendo bien, ya que no genera muchos gastos y lo que vende le alcanza para pagar sus cosas personales. mas adelante desearía montar un negocio que es la venta de zapatos para la siguiente campaña escolar. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, le esta yendo bien con su grupo y se siente cómoda de poder trabajar juntos ya que le es de mucha ayuda los prestamos recibidos para poder aumentar su capital y trabajar mejor. Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos para tener en stock, entre ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
51-year-old Eldith is a good woman and a very responsible woman.  She raised and educated her children as a single mother.  Her children are now grown up and independent.  Eldish has her own home which she shares with her two children and the family of one of them. 

Eldith's work consists of selling clothes and cosmetics through a catalog.  Her specialty is cologne and perfume.  She goes out into the street in search of friends, neighbors and family members to sell her clothes to.  She also makes the most of the opportunity and sells cosmetics and perfume as well.  She has been in this business for 10 years and works alone because now she only has to take care of her own expenses as her children help her with the household expenses.  Right now her business is doing well as she doesn't have many expenses and what she sells serves to cover her personal needs.  In the future, she would like to set up a business selling shoes for the next school year.

This will be Eldith's third loan from MFP.  She is doing well within her group and she feels comfortable working together.  The loans she receives are very helpful to her as they allow her to increase her capital and work better.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy more products to have in stock (clothes and cosmetics).

loans.use: to buy more clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Jonathan's Group

texts.es:
Jonathan's group está conformado por tres personas (hombres). En este grupo el presidente es Jonathan, que tiene 21 años es soltero y tiene un hijo de 3 años. Vive en San Gabriel con sus padres y su hijo. Se considera una persona muy trabajadora.

Trabaja con sus padres en su negocio de Tapicería, empezó a trabajar desde que tuvo a su hijo ya que necesitaba cuidarle y mantenerle. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de cuero para realizar los tapizados, que le ayudará a tener una productividad y mejores ingresos.

Su sueño es poder tener sucursales de su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y así mantener a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jonathan's group is made up of three men.  This group's president is 21-year-old Jonathan who is single and has a 3-year-old son.  He lives in San Gabriel with his parents and his son.  He considers himself to be a very hard-working person.

Jonathan works with his parents in an upholstery business.  He started working when his son was born as he needed to care for him and support him.  This is the first loan that he has requested from Fodemi and he will use it to buy leather for making upholstery.  This will help him to improve his productivity and his income.

Jonathan's dream is to be able to have more branches of his business so that he can improve his income and thereby provide for his son.

loans.use: to buy leather for making upholstery

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Manuel le está haciendo falta los acabados del interior y exterior.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material que es (cementó, arena, pintura para el interior y el exterior, ya que se encargará de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. Se dedica a la construcción tiene ya más de 20 años en este oficio de la construcción. 
Con una parte del  salario que recibe de sus trabajos planea pagar el crédito, es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Don Manuel y su esposa la señora Rosavelia, viven solos ya que sus hijos están casados y tiene su propia familia.  Desean mejorar la calidad de vida y el patrimonio de ellos dos.
texts.en:
Manuel’s house needs both interior and exterior work.  He’s asking for the loan just to buy building materials and supplies (cement, sand, interior and exterior paint) since he’ll do the work himself in his free time from work.  He works in construction and has more than 20 years’ experience in this occupation.  He will use part of his salary which is his family’s source of income to repay the loan.

Manuel and his wife, Rosavelia, live alone because their children are all married and have their own families.  They want to improve their quality of life as well as their main asset.

loans.use: to do interior and exterior work on the house.

loans.name: Missimide 3 Group

texts.fr: MISSIMIDE 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et mènent certaines activités ensemble. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien nommé Calixte. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Antoinette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Antoinette n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs quinze ans, Antoinette prépare de la bouillie de maïs accompagné de gâteaux (faits à base de farine de blé) dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Antoinette  vend divers autres articles. Antoinette achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la cinquième fois que Antoinette et les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE 3 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MISSIMIDE 3 is a group of three persons who all reside in the same district and have certain common activities. The representative of the group,  Antoinette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 46 and is married to a mechanic named Calixte. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school and in their care. Antoinette lives together with her husband and her children. The couple share in supporting their family. 

Antoinette did not attend school. For about 15 years, Antoinette has been preparing maize porridge with cookies (made of wheat flour) in a town in  Bénin. Secondarily, she sells various other articles. She buys her supplies in Bénin. It's the fifth time that Antoinette and the other members of the group called MISSIMIDE 3 are requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to add to their working capital and grow their businesses so as to better serve their clientele.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Afepeb (Missebo)1 Group

texts.fr: AFEPEB (MISSEBO)1 est un groupe constitué de cinq personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Gwladys Olivia Afiavi. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Hubert. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leurs charge. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi vit avec sa famille et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges du ménage. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Gwladys Olivia Afiavi  mène comme activité la vente de chaussures à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi achète ses produits au Bénin et au Togo. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Gwladys Olivia Afiavi et aux autres membres du groupe AFEPEB (MISSEBO) 1,de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
AFEPEB (MISSEBO)1 is a group made up of five persons whose representative (the one raising her hand in the photo) is named Gwladys Olivia Afiavi. The members of the group all live in the same neighborhood. Wishing to grow their working capital, this group is asking for a loan from ALIDé for the third time. Gwladys Olivia Afiavi is 30 and is married to a carpenter named Hubert. The couple are raising two children, both enrolled in school. 

Gwladys Olivia Afiavi lives with her family and shares the responsibility of supporting their family with her husband. She left school at the secondary level. For some ten years, she has been selling shoes out of her home. This business brings in money that she uses to contribute to covering family expenses. She buys her products in Bénin and in Togo. This third loan will certainly allow Gwladys Olivia Afiavi and the other members of the group called AFEPEB (MISSEBO) 1, to raise the level of their businesses and grow their clientele and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Afepeb (Gbegamey) Group

texts.fr: AFEPEB (GBEGAMEY) est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un troisième prêt. La représentante du groupe, Houenangnon Abibatou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans. Houenangnon Abibatou est mariée à un peintre du nom de Jean-Marie. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant. Houenangnon Abibatou vit ensemble avec son mari. Houenangnon Abibatou a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Houenangnon Abibatou vend des tissus et des plateaux d’œufs frais dans son quartier. Houenangnon Abibatou mène cette activité depuis six ans, ce qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, Houenangnon Abibatou sollicite, avec les autres membres de son groupe AFEPEB (GBEGAMEY),un troisième crédit. Les crédits précédents ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AFEPEB (GBEGAMEY) is a group of four persons who all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. In order to raise the level of their businesses and meet the demand of their clientele, this group came to ALIDé to request a third loan. The representative of the group, Houenangnon Abibatou (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 32. Houenangnon Abibatou is married to a painter named Jean-Marie. The couple don't have any children yet.

Houenangnon Abibatou lives together with her husband. She was barely able to attend school. To meet her needs, she sells cloth and trays of fresh eggs in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for six years and it brings in considerable income. Wishing to expand her business and better respond to the growing demand of her clientele, she is requesting a third loan, together with the other members of her group called  AFEPEB (GBEGAMEY). The prior loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy trays of fresh eggs and lengths of cloth.

loans.name: Las Flores De Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS FLORES DE NUEVO AMANECER” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro de Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de mantas, venta de muebles, venta de dulces, venta de comida, venta de polleras.

La señora María  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles usados que viene trabajando hace un año atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de su tío. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de muebles.) que comprará de las barracas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su local. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención.
texts.en: The 'Las Flores de Nuevo Amanecer' community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office. This group has six members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Maria. The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling blankets, selling furniture, selling sweet treats, selling food and selling polleras (traditional skirts). Maria tells us that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer which she joined through an invitation from a loan officer. She currently has a business selling used furniture. She has been in this business for one year and learned the trade from her uncle. Maria will use this loan to increase her capital (buying furniture). She will buy her products in builders' yards and then sell them from her sales location. This work allows her to make the money she needs to support her family. She is married and has six children. When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Maria replied that she likes the service.

loans.use: to buy [used] furniture

loans.name: La Gran Esperanza 3 Group

texts.en:
Juliane is one of the members of the group named La Gran Esperanza "The Big Hope" 3. They sell mainly in the city of El Seybo, a farming community in the northeast of the country. It is one of the poorest communities, where the majority of the inhabitants are Haitian immigrants who came to the Dominican Republic with the goal of improving the quality of their lives.

Juliane has a grocery stand which she operates from her house. It is a modest home that she shares with her 4 children and her long-term partner. Juliane has been living in the country for several years, ever since she emigrated to the Dominica. She is currently in receipt of her 8th loan with Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner).  She has managed to repay and invest her previous loans to expand and increase her business.

Juliane plans on investing this loan in the purchase of snacks, juice, cookies, sweets, and other appetizers. One of her dreams is to buy or build a house. She plans to save her business benefits to make this dream come true. Juliane is thankful to all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy snacks, juice, cookies, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María, de 31 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, esta casada, su esposo trabaja como ayudante en una joyería, tiene 2 hijos 8 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, el mayor ya esta en tercer grado de primaria, ella es comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Antes que se dedicara al mundo del comercio ,era ama de casa y dependía del salario de su esposo pero un día ella decidió que tenia que ser  mas independiente y  traer ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos y tener un mejor nivel de vida ,mejorar las condiciones de su casa, comenzó a vender ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante se dedico a esta actividad durante tres años después con sus  ahorros que tenia y los ingresos de la venta de ropa y cosméticos puso la pulpería ya tiene 2 años de tenerla . 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, productos de limpieza, dulces, snacks, productos enlatados. Ya que con esta inversión de capital podrá comprar, ofrecer más productos y brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela. Uno de sus sueños es poder remodelar su casa, por lo pronto esta ahorrando para invertir en comprar mas vitrinas y estantes para poner en exhibición sus productos.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and lives in the city of León.  She is married and her husband works as an assistant in a jewelry store.  María has two children who are 8 and 3 years old.  Her eldest is in third grade.  María is a retailer.  She owns a grocery store.  Before she started working in the world of commerce, she was a housewife and depended on her husband's salary.  However, one day she decided that she had to be more independent and bring in some income so that she could provide for her children, enjoy a better standard of living and improve the condition of her home.  She started selling clothes and cosmetics as an itinerant street vendor and did that for three years.  Then, with the savings she had and the income she made from selling her clothes and cosmetics, she set up a grocery store, which she has had for two years now.

María needs this loan to buy basic grains, soda, cleaning products, sweet treats, snacks and canned products.  With the investment of this capital, she will be able to buy more products, sell more products and offer her customers a better service.  One of her dreams is to remodel her house.  Right now she is saving up so that she can invest in buying more display cabinets and shelves to display her products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, cleaning products, sweet treats, snacks and canned products

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es: El señor Francisco, 56 años de edad, originario de  Corinto municipio de Chinandega, pero vive en León, es padre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos son profesionales y el ultimo esta cursando el tercer año de la secundaria. El es comerciante, tiene un humilde establecimiento de auto lavado, donde con sus propias manos y herramientas manuales lava carros , es muy servicial , atento a pesar que su local no es un sitio nada lujoso ni con comodidades modernas para lavar autos es buscado por taxis y vehículos privados para que el les haga la limpieza semanal,  el antes de tener este negocio era chofer de vehículos privados esto lo hizo por mas de 30 años y conoce de mantenimiento y limpieza da autos , es por ello que sus clientes lo buscan para solicitarle sus servicios, ya tiene dos años con este negocio, y lo puso por la falta de trabajo en la que estaba y sobre todo porque todavía le falta un hijo por preparar pues el quiere que sea un profesional al igual que sus hermanos así que por ello busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia de manera honrada y digna. El requiere el préstamo para comprar aspiradora, manguera, desinfectantes, jabones, toallas, spray aromáticos para realizar, cera para carros, que son parte de las herramientas de  limpieza de los autos  las cuales el necesita para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pues el desea poder tener una mejor infraestructura de su negocio, pintarlo, ponerle piso para poder ser mas atractivo a los clientes y salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
56-year-old Francisco is originally from Corinto, in Chinandega, but he lives in León.  He is the father of three children.  Two of his children are professionals and the youngest is in his third year of high school.  Francisco has a humble car-wash establishment where, with his own hands and manual tools, he washes cars.  He is very obliging and attentive, despite the fact that his establishment is not at all fancy and doesn't have modern conveniences for washing cars.  He is used by taxi drivers and private vehicle owners who have him carry out their weekly clean.  Before he had this business, he was a driver of private vehicles.  He did this work for more than 30 years and knows how to maintain and clean cars.  For this reason, his customers seek him out to request his services.  He has had this business for two years and he set it up because he didn't have a job and, above all, because he still has one child to support who wants to become a professional, like his siblings.  For this reason, Francisco looked for a way to support his family in an honest and decent manner.

Francisco needs this loan to buy a vacuum cleaner, hose, disinfectants, soaps, towels and aromatic sprays to clean and wax cars.  These are some of the cleaning tools that he needs to provide his customers with a better service.  He would like to be able to have better infrastructure in his business, painting it and laying some flooring, so that it can be more attractive to his customers and help him to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner, hose, disinfectants, soaps, towels and aromatic sprays for cleaning and waxing cars

loans.name: Ricardo  Jose

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene la edad de 37 años, con su propio negocio, una vulcanizacion con un año de trabajarla, pues anteriormente, tenia negocio de billar, pero no tenia  ganancias, lo que toma la decision de cambiar totalmente, para lograr recuperar la inversion perdida. Que ahorro en su periodo de trabajo, asi como aporte de la familia.
Es soltero, vive junto con su familia,  lo que aporta al hogar, hoy en dia, esta contento por lograr sus propios ingresos, ya que por años laboro en una joyeria en un mercado de la capital, lo cual viajaba todos los dias, por que vive a cuarenta kilometros de la capital.
Toma la iniciativa de un financiamiento para la instalacion de un baño e inodoro en su cuarto, logrando tener espacio y privacidad para su persona.en donde comprara inodoro, tubos para aguas negra, pegamento, piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, entre otros para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 37, has a business of his own: a tire repair shop that he’s had for a year.  He used to have a pool hall but it wasn’t profitable so he decided to totally change to recuperate the lost investment.  He supported his family with savings he’d earned from work.

He’s single and lives with his family and contributes to the household.  Today, he’s happy to be earning his own income because he worked for years in a jewelry store in a market in the capital that he had to travel 40 kilometers each way daily to get to.

He takes the initiative of a loan to install a bathroom and a toilet in his room to have more space and personal privacy.  He will buy the toilet, sewage pipes, adhesive, stone, sand, cement and metal rods, among others, to start the project.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and install a toilet for more comfort and privacy.

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer emprendedora que ha trabajado durante 17 como comerciante, labor que aprendió gracias a su familia que desde que ella era una niña se han dedicado a este trabajo, actualmente Gladys tiene una miscelánea donde ofrece gran variedad de productos como ropa, zapatos, productos de papelería, y otras variedades que sus clientes requieren, sueña con sacar su negocio adelante y ofrecerle a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

A sus 42 años de edad, y con la ilusión de ver crecer su negocio Gladys quiere comprar mercancía al por mayor para surtir el negocio, con insumos como: Zapatos, sandalias y cosméticos, pues estos productos son de gran demanda en las ventas, pero debido a la difícil situación económica Gladys no cuenta con la suma de dinero necesaria para comprar un buen surtido que le deje mejores utilidades por lo que solicita un préstamo para hacer dichas comprar obtener las ganancias generar mas ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked as a retailer for 17 years.  She learned this business thanks to her family who have been in this line of work since she was a little girl.  Gladys currently has a general store where she sells a wide variety of products such as clothes, shoes, stationery products and other items that her customers need.  She dreams of making progress in her business and offering her two children a better quality of life.

At 42 years of age, and with the hope of seeing her business grow, Gladys would like to buy merchandise wholesale so that she can stock her business.  She will buy products such as shoes, sandals and cosmetics as these products sell well.  However, owing to her difficult financial situation, she doesn't have the money she needs to buy a good selection of products which will make her better profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can make her purchases, make a profit, make more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics and other products with which to stock her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 34 años, es una mujer alegre y muy dinámica, le gusta mucho trabajar y encuentra en todo lo que hace una manera de ganarse la vida. Ella esta casada y tiene seis hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia, en donde comparten la armonia y buenas costumbres. El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de golosonas, actividad que lo hace de manera ambulante. Es así que diariamente se establece en las afueras de los colegios, que es ahí sus pequeños clientes la buscan para comprar algún producto. De esta manera su trabajo lo separa por horarios, durante la mañana, tarde y noche, que son los tiempos en que entran y salen de estudiar los alumnos. Tiene cuatro años en esta actividad y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola, además le gusta mucho éste trabajo ya que tiene tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos, sin emabrgo le parece muy agotador tener que caminar de un colegio a otro. Espera mas adelante, poner un negocio en su casa que le permita estar ahí generando ingresos para su hogar sin tener que dejarlo tan seguido. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más golosinas para su venta, además algunos ingredientes, insumos y materiales para empezara vender comida en su casa.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old.  She is a cheerful and very dynamic woman who really enjoys working.  She finds a way of earning a living in everything she does.  María is married and has six children.  They live together in their own home where they share family harmony and good habits.

María's business is selling candies as an itinerant street vendor.  Every day she sets herself up outside schools where her small customers seek her out to buy her products.  She carries out her work at different times of the day (mornings, afternoons and evenings) as these are the times that the students go to school and come home from school.  María has been in this line of work for four years and, up to now, she has worked alone.  She very much enjoys this work as it gives her time to care for her children.  However, it is very tiring having to walk from one school to another.  She hopes, in the future, to set up a business in her home which will allow her to be at home and make income for her household without having to go out all the time.

This will be María's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your support.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy more candies to sell.  She will also buy some ingredients, supplies and materials so that she can start selling food from home.

loans.use: to buy more candies and also raw materials for making and selling food

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: El Sr. Porfirio es casado con la Sra. Betty  viven en la zona Pampahasi que esta ubicada a veinte minutos del centro de la ciudad de La Paz, su ultimo hijo menor trabaja como chofer en el sindicato de la zona, el Sr.  Porfirio se dedica a la costura de botas y botines para mujeres en un pequeño taller que tiene instalado en su casa. Don Porfirio trabajaba en una fábrica donde aprendió a realizar estos calzados y desde hace varios años que ya tiene su propio taller. En este momento don Porfirio no tiene una máquina desvastadora la cual ayuda a desgastar el cuero por los bordes para poder manipular este material al momento de realizar la costura y es de esta manera que solicita este préstamo para poder comprar esta máquina. Uno de sus mayores anhelos es poder ampliar su taller y así de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Sr. Porfirio is married to Sra. Betty. They live in Pampahasi which is located 20 minutes from the city centre of La Paz. His youngest son, who is still a minor, works as a driver for the local union. Sr. Profirio is a cobbler and makes boots and ankle boots for women in a small workshop he has at home. Don Porfirio used to work at a factory where he learned to make these shoes and he has had his own workshop for several years now. At the moment, Don Porfirio does not have a skiver machine which helps to bevel the leather at the edges so that it is easier to handle when making the seams. This is why he is asking for a loan in order to buy a skiver machine. One of his greatest desires is to expand his workshop and be able to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a skiver machine.

loans.name: Kelin Jahayra

texts.es: Kelin de 26 años de edad,  vive en una zona periférica de San Pedro Sula. Tiene  dos hijos de 1 y 4 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio, junto con su esposo,  de venta de cocos de manera ambulante. Este  negocio inicio por consejos de un amigo de su esposo, quien le dijo que generaba buenas ganancias.  Entonces decidieron esforzarse mucho. El compra los coco y ella lo prepara, luego lo trasladan en una bicicleta con freezer.  Ya tienen un  lugar donde estacionarse  que es estratégico para la venta,  enfrente del edificio del Seguro social. Sus ventas han sido buenas y le han  generado ingresos para el hogar. Ahora ya no sufren de hambre como antes. Con el fin de seguir creciendo solicitó un préstamo a ODEF para comprar una bicicleta mas y salir a vender los dos a distintos lugares.
texts.en:
Kelin, age 26, lives in an outlying area San Pedro Sula.  She has two children, ages one and four.

She has had her business for three years.  Together with her husband she sells coconuts in an itinerant manner.  She started this business on the advice of a friend of her husband.  He told her that it would generate good income. They decided to put forth great effort.

He buys the coconuts, and she prepares them.  Then they transport them on a bicycle with a freezer.  They have a place where they park, and it is a strategic place for sales.  It is in front of the Social Security building.

Their sales have been good, and they have generated income for the household.  Now they do not suffer from being hungry like before.

In order to continue growing she has requested a loan from ODEF.  She will buy another bicycle and use both bicycles to sell in different places.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle with a freezer.

loans.name: Katty

texts.es: Doña Katty es una clienta con 42 años de edad, divorciada, tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales vive solamente con uno. Es muy trabajadora y tiene visión empresarial. Cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en la Fundación y siempre se ha caracterizado por su reponsabilidad y puntualidad. Tiene su negocio de pizzería en su misma casa, ubicada en un buen punto de la comunidad. Ella junto con una hija son las que realizan la actividad. Cuenta con contratos en ocasiones especiales con asociaciones de diferentes bananeras que hay en el lugar. Actualmente necesita invertir en equipo de trabajo para mejorar la calidad del servicio express que ofrece.
texts.en: Doña Katty is a 42-year-old borrower. She is divorced and has four children, of whom only one lives with her. She is very hard-working and has an entrepreneurial vision. She has a considerable history with the foundation and has always been characterized by her responsibility and punctuality. She has a pizzeria in her own house, located at a good spot in the community. She and one of her daughters are the ones who work in the business. She has contracts for special occasions with associations of various banana workers in the area. Now she needs to invest in some equipment to improve the quality of her express service.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and invest in her business

loans.name: Sr. De Pampacucho Ccochirhuay Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Sr. de Pampacucho Ccochirhuay” y se reúnen  cada treinta días en la comunidad de Ccochirhuay del distrito de Qolcha de la provincia de Paruro del departamento Cusco. El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora, artesanos y comerciantes. El grupo está conformado por diez integrantes y son varias vez que solicitan un préstamo de la Asociación Arariwa y el dinero lo invertirán para mejorar sus negocios. 

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Patricia, ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y se levanta muy temprano para atender su tienda. Desde joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable y amable y por ese motivo sus vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. 

Patricia en sus horas libres se dedica a elaborar artesanía de tipo tejido, ella realiza estos trabajos en su domicilio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para poder abastecer su tienda. (En la fotografía la socia Patricia está levantando la mano).
texts.en:
The group is called “Sr. de Pampacucho Ccochirhuay” and they meet every 30 days in Ccochirhuay in the district of Qolcha in the province of Paruro in the departament Cusco. The communal bank stands out for being made up of working people, artisans and merchants. The group has 10 members and they have asked Asociación Arariwa for loans on various occasions. They will invest the money in improving their businesses.

At this meeting we met Señora Patricia. She has a small grocery store in her home selling staples. She gets up very early in the morning to take care of her store. From an early age, she was known for being a responsible and friendly person which is why her neighbours invited her to join the communal bank.

In her spare tiime Patricia weaves fabric. She does this work at home and she is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. At this time she is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store. (In the photo the member Patricia is the one with the raised hand).

loans.use: to buy more merchnadise.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 66 años, es una señora buena, amable y muy responsable, es viuda y madre de tres hijos quienes ya son mayores y tienen su propia familia. Su corazón es muy grande, ya que por ahora tiene a su cargo un niño de 10 años a quien cría por que su familia lo abandono. Juntos vive en su casa. El trabajo de Norma consiste en diversas actividades, pero tiene dos principales, la primera es la costura, por lo que tiene un pequeño taller en su casa, ahí llegan sus clientes en busca de remendado en sus prendas; y la segunda es la venta de cosméticos. Ambas actividades lo realiza desde hace 15 y 10 años respectivamente y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de tiempo para dedicarse a otras actividades y a su hogar. Le esta yendo bien en todo y tiene buenos ingresos, gracias al esfuerzo que hace en colocar sus productos y remenndar las prendas de sus clientes lo más rápido que puede. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, y espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con sus negocios. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales para continuar con la costura, entre ellas, telas, hilos, elásticos, blondas, cierres. Asimismo comprará cosméticos y productos de belleza para tener en stock y ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Norma  is 66 years old. She is good woman, friendly and very responsible. She is a widow and mother of 3 who are already adults and have their own families. She has a big heart as at the moment she is taking care of a 10 year old boy who was abandoned by his family. Together they live in her house. Norma has several business activities but the two main ones are sewing from a small workshop she has at home where she serves the cutomers who call on her to have their clothes mended, and selling cosmetics. She has been doing both jobs for 15 and 10 years respectively and up until now she has worked alone. What she likes about her work is that it allows her time to pursue other activities and to take care of her house. She is doing well with all her activities and has a good income, thanks to the effort she makes in placing her products and mending her customers clothes as fast as she can.This will be her 3rd loan with MFP and she hopes to receive the support of all of you to continue with her businesses. With the money requested she will buy what she needs to continue sewing such as fabrics, thread, elastic, laces, zippers. She will also buy cosmetics and beauty products to have them in stock and offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, laces, zippers and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Doña Rosa, de 60 años, es una humilde comerciante , dueña de una mini pulpería, nació en Chinandega pero tiene 55 años de vivir en León , es madre de 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, independientes , ella crio a sus hijos sola, su nivel de estudio es básico solo curso hasta cuarto grado de primaria , ella trabaja desde muy joven , pues ella se crio en el campo y aprendió a trabajar en labores domesticas propias del campo como es elaborar y vender tortillas esta actividad la realizo durante 25 años ese fue su primer negocio pero dejo esta actividad debido a problemas de salud fue entonces que decidió poner una pulpería ya tiene 10 años de tenerla y con esta actividad termino de preparar a sus hijos y darle estudios que ella no pudo tener. Realizo el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, huevo, jugos, enlatados, detergentes, jabones, aceite, dulces, galletas, pan. Ya que estos son parte de los productos que ella ofrece y sus clientes le piden, además desea tener mas surtidos su negocio para que el cliente encuentre lo necesario y se sienta a gusto, su próximo paso es hacerle mejoras a su hogar  pues antes no invirtió en reparaciones a su hogar porque tenia que ahorrar para darle estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en: Doña Rosa is 60 years, a humble merchant and owner of a minimart. She was born in Chinandega but has been lived in Leon for 55 years. She has 6 children, all adults and independent. She brought up her children on her own. She has a 4th grade education and has worked from an early age as she was raised in the countryside and learned the domestics chores relevant to the area such as making and selling tortillas. She did this for 25 years and this was her first business. However, she left this due to health probelms and it was then that she decided to set up a grogery store. She has had this store for 10 years and with this business she fiinished raising her children and giving them the education she was unable to receive. She asked for a loan to buy dry grains, lemonades, eggs, juices, canned goods, detergents, soaps, oil, sweets, cookies and bread, as these are some of the products that she sells and her customers ask for. She also wants to have a bigger variety so that her customers can find what they need and feel at home. Her next step is to make home improvements not previoussly invested in as she had to save to pay for her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, lemonades, eggs, juices, canned foods, detergents, soap, oil, sweets, cookies, bread.

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Perseverantes” lo conforman 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran confección de ropa, venta de cosméticos, preparación de comida rápida, artesanía, preparación de ensaladas y atención de un minimarket, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Maritza delegada del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo de pie, de derecha a izquierda, su cabello es color negro y se encuentra tomado, además viste una chaqueta color blanco con azul.
Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 30 años.
Su taller de trabajo se encuentra al interior de su casa en un dormitorio que habilitó para realizar sus costuras. Su taller cuenta con dos maquinas de coser una de estas es una recta industrial y la otra es una overlock. También presta sus servicios a empresas confeccionando overoles. 
Durante esta temporada se encuentra confeccionando manteles y bombachos para mujeres, temporada de muy alta demanda.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes sectores para abaratar costos, entre estos se encuentran el barrio Meiggs e Independencia. Últimamente también está comprando los moldes en una feria libre.
Con el crédito comprará una maquina multipunto y dos motores para maquinas. 
Las metas para su negocio son comprar un maquina bordadora, ya que pretende aumentar su número de producción de bolsas de párvulos, para bordar diseños y nombres. De esta manera también captar un mayor número de clientes. 
Maritza vive junto a su marido y su hija de 28 años de edad, quien trabaja de manera dependiente. Sus sueños a nivel personal son postular al subsidio habitacional para obtener su casa propia, ya que actualmente arrienda. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y de esta manera podrá aumentar su producción, lo que le permitirá generar mayores ganancias.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Los Perseverantes”. It consists of 20 entrepreneurs who run different businesses such as garment manufacturing, cosmetic sales, fast food preparation, crafts, salad-making and managing a minimart among others. They are all from the city of Valparaiso. 

Maritza is a member of the communal bank and can be seen in the photo standing at the back, from right to left, with black hair and wearing a white and blue jacket. She has been making garments for 30 years. She has a workshop inside her house in a bedroom which she converted for sewing. Her workshop has two sewing machines, one of which is an industrial straight and the other an overlock. She also takes orders from companies making overalls. This season, she has been making shawls and baggy trousers which have been in very high demand. She buys her materials in different places to save on costs; these include the Meiggs and Independencia neighbourhoods. Lately she has also been buying the patterns at an open air market. With the loan she will buy a multipoint sewing machine and 2 motors for machines.

The goals for her business are to buy an embroidery machine as she wants to increase her stock production of nursery bags, to embroider designs and names. In this way she also captures a larger number of customers.

Maritza lives with her husband and her daughter who is 28 years old and who is self-employed. Her dreams at the personal level are to apply for a housing subsidy for home ownership as she is currently renting.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan obtained by Fondo Esperanza as it has allowed her to invest in her business and in this way to increase production which will allow her to generate more profits.

Valparaíso is located 120 kms to the northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the seat of legislative power in the country. It is the nation's main port and offers a wide variety of beautiful and picturesque places such as the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, Nobel Prize winner.

loans.use: to buy a multi-point sewing machine and 2 motors for machines.

loans.name: Javier Ludwin

texts.es: Javier es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, vive junto a su esposa en la zona de Pampahasi ubicados a treinta minutos del centro de la ciudad. Javier y su esposa tienen una tienda de abarrotes que atiende ella y él se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en una  calle de la zona,  La ropa usada que vende la trae desde la cuidad de Oruro y ya trabaja con esta actividad desde hace varios años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de abarrotes como ser fideo, azúcar y arroz para surtir su tienda Es la primera vez que Javier trabaja con préstamos de emprender, pero esta recomendado por su madre quien es clienta antigua y muy puntual de nuestra institución. Uno de los mayores anhelos de Javier es poder ahorrar el suficiente dinero para que en un futuro pueda comprar una casita propia ya que actualmente vive en la casa de su Madre.
texts.en:
Javier is a young and very hard-working person.  He lives together with his wife in Pampahasi, thirty minutes from the city center.  Javier and his wife have a grocery store in which his wife works.  Javier sells used clothes in a local street.  He goes to the city of Oruro to buy the used clothes that he sells and he has been in this business for several years.  He will use his loan money to buy groceries such as noodles, sugar and rice with which to stock his store.

This is the first time that Javier has worked with loans from Emprender.  He was recommended by his mother who is a long-standing and very punctual client of our institution.  One of Javier's biggest wishes is to be able to save up enough money to buy a little house of his own in the future as he currently lives in his mother's house.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as noodles, rice and sugar

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
A sus 45 años de edad Jesús Antonio es un padre consagrado a su familia, un trabajador incansable y un emprendedor ejemplar, desde hace años tiene su propio negocio, una panadería que inició con la ilusión de sacar a su familia adelante, ser independiente y generar buenos ingresos para las necesidades económicas de su familia. Actualmente la panadería es una empresa familiar, allí trabaja su hijo mayor y espera que en un futuro su negocio sea el mejor legado que sus hijos tengan de él. 

Jesús Antonio espera ampliar su negocio, tener más capacidad productiva y paralelamente la mejor calidad del mercado, sin embargo necesita comprar insumos para la producción y preparación de los alimentos como: harina, azúcar, huevos y otros que son indispensables para que los productos queden esquicios, y él no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertirle a su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprar dichos insumos, mejorar las ventas, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 45 years of age, Jesús Antonio is a man who is devoted to his family.  He is a tireless worker and an exemplary entrepreneur.  He has owned his own business for years.  His business is a bakery which he set up with the hope of getting his family ahead in life, becoming independent and making good income with which to cover the financial needs of his family.  His bakery is currently a family business.  His eldest son works there and he hopes that, in the future, his business will be the best inheritance he can give to his children.

Jesús Antonio hopes to expand his business, to have more productive capacity and, at the same time, to offer the best quality on the market.  However, he needs to buy supplies for making and preparing his products, such as flour, sugar, eggs and other supplies which are essential for his products to be delicious.  He does not have the capital he needs to invest in his business and so he is requesting a loan to buy these supplies, improve his sales, increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and preparing his products, such as flour, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
A sus 43 años de edad Adriana es una microempresaria dedicada a la fabricación de productos artesanales, afirma haber tenido muy buena afinidad para este arte desde pequeña, aun así hasta hace 6 años, que tomo clases de pintura, se dedicó del todo a crear su empresa, en la cual cuenta con el apoyo de sus 3 hijos y su esposo, el cual es militar pensionado del ejército de Colombia.
Actualmente Adriana solicita un préstamo que le permita surtir su negocio con materiales e insumos nuevos, de manera que pueda  innovar, realizando para la época de Diciembre una buena producción de artículos navideños en tela, y así mejorar sus ventas, sus ingresos y proporcionalmente su entorno de mercado, ya que su sueño es que sus productos sean reconocidos en el sector, que cada vez los clientes sean mas y que su calidad de vida mejore notablemente.
texts.en:
Forty-three year old Adriana is a micro-entrepreneur whose work is making handicraft items, and she says she has had an inclination towards the arts since she was a child, as early as 6 years old. She has had art classes and puts everything into growing her business, and she has the help of her 3 children and her husband who is retired from the Colombian army. 

Adriana is applying for a loan in order to stock her business with materials and buy new supplies, so that she can create and complete by December a good quantity of Christmas items made of cloth, and thus increase her sales, her income and correspondingly her market share. Her dream is that her products become known in the industry and that her clients buy more and that her quality of life markedly improves.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and raw materials to make handicraft items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to the premises such as buying a refrigerator and to supply her business

loans.name: Josefa Nuvia

texts.es:
Doña Josefa sigue con el comercio de venta de ropa y zapatos, carteras de dama, con varios años en las ventas, sus ventas las hace al contado y al credito, su esposo sigue trabajando en operaciones de comunicación, dos de sus hijos cursan el año escolar y un bebe de cuatro meses. Lo que sus  ventas las hace en su casa, y muchos por encargos.
Sus prestamos han sido, para compra de productos, y mantener al cliente sastifecho con la variedad. Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento, sera para la compra  ropa de dama, pantalon de vestir, carteras, cosmeticos, por docenas, y poder tener mejores ventas, ya que tiene mas gastos por su hermoso bebe. y que es atraves de estos prestamos,  mantiene  el equilibrio de su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefa continues selling clothes, shoes and women’s purses; she has several years in sales.  She sells on credit and for cash.  Her husband continues working in communications operations.  Two of her children are in school and she has a four-month-old baby.  Her sales take place at home and many are based on prior orders.

Her loans have been to buy merchandise to keep her customers satisfied with the variety.  This new loan will be to buy women’s clothes, dress pants, purses, cosmetics by the dozen to improve sales because she has more expenses now due to her beautiful baby and it’s through the loans that she maintains her business stability.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.es:
Jeffrey tiene 32 años es casado, vive con su mujer en Otavalo que se encuentra en la provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador. Se describe como una persona luchadora y muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante todos los días.

Jeffrey trabaja solo en su casa en la elaboracion de artesanías como son las flautas de madera (tunda). Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que se va a invertir en la compra de tubos de madera (tunda) que es la materia prima para la elaboración de flautas, esto le ayudará a que su producción aumente lo que generará un buen número de ventas y sus ingresos se incrementarán lo cual le ayudará para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es poder tener una familia y un buen taller propio para compartir sus habilidades con las demás personas.
texts.en: Jeffrey is 32 years old and married. He lives with his wife in Otavalo, in Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador. He describes himself as a tenacious and very hard-working person who enjoys getting ahead in life every day. Jeffrey works alone at home making handicrafts such as flutes. This is the second loan that he has requested from Fodemi and he will invest it in buying wood cane (tunda) which is the raw material he uses in making his [traverse] flutes. This will help him to increase his production and make a good number of sales. His income will increase, which will help him to improve his quality of life. Jeffrey's dream is to be able to have a family and to have a good workshop of his own so that he can share his skills with other people.

loans.use: to buy wood cane (tunda), a raw material for making flutes

loans.name: Roberto Enrique

texts.es:
En las Peñitas uno de los lugares mas turísticos y visitados por los turistas localizado en la ciudad de León , habita el señor Roberto , de 39 años de edad un sencillo comerciantes, dueño de una pulpería que administra junto con su esposa , es padre de tres hijos 16,12 y 8 años de edad, todos ellos están en a escuela. Don Roberto toda su vida ha sido comerciante, el ha sido vendedor ambulante desde los 19 años de edad, ha trabajado todo tipo de electrodomésticos, bisuterías, ropa, zapatos, utensilio del hogar. El puso una pulpería desde hace 8 años que su esposa administra, el trabaja también como vendedor de electrodomésticos a una empresa, de esta manera es que se gana la vida diariamente.
El realizo este crédito para comprar dulces, sopas, jugos, agua, gaseosas, pan, arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, huevos, carne, productos de limpieza. Pues estos son parte de los productos que requiere y más buscan sus clientes y con el crédito se ayudara a surtir mejor su pulpería. El desea poder construir su casa para que sus hijos vivan en un lugar digno y con las condiciones básicas y necesarias para vivir.
texts.en:
In the Peñitas, one of the most visited tourist sites in the city of Leon, lives Roberto a 39 year old simple merchant, an owner of a small grocery store that he and his wife run together. He is the father of three children who are 16, 12, and 8 years of age, with all of them in school. 

All his life Roberto has been in business. He has been a street vendor since he was 19 years old, and has worked with all types of appliances, costume jewelry, clothing, shoes, and house utensils. He has had a grocery store for 8 years that his wife manages, and he works also selling appliances, and this is how he earns his daily bread.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy sweets, soups, juices, water, soda, bread, rice, sugar, oil, beans, eggs, meat, and cleaning products. These are some of the products that he needs and are most requested by his customers and with the loan he can better supply his store. His dream is to be able to build a house for his children so they can live in a decent place in an environment of a basic and normal life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soups, juices, water, soda, bread, rice, sugar, oil, beans, eggs, meat, and cleaning products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more junk.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene  58  años D. edad, está separada y tiene ocho hijos, siete D. ellos son independientes.

Trabaja más D. doce años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artículos artesanales.  Nos cuenta que también se dedica a la venta D. comidas y animales menores como chanchos.

Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1300.00 nuevo soles, comprará, diez sacos D. arroz, azúcar, fideos, papa, chuño, lana D. diferentes colores para los bordados 

La señora desea continuar con el negocio, lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la alegría D. las socias y el compartir con ellas.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Santa Rosa D. Lima communal bank in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department.  She is 58 years old, separated, and has eight children.  Seven of them are independent.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for over 12 years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles.  She invested that money in her business of selling handicrafts.  She tells us that she also sells food and small animals like pigs.

With this new loan for 1,300 soles she will buy ten sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, potatoes, potato flour, and different colors of woolen yarn for embroideries.

She wishes to continue with the business.  What she likes about her communal bank are the meetings, the members’ happiness, and sharing with them.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, potatoes, potato flour, and different colors of woolen yarn.

loans.name: Banco Mujer La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Priscilla es una mujer muy joven de 19 años de edad y madre de un niño de apenas 2 meses de edad, con quién vive junto a su compañero, ella terminó la secundaria pero desea seguir estudiando y no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para continuar, por eso quiere formar una pequeña empresa, para ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar y terminar sus estudios superiores, y ve en Fundación Mujer una oportunidad de lograrlo, este es el primer crédito que solicita, y va a invertir en la cría y venta de cerdos, se enteró de los servicios de la organización por medio de las compañeras del Banco Mujer.
La actividad que va a desarrollar es la porcicultura y cuenta con la ayuda de su compañero y la de su suegra que tiene mucha experiencia en el cuido de animales, Priscilla sabe que debe organizar muy bien un horario de trabajo ya que tiene que cuidar a si hijo que está muy pequeño. 
Ella tiene muchos sueños y metas que desea cumplir , entre esas están mejorar la calidad de ella y su familia, aumentar los ingresos económicos del hogar , y llegar a ser una profesional muy exitosa, y está segura que la mejor manera de lograrlo es la buena administración de los financiamientos.
