Justina es una persona trabajadora que también estudia en un instituto superior la carrera técnica de computación e informática. Su sueño de la Justina es estudiar la carrera profesional de educación inicial. 

Justina agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Justina belongs to the "San Isidro de Compone" communal bank. Every 30 days, meetings are held in the city of Izcuchaca in the Compone community. 

Justina is 21 years old, single, and has no children. She was born in the city of Cusco and still lives and does business there, producing jumpers for children ages 3 to 5. She's been in business for two years already and it's going very well for her thanks to the determined effort she puts into the work. 
At the moment, Justina needs this loan to buy more merchandise, such as cloth. Justina is a hard-working person who also attends the Instituto Superior studying computer and information science.  

Justina's dream is to earn a professional degree in early childhood education. She is thankful for and appreciates this loan and is committed to meeting her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as cloth.

loans.name: Bertha Marisol

texts.es: En Quezalguaque municipio de León, donde la actividad agrícola es parte de la actividad diaria de los habitantes de este sector, vive Bertha, de 37 años, la encontramos acomodando  a los cerdos de su finca, que son parte de las tareas propias de la mujer agrícola de esa zona, ella es madre de 2 adolecentes de 12 y 14 años de edad, ambos están en la secundaria. Ella inicio con capital propio, comprando cerdos para criarlos y venderlos, al mismo tiempo trabajando en una tortillería, poco a poco fue especializándose en lo que es crianza y venta de cerdos, es por medio de esta actividad que mantiene a su hogar ya que ella es madre y padre para sus hijos. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cerdos de crianza, para vender, ella desea convertirse una distribuidora  de cerdos mayoristas conocida en su comunidad, darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bertha, age 37, lives in Quezalguaque, in the municipality of León, where agricultural activity is a daily part of life for residents. She can be found tending after the pigs on her farm, which is all part of a day's work for women farmers in this area. She is the mother of two teenagers, ages 12 and 14, both of whom are in school. 

She began with her own startup funds, buying pigs to raise and sell, while at the same time working in a tortilla shop. Little by little, she has become an expert at raising and selling pigs, which is how she sustains her home, as she serves in the role of both mother and father for her children. 

She needs this loan to buy young pigs to sell and aims to build herself into a well-known purveyor of mature pigs in her community. In this way, she hopes to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase children's clothing and accessories for her store.

loans.name: Cristhian José

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San André se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a Cristian, el es un joven muy trabajador, tiene 20 años de edad, está soltero, y espera seguir trabajando para en un tiempo poder formar su propia familia.

El se dedica a la venta de pescado, recorre la ciudad en un triciclo de su propiedad  que adquirió con uno de los créditos que recibió de la institución. Trabaja de tres a cuatro días a la semana   desde las 05h00 hasta las 14h00. Él se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar el pescado directamente en las playas a los pescadores, lleva dos años en este negocio y le va bastante bien. En los días que tiene libre hace trabajos de albañilería.
 
Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar más pescado para la venta.  Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante creciendo en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San André communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi (Portoviejo) Canton, which is well known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its nationally and internationally recognized artisanship. It is famous for its straw hats. This is where Cristhian lives. He is a very hardworking young man, age 20 and single. He hopes to continue working in order to someday be able to start his own family. 

He sells fish, making runs around the city on his own tricycle cart, which he acquired with one of the loans that he took out through the communal bank. He works between three and four days a week from 5:00 am to 2:00 in the afternoon. He goes down to the city of Manta to buy fish straight from the fishermen on the coast. He has been in this business for two years and it's going well enough for him. On his off days, he does masonry work. He will use this loan to buy more fish for sale. This is his fifth loan with Fundación ESPOIR [Kiva field partner], which he appreciates it for the help it provides through its loans. 

His dreams are to keep on growing his business and in his personal life.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es: Don Juan de 58 años de edad, nació en León, de oficio comerciante, es soltero, dueño de una pulpería, su nivel de estudio solo es el segundo grado de primaria. Inicio con su negocio hace 9 años, muy a pesar de no tener hijos, tiene unas sobrinas a las cuales el ayudo a criar y son quienes le han ayudado a poner su pulpería, de esta actividad sobrevive pues a su edad es muy difícil que le dan trabajo pero eso fue motivo para detenerse así logro poner su humilde pulpería. La cual al llegar es pequeña pero la atención es amable y calurosa. El requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan , leche , huevo, jugos, gaseosas, mantequilla, carne de pollo y res, enlatados, dulces, jabones, detergentes, cloro. El desea en lo futuro convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora en general donde tenga de todo para suplir las necesidades de su barrio.
texts.en:
Don Juan Rafael, age 58, was born in León, is single, and is the owner of general store. He only reached the second grade. 

He started his business nine years ago. Regretful of not having any children of his own, he does have some nieces who he helped raise and who have helped him to set up his store. He makes a living through this business, given that at his age it's quite difficult to get other work. That's why he wound up establishing his humble store, which is small but offers kind and welcoming service. He needs this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, milk, eggs, juice, soft drinks, butter, meat, canned foods, sweets, soaps, detergents, and bleach. 

He hopes to someday build his store into a general distributor supplying everything needed to meet the basic needs of his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, milk, eggs, juice, soft drinks, butter, meat, canned foods, sweets, soaps, detergents, and bleach.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for making traditional food

loans.name: Alcione

texts.es:
Alcione pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Alcione tiene 63 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es contadora profesional y trabaja de forma independiente y su oficina está ubicada en su domicilio. 

Alicione también se dedica a la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos de chompas de lana de alpaca y oveja. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en el trabajo. En esta oportunidad Alcione requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y oveja. 

Alcione agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Alcione belongs to the “San Isidro de Compone” communal bank. Every thirty days members of the bank meet in the city of Izuchacha in the community of Compone.

Alcione is 63 years old. She is married and has two children. She was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the city of her birth, where she carries out her business. She is a professional accountant and works independently. Her office is located in her house.

Alcione is also involved in the sale of handicrafts such as woven sweaters made from alpaca or sheep wool. She has dedicated herself to this business for several years and it is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into the work. Alcione needs the loan in order to buy more merchandise such as alpaca and sheep wool sweaters. She is thankful, appreciates the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as alpaca and sheep wool sweaters.

loans.name: Favio Ramon

texts.es: El señor  Favio, de 62 años, vive en la ciudad de León, tiene 3 hijos, dos son mayores de edad, el ultimo tiene 11 años de edad esta en la escuela cursando su primer año de secundaria. Don Fabio es taxista, es muy personaje muy pintoresco según lo describen sus compañeros de trabajo, ya que con música y alegría sale a buscar pasajeros para transportarlo en diferentes punto de la ciudad, antes el se dedicaba a trabajar en un taller de soldadura pero al cumplir 40 años comenzó a trabajar como taxista actividad de la cual sobrevive y además su esposa lo ayuda, ya que en su hogar tiene una pulpería que es su segunda fuente de ingresos. El requiere el préstamo para mejorar las condiciones de los asientos, mantenimiento del motor, comprarle un juego de llantas a su  taxi. Con esta inversión podrá mantener en buenas condiciones su carro y transportar a sus pasajeros con más seguridad. Uno de sus planes en lo futuro es comprar otro taxi y también hacer crecer la pulpería.
texts.en:
Señor Favio, aged 62, lives in the city of León.  He has three children, two of whom are adults.  The youngest is 11 years old, and is in his first year of secondary school. 

Don Favio is a taxi-driver.   According to his work colleagues, he is a very colorful character who look for passengers to drive to different parts of the city with music and joy.  Previously he worked in a soldering workshop, but when he reached 40, he began working as a taxi-driver.  He's done well in this activity, and his wife helps out as she has a small general store in their home which is a second source of income.

He is requesting the loan to improve the condition of his seats, to conduct maintenance on his engine, and to buy a set of tires for his taxi.  With this investment he will be able to keep his car in good condition, and transport his passengers more safely.

One of his plans for the future is to buy another taxi and to also grow the general store business.

loans.use: to improve the conditions of his seats, to do maintenance on his engine, and to buy a set of tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to extend the laundry room

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Laura tiene 23 años de edad y tiene una hija de dos meses de nacida, ella nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la comunidad de Compone y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de leche y criana de animales menores. Laura es una persona trabajadora y estudiosa. Actualmente, Laura estudia la carrera profesional de derecho en una las universidades particulares más prestigiosas de la ciudad del Cusco. Su sueño de Laura es ser notaria pública.   

En esta oportunidad Laura requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado. 

Laura agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Laura belongs to the communal bank San Isidro de Compone and meetings are held every thirty days in the city of Izcuchaca in the community of Compone. Laura is 23 years old and has a daughter two months old. She was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the community of Compone where she works. 

She sells milk and breeds small animals. Laura is a hard-working person and a scholar. She is studying law in one of the most prestigious private universities in the city of Cusco. Laura’s dream is to become a notary public. 

Laura is asking for a loan in order to buy cattle.

She is thankful and grateful for the loan and promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more articles of clothing for her business.

loans.name: María Evangelista

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  de la cual tiene cinco hijos ya todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende artesanías como sillas, muebles y adornos para el hogar, ella compra en Montecristi a los artesanos de esta ciudad y luego una o dos veces por semana lleva a entregar a Guayaquil y otras ciudades donde son apreciados estos productos y donde vende  a muy buen precio. La Señora María es también muy inteligente ya que una vez que está en estas ciudades compra ropa, bisutería y utensilios de cocina los mismos que lleva a vender por su ciudad natal, lleva en este negocio por más de 20 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene clientes fijos.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar artesanía como sillas, muebles y adornos para el hogar para llevar a entregar a Guayaquil. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
  
Su sueño  tener un camión para llevar sus productos a otros lugares del país.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Aníbal San Andrés meets every fifteen days in the Canton Montecristi (Portoviejo), known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts that are recognized on a national and international level.  It is the home of the famous straw hats.  

In this place we met the lady María, who is 54 years old of age, and is in a common law marriage from which she has five children, already all of legal age, one of whom still lives in at home.  Her husband is a merchant.  

She sells crafts such as chairs, furniture and decorations for the home.  She buys them in Montecristi from the artisans of this city and then one or two times a week she brings them to Guayaquil and other cities where these products are appreciated and where she sells them at a very good price.  María is also very intelligent since once she is in these cities, she buys clothes, costume jewelry and kitchen utensils which she brings back to her hometown to sell.  She has been in this business for more than 20 years and it has always gone very well since she has regular customers.  

She will use this new loan to purchase handicrafts such as chairs, furniture, and decorations for the home to deliver to Guayaquil.  She has been with the Communal Bank since its start and she likes it for the benefits that she receives from the institution.  

Her dream is to have a truck to use to carry her products to other places in the country.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables, and decorations for the home.

loans.name: Bitia Yorleny

texts.es:
Yorleny tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, la cual pertenece a la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde unos anos que Yorleny desea hacer unos cambios en su casa, es por eso que para ella es una gran oportunidad el formar parte de esta Empresa de crédito. 

Actualmente Yorleny está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢200.000 (doscientos mil colones) para  poder comprar materiales de construcción específicamente tablilla, para asi arreglar el techo de su hogar. Con esto el espera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ya que su deseo estar más tranquila, que sus hijos vivan más cómodos y tengan un techo digno.

Yorleny es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Francisco, una de las 150 organizaciones socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Yorleny is 33 years old and lives with her spouse and children in a community called San Carlos, in Costa Rica's second largest province, Alajuela. This is a zone which stands in first place nationally for coffee and sugar cane production. It also produces staple foods (rice, beans, corn), fruits, vegetables, root crops and leafy greens. Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important in the country, is also located in this province.

For the past few years, Yorleny has been wanting to make some changes to her house, and for this reason, joining this credit group was a great opportunity for her. 

Currently, Yorleny is requesting a microloan of ¢200,000 (two hundred thousand colones) so that she can buy construction materials, specifically pieces of sheeting, so that she can fix up the roof of her house. With this, she hopes to give her family a better quality of life. Her desires are to have more peace of mind, to help her children live more comfortably, and to give them a proper roof. 

Yorleny is a member of the San Francisco communal bank, one of EDESA's 150 partner organizations in Costa Rica. She plans to continue growing on a personal and economic level, and to participate actively in her community's credit organization.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Maria Maxima

texts.es: La señora María es cliente antigua D. la institución ella vive en casa familiar en la zona D. las Carmelitas en Cota Cota, la Sra. Máxima se dedica a la repostería en su misma casa ya que ella tiene  su tienda donD. realiza sus tortas galletas  y quequesitos,  ella es muy conocida por la zona por las ricas masas que prepara doña máxima es casada con el Sr. León quien ya se jubilo por lo que le ayuda con las compras D. los ingredientes sus hijos ya son mayores y cada uno ya realizo su viva aparte ella esta solicitando el crédito para  la compra D. insumos como harina arroz azúcar para la elaboración D.  pásteles.
texts.en: The lady María is a longtime client of the microfinance institution.  She lives in the family home in the zone of the Carmelites in Cota Cota.  María Máxima works as a baker in her own home in which she has her store where she makes cakes, cookies and cupcakes.  She is very well-known in the area because of the rich desserts that she makes.  María Máxima is married to León who is already retired so he helps her with purchasing the ingredients.  Their children are already grown and each of them live elsewhere.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies such as sugar and flour for the preparation of cakes.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica tiene un hijo de 4 años vive en la casa de sus abuelos en la zona de Chacacollo, ella se dedica a la venta de almuerzo y por la tarde otros platos especiales,  atiende su puesto de lunes a domingo su esposo se dedica al servicio de transporte, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una cocina e insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas ya que tiene mucha clientela por la buena comida que ofrece y también por la buena atención que la Sra. brinda ya que la Sra. es una persona muy amable, se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Verónica has a four-year-old son, and lives in her in-laws' home in the Chacacollo area.  She works preparing lunch and in the evening makes other special dishes.  She works in her job from Monday to Friday.  Her husband works in transportation.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of a stove and supplies for preparing her meals, as she has many customers who come for the good food she offers and also for the good service that she provides.  The Señora is a very friendly woman, who is grateful to the financial institution for the support that's being provided.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: German

texts.es: El señor  German es cliente nuevo que esta en su primera secuencia de  su crédito esta casado con la señora  Elizabeth  tienen dos hijos que están en la edad escolar  y viven en casa propia   en la zona de  vino tinto de la ciudad de La Paz, el préstamo  invertirá en la compra de harina y azúcar  por quintal  los cliente trabajan sacrificadamente de lunes a domingo desde horas 5:00 de la mañana hasta  21:00 horas se sienten  muy contentos por ser otorgado con el crédito Kiva, el deseo del Sr. German es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en: German is a new client who is in the process of his first loan. He is married to Elizabeth and they have two school age children. They live in their own home in the red wine zone of the city of La Paz.  The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of flour and sugar by the quintal.  These clients work sacrificially from Monday to Sunday from 5:00 in the morning to 9:00 at night.  They feel very happy to be offered the Kiva loan. German's desire is to see his children become professionals and people of goodwill.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar.

loans.name: Artem

texts.ru:
Артем женат, имеет дочь 5 лет. Раньше работал в строительной компании инженером, но потом решил заняться своим бизнесом.

Артем - владелец небольшой компании, которая предоставляет услуги такси. В его распоряжении несколько машин, на которых работают наемные водители. Для нормальной работы машин требуется постоянный уход и ремонт. Артем хочет взять кредит для проведения ремонта своих машин, чтобы клиенты чувствовали себя более комфортно, т.к. в этом бизнесе постоянные клиенты делают хорошую прибыль.  

Артем очень трудолюбив и предприимчив. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес дальше и приобретать больше машин для такси. В то же время, он рассматривает и другие перспективные направления в бизнесе, например, производство очищенной воды.
texts.en:
Artem is married and has a five year old daughter. He used to work in a construction company as an engineer, but then decided to start his own business.

Artem is an owner of a small company which provides taxi services. He owns several cars which are used by hired drivers. A constant care and repairs are required for the cars to work well. Artem wants to take out a loan to do repairs on his cars so that his customers will feel more comfortable because in this business regular customers bring most profit.

Artem is very hardworking and business-oriented. He wants to grow his business further and buy more cars for the taxi. At the same time he is also looking at some other promising trends in business such as production of filtered water.

loans.use: to make the current repairs on his car.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория замужем, имеет одну дочь. Вот уже 14 лет, как она занимается своим бизнесом - продает женскую одежду на одном из рынков города Запорожье. У Виктории хорошее торговое место. Она предлагает качественный товар по доступным ценам, что привлекает новых и удерживает постоянных покупателей. Ее клиенты - женщины 45-55 лет. Мало кто на рынке работает с этой возрастной группой, поэтому у Виктории мало конкурентов и бизнес идет хорошо.

Виктория просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку зимних теплых курток. Она планирует получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Victoria is married and has one daughter.  She has been involved in her own business for 14 years and sells women's clothing at one of the markets of the town of Zaporozhye.  Victoria has a good retail location.  She offers quality merchandise at affordable prices, which attracts new customers and retains loyal ones.  Her clients are 45-55 year-old women.  Hardly anyone at the market works with this age group, and this is why Victoria has little competition, and her business is going well.  Victoria is requesting a loan for the purchase of warm winter jackets.  She plans to make additional profits and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase winter jackets

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She provides manicure and pedicure services to the people in her community. Sometimes she also accepts hairstyling and make-up jobs. She does her best to help provide for her family. 

Elisa requested this loan to purchase nail polish, cuticle remover and other manicure/pedicure materials. She hopes to have her own beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: buy manicure/pedicure supplies

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced. Her kids are grown. Tatyana runs a small female clothing sales business in her hometown of Kahovka. She also travels to small neighboring towns in the Kherson region, selling clothing merchandise as well. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, Tatyana was forced to find new ways to support and feed her family, which motivated her to launch this small vending venture. Tatyana worked really hard to see her trade succeed. Presently, she has 40,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. 

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to increase her inventory of assorted merchandise that she offers for sale. She wants to increase her sales and income as a result. Tatyana always says she enjoys being self-employed and would never trade it for any other job.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventories - winter coat and sweaters.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz raises pigs for a living. She lives in Tagbilaran City, Bohol,  with her family.  Luz has a backyard piggery that she hopes to expand soon.  She also sells rice to the people in her community.

Luz requested this loan to purchase feed for her pigs and rice to sell.  She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: buy pig feed and rice

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is a married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She raises pigs for a living. Celerina has been in this kind of business for 8 years. She works hard to support her family. Aside from raising hogs, she also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community. 

Celerina requested this loan to purchase pig feed and raw ingredients such as rice, flour and sugar.  In the future, she hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: buy pig feed and ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 12 years old. Her husband works as a Barangay official and a chainsaw operator.

Anabella has been in the business of raising hogs for 9 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. Anabella would like to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Analeza

texts.en:
Analeza is 25 years old. She is a married woman with a 1-year-old child. She lives in the town of Cortes, Bohol, with her family.

Analeza has been in the business of raising hogs for a year. She also raises chickens. Analeza plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feeds. Analeza does her best to support her family. She plans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Cristina is a married woman with six children aged between 2 and 15. Cristina's husband makes hollow blocks for a living.

Cristina has been making baskets for 15 years. She uses buri and rattan palms to make baskets. Cristina earns about 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month with her business. Cristina plans to use her loan to purchase more buri and rattan palms. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more buri and rattan palms.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 42 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 15 years old. Delia makes rice cakes, lumpia (spring rolls) and other local delicacies. She sells her products to the people in her community. Delia also buys and sells dried fish. She requested this loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, lumpia wrappers and more dried fish to sell. She hopes for her business to improve.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar, lumpia (spring roll) wrappers and more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 30 years old and married. She has 3 children aged 6, 4 and 2. Her husband works as a carpenter and driver.

Elisa is a food vendor. She makes lumpia (spring rolls), banana and camote cues, rice cakes and other local delicacies. She also sells coconut juice with milk to the people in her community.  

Elisa earns 3200 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase ingredients such as bananas, sweet potatoes, oil, sugar and others. Elisa hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
48-year-old Felomina is a married woman with 6 children. The oldest child is 26 years old. Her husband works as a farmer.

Felomina has been in the business of raising pigs for 5 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. Each month, Felomina earns 3000 PHP with her business. Felomina hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 33 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. Her oldest child is 15 years old.

Luzviminda buys and resells Cignal Digital TV, a satellite television service provider in the Philippines. She has been in this kind of business for 3 years.

Luzviminda earns 4000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase 1 set of Cignal Digital TV.   Luzviminda hopes to succeed with her business.

loans.use: buy a Cignal Digital TV set

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is 47 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 24 years old. Mauricia's husband is a farmer.

Mauricia sells barbecue to the people in her community. She marinates pork and chicken meat in the morning to sell in the afternoon. She also raises chickens to produce and sell eggs. 

Mauricia requested this loan to purchase pork and chicken meat and feeds. She hopes for her business to improve.

loans.use: buy pork and chicken meat and feeds

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
41-year-old Monica is a married woman with 3 children, aged 13, 11 and 7. Monica and her husband run a bakery. They work together to make bread and sell their products to the people in their community. This business has been running for 3 years. 

Monica has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, butter and other ingredients. Monica hopes for their business to grow bigger.

loans.use: buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 41 years old and is a married woman with 8 children aged between 13 and 28.  Her husband works as a welder.

Sheila has been in the business of basket-making for 15 years. She uses buri and rattan palms to make baskets. She works hard to support her family. 

Sheila requested this loan to purchase more buri and rattan. She hopes for her business to improve.

loans.use: buy buri and rattan to make baskets

loans.name: Ndéye   Fama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme marié , mère de deux enfants.Elle exerce le commerce de produits cosmétiques,de tissus et de vetements pour dames et enfants.Cette activité lui permet non seulement de se prendre en charge mais aussi de soutenir son mari dans les dépenses familiales. A l'approche de la fete de Tabaski, elle sollicite un pret de 100 000F pour acheter du tissus basin et des habits afin de profiter de la forte demande de la période.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une boutique au marché.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman and the mother of two children. She sells cosmetics, fabrics, and ladies and children's clothes. This business allows her not only to take care of herself but also to support her husband with their family expenses. With the Tabaski (Eid al-Adha) holiday approaching, she is requesting a loan for 100,000 francs to buy damask fabric and clothes so that she can make the most of the high demand during this period. Her ambition is to open a store in the market.

loans.use: to buy damask fabric and clothes

loans.name: Niyonkuru K1 Group

texts.fr:
Thérèse est une commerçante âgée de 46ans qui habite  la Commune Gatumba de la Mairie de la Ville de Bujumbura. Elle vend divers produits vivriers comme l’huile, le sel, le sucre, les oignons, le riz, le haricot depuis 9 ans. Elle était fonctionnaire de l’Etat avant de commencer cette activité. Elle est détentrice du Diplôme A2 en Technique. Elle est mariée a Gordien, un chauffeur mécanicien et ont ensemble 2 enfants qui étudient. Elle prend aussi en charge 2 orphelins de parente proche et assure pour eux les frais de scolarité.

Le crédit Kiva  de 200,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de produits vivriers (l’huile, le sel, le sucre, les oignons, le riz, le haricot) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et ainsi accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« NIYONKURU 1».
texts.en:
Thérèse is a 46-year-old retailer who lives in Gatumba, in Bujumbura.  She sells a range of food products such as oil, salt, sugar, onions, rice and beans.  She has been in this business for nine years.  Before starting this business, she was a civil servant.  She has an A2 diploma in technical subjects.  She is married to Gordien, a driver/mechanic and they have two children who are in school.  Thérèse is also responsible for two orphans from her immediate family and she covers their school fees.

This Kiva loan for 200,000 Burundian francs will allow her to increase her capital and buy large quantities of food products (oil, salt, sugar, onions, rice and beans) to re-sell in order to make large profits and thereby increase her savings.

Thérèse is a member of the Niyonkuru 1 community bank.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy large quantities of food products (oil, salt, sugar, onions, rice and beans) to re-sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy large quantities of home products (plates, pans, thermos flasks and glasses) to re-sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy lots of children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Niyonkuru 2 Group

texts.fr:
Godefride est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite  la Commune de Gatumba en Mairie de la Ville de Bujumbura. Elle vend de la bière industrielle depuis 17 ans. Elle vendait l’huile de palme avant de commencer cette activité. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est veuve et mère de 5enfants dont 2 maries et 3 autres étudient.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bière locale à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et ainsi accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« NIYONKURU 2»
texts.en:
Godefride is a 40-year-old trader who lives in Gatumba, in Bujumbura.  She has been selling commercial beer for 17 years.  Before starting this business, she used to sell palm oil.  Godefride did not attend school.  She is a widow and has five children.  Two of her children are married and three are in school.

Godefride will use her Kiva loan for 250,000 Burundian francs to increase her capital and buy large quantities of local beer for resale.  This will make her good profits and she will increase her savings.

Godefride is a member of the 'Niyonkuru 2' community bank.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy large quantities of local beer for resale

loans.name: Gabool

texts.en:
Gabool is a 29-year-old-woman who is married and a mother of three children. She lives in Sana'a where she completed her secondary school and high diploma, in spite of family financial challenges and a hard life.

Gabool started her business, which is a Beauty Salon for women, three years ago with the expectation that she would be able to meet her own needs and her children's. She tirelessly worked in her salon and attracted new clientele to the extent that she hired another woman to help her. Her living conditions improved and so did her income.
 
The expansion of Gabool's clients made her in need of funding to purchase more beauty supplies. She applied for her first loan from AMB and repaid it successfully. Now Gabool took her second loan amounting to 80,000 Rials from AMB in order to purchase more beauty supplies for her salon. In the future, Gabool intends to expand her business and hire another woman to replace her. She is also saving for her children in order to enroll them in a private school.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and other beauty supplies

loans.name: Kuña Pukavy Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Pukavy se conformó este año, con mucho esfuerzo ya se encuentran en el segundo ciclo. Todas ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de Juatina, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, como ser empanadas, sandwish y demás. Comenta que gracias a su buena comida ha logrado atraer a sus clientes. Le gustaría poder seguir con su trabajo por lo cual solicita este préstamo, que es para la compra de carne, pollo, condimentos y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The Women’s Committee by the name of Kuña Pukavy was formed this year, and with hard work they are already in their second loan cycle. Today they all work together as a supportive group within foundation’s group for women entrepreneurs. In addition to each one’s independent work, they have also developed joint businesses in order to raise funds to have working capital within the group and, at the same time, to help each other financially support their families. 

Juatina’s story is very moving. She works selling all types of food, like empanadas, sandwiches, and other things. She says that she has attracted her customers thanks to her good food. She would like to be able to continue her work which is why she asked for this loan which is for the purchase of beef, chicken, condiments, and other things. She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it’s given her.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, condiments, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tennis shoes

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Michael.  He is married and has 5 children aged 17, 15, 12, 5 and 4. He has 3 additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives.  

In 2009, Michael established his rice, wood, palm oil and garri business. He began this business after he retired as a driver from Oxfam.  He now has  something to do even as he is retired, transacting with a lot of customers. 

Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, Michael earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.   Michael has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy rice for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. 

In the future, Michael plans to improve on his business by dealing in a variety of rice, and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Salamatu.  She is a widow and has 2 children aged 8 and 5. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her because they help her with her business.  

In 1999, Salamatu established her used clothing and plastic products business. She began her business by assisting her late husband.  The business attracts a lot of customers.   Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Salamatu earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  

Salamatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more bales of used clothing and plastic slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to own a shop rather than a stall, to improve on the lives of her family, and to save for her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy used clothes and plastic slippers

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Idrissa.  He is married and has 5 children aged 17, 15, 12, 9 and 5. 

In 2001, Idrissa established his shoes, bags, artificial hair products and cosmetics business. He began this business because he wanted to be self-employed and get a regular source of income to support his family.  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

Idrissa would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  He has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more shoes, bags and cosmetics. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Idrissa plans to expand his business to other areas in the township, and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy shoes, bags and cosmetics

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Idrissa.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 12 and 6 years. He has 1 additional dependent who live with him because he is the child of his brother, who lives in the village.  

In 1997, Idrissa established his used clothing business. He began this business by selling used clothes from his uncle.  It attracts a lot of women because of the type of used clothing he sells.   Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. 

Idrissa would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  He has already received and successfully repaid 3 previous loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional bales of used clothes.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. 

In the future, Idrissa plans to have another stall in the market, and support his children’s education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy used clothing to resell

loans.name: Yarjah

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Yarjah. He is married and has three children aged 15, 9 and 6. He has two additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives.  

In 1991, Yarjah established his patient drugs, cosmetics and video cassettes business. He began his business because he wants to be able to take care of his family. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Yarjah has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to improve the sale of cosmetics. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Yarjah plans to improve the cooling facilities of the shop to make it more standard and to support the education of his children. The loan helped him to improve his shop to meet the pharmacy board standard. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy more medicines for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Jeaneth sigue trabajanco como conserje, apoyando a su familia, junto con su esposo quien trabaja de sastre, el objetivo ha sido la mejora  a su vivienda.
Sus tres hijos habitan en casa, y las condiciones internas de cuartos, esta bastante incomoda, es por tal razon, comenzara la construccion de un cuarto en la parte de atrás, para tener mejor comodidad de espacio. Pues desde su primer credito era este su proposito, lo que no lo logro por que solo compro el material , lo que vino a reparar paredes de la casa, que se rajaron y que finalizo esta mejora con su segundo ciclo.

Jeaneth, hoy en dia, ha logrado esta mejoras, gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado, lo que esta sastifecha, junto a su esposo  equilibran  los gastos, ya que su sueldo es bajo, pero desde hace un año le dan un bono en su trabajo de setecientos cordobas, en donde se ha ayudado mucho, logrando pagar sus compromiso en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Jeaneth continues to work as a doorwoman, supporting her family, together with her husband who works as a tailor. The goal has been to improve their home. 

Their three children live at home, and the conditions of the rooms are pretty uncomfortable. For that reason, she’s begun construction of a room in the back, to have a more comfortable space. So, since her first loan was for this purpose, it wasn’t completed because she only bought the materials. She began to fix the walls which were cracked which ended the improvements in her second loan cycle. 

Today Jeaneth has made improvements, thanks to funding that Afodenic has given for which she is happy. Together with her husband they balance out the expenses since her salary is low. One year ago she was given a bonus of 700 cordobas, which was very helpful, letting her make payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to build a room, to have better living conditions and more comfort.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Fatmata. She is married, and has 4 children aged 17, 14, 8 and 5 years. In 2008, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business by selling door-to-door and now has a stall, choosing dresses for customers. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to improve the stock, buying trimmings, linens, ribbons and zippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to own a shop with a door rather than a stall. She thinks the loan will help to improve her family's lives. The previous loans also helped her to add on to her stock and to make more profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for clothing materials.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 40 year-old Fatmata.  She is married, and has 5 children. She has 1 additional dependents, who live with her because to assist in her schooling.  In 1995, Fatmata established her cooking condiment business. She began her business because she wants to be self dependant and to take care of her home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid 1 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to add to her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Fatmata plan to be a supplier of cooking condiment and to educate her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more imported foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Maria Felicitas

texts.es:
María de 52 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y ganadería.  

María se dedica  a la venta de frutas, tiene su puesto al frente de mercado de la zona donde vive, con una experiencia de 10 años, es conocida por la buena calidad de su producto (frutas) y tiene su propia clientela,  las ventas de sus productos se han ido incrementando; al igual que sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue de 1000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar mayor cantidad de fruta para abastecer su negocio como a su clientela, ya que sus productos son consumidos diariamente, el aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito y cumplir con sus obligaciones de casa.  María es una persona con muchos aspiraciones y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener más grande su  puesto en el mercado y contar con más comodidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
María is 52, and lives with her husband and children in their own house, which has water and electricity. It is located in the urban area of Bambamarca district, which is part of Cajamarca department.  People in this area make their living from farming and livestock-raising.

María sells fruit. She has her stand in the front of the market of the area where she lives.  She has ten years of experience doing this, and is known for the good quality of her fruit.  She has her own clientele, and the sales of her products have been gradually increasing, along with her income; improving her family's quality of life.  

She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles through the Capital Semilla program. She will use it to buy fruit in greater quantity, in order to stock her business and supply her clientele, as her products are consumed on a daily basis. The increase in her sales will allow her to pay back her loan, and meet her household expenses.

María is a person with many ambitions, and one of them is that with her hard work, she can have a larger stand in the market, and have more home comforts.

loans.use: To buy fruit in greater quantity for stocking her business and supplying her customers.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 31 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona tiene como actividad la agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace algunos años Luz se dedica a la venta diaria de menestras y granos cocidos en el interior del mercado de la ciudad donde vive, tiene su propia clientela a quien ofrece sus productos.  Ha creído conveniente en solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de  3000 nuevos soles para comprar más menestras y granos para seguir cocinando y luego venderlas, también para realizar algunos arreglos en su vivienda y con los ingresos que obtenga con las ventas de sus productos podrá cubrir su crédito y tener más comodidades en su casa para su hija.

Luz es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y honesta que lo único que quiere es sacar a su hija adelante brindándole otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a 31 year-old housewife. She lives with her daughter in their own house, which has water and electricity service. It is located in Bambamarca district, which is part of Cajamarca department. People in this area make their living from farming and livestock-raising.

For a few years now, Luz has sold cooked legumes and grains daily, inside the market of the city where she lives.  She has her own clientele, to whom she sells her products.  

She decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, in order to buy more legumes and grains, so that she can continue cooking and selling them. She will also carry out a few home repairs. With the income she gets from selling her products, she will be able to pay off the loan, and have more home comforts for her daughter.

Luz is a responsible, hard-working, and honest woman.  All she wants is to help her daughter get ahead in life, by offering her other opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy more legumes and grains in order to continue cooking and selling them, and also carry out a few home repairs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Margaret. She is married, and has four children aged 18, 14, 12 and 8 years. In 1996, Margaret established her provisions (such as sugar, milk, sardines, margarine, etc.) and drinks business. She began her business because she needed a source of income to help her husband provide a livelihood for her family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,300,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Margaret has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stocks of provisions and drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Margaret plans to expand to the sale of building materials, and to take care of her family to uplift the standards of living of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for provisions such as sugar, milk, sardines, margarine, etc., and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Mher

texts.ru:
Мгеру(Mher) 38 лет.Он родился и вырос в селе Срашен(Srashen) Капанской области.С юношеских лет Мгер вместе с родителями занимается сельскохозяйственными работами в родном селе. Мгер женат и живет отдельно от родителей, вместе  с женой , двумя дочерьми 10 и 2 лет и с сыном которому 8 лет. Мгер работает сварщиком , но так-как зарплата небольшая , он с женой занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом. В собственном огороде Мгер с женой выращивают овощи и фрукты, а так-же занимаются  пчеловодством. У них есть и орендованный земельный участок в селе , где Мгер сеет пщеницу. Сельскохозяйственную продукцию Мгер с женой реализуют в городе Капан. Выручка от ихнего сельского хозяйства очень помогает Мгеру достойно содержать семью и помогать  родителям. 
Мгеру нужен кредит 800.000 Армянских драм для покупки новых сортов семян пшеницы,кортофеля и для покупки новых ящиков для пчел.
texts.en:
Mher is 38 years old.  He was born and grew up in Srashen village in the Kapan area.  Since his youth Mher together with his parents has worked in agriculture in his native village.  Mher is married and lives separately from his parents with his wife, two daughters who are 10 and 2 years old and a son who is 8 years old.  Mher works as a welder but since his salary is not big, he and his wife also have an agriculture business.  In their own garden Mher and his wife grow vegetables and fruits and also raise bees.  They also have a rented plot of land in the village where Mher plants wheat.  Mher and his wife sell their agricultural products in Kapan city.  Revenues from their agriculture business help Mher to properly support his family and to help his parents.  

Mher needs a loan of 800,000 Armenian dram to purchase new varieties of wheat seeds and potato seeds and to purchase new boxes for bees.

loans.use: to buy new varieties of wheat seeds, potato seeds, and new boxes for bees

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa de 44 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz y agua, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y comercial.

Teresa se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos años, su mercadería lo ofrece en su casa a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su negocio con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old. She lives with her  family in their own house, which has water and electricity service. It is located in the Chepén district, which is part of the La Libertad department. This is an area where people make their living from farming, livestock raising and commercial activities.  

Teresa sells clothing, a business she has run from her home for a few years.  She sells merchandise to her customers in her home, and also fills orders. She is trying to have greater customer demand, so she can earn more income to meet her household expenses. 

Seeing her business become more prosperous each day, she felt it necessary to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, to buy merchandise in greater quantity and stock her business with innovative products. Her aim is to keep increasing her clientele, in order to be able to pay off her loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in greater quantity, to stock her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario de 31 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposa e hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Rosario desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y vacas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectivo alimento, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.  Rosario es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario is 31 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and children. The house has only electric service, and it is located in the rural part of the district of Tambogrande, which is part of the department of Piura. People in this area work in agriculture, ranching and handicraft production. 

For the past several years, Rosario has worked raising and selling farm animals (sheep and cows). His enclosures are behind his house, and they are large and appropriate. He feeds the animals balanced commercial feed and natural grasses, so that they achieve optimal growth. He is then able to offer them for sale at the various markets in the area, obtaining good earnings so that he can cover his family's expenses. 

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1200 Peruvian new soles, to buy more animals and the appropriate feed for them. With the earnings he obtains from selling his animals, he will be able to pay off his loan while also providing his family with a better quality of life. Rosario is a person who has found ways to help his family get ahead, with much effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy more animals and appropriate feed for them.

loans.name: Mario Noe

texts.es:
Mario de 34 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Mario se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, además de ser un producto consumido diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo y a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizante para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Mario con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a sus hijos, con la intensión de brindarles otra oportunidad académica en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mario is 34 years old. He lives with his family in his own house, which does not have basic services. It is located in the rural zone of the district of Tambogrande, which is part of the Piura department.  This is an agricultural, ranching, and artisan zone.

Mario works in agriculture.  He has his own farming land where he plants corn, something he has done for several years. Besides being a product that is eaten daily by people, once he harvests the corn, he sells it in the different markets in the area and outside of the area. With the income that he gets he can provide a better quality of life for his children and wife.

Seeing that his business continues to grow, he has believed that it is necessary to ask for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 3000 nuevos soles to buy fertilizer to improve his land as well as his produce. With the earnings that he makes he will pay off his loan and provide for the daily needs of his family.  Mario, with work and dedication, provides the best for his children, with the intention of offering them another academic opportunity in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his land as well as his produce.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva de 49 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijo, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Genoveva es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, una vez que realiza su cosecha sus productos los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su casa.  También cuenta con algunos animales de corral los cuales cría y luego comercializa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y alimento balanceado para sus animales, con la finalidad que con su cosecha obtenga mejoras económicas para su familia.  Genoveva a pesar de las dificultades  que se presentan en la vida sigue trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 49, lives with her husband and son in their own house, one that has electricity but no running water.  It is located in the rural zone of Tambogrande district, Piura department, an area that is characterized by agriculture, cattle raising and handicrafts.

Genoveva is a farmer and she has her own fields where she grows limes and mangos.  Once she harvests them she sells the fruit to different merchants in Piura and that is how she makes enough money to cover the household expenses.  She also has some large animals that she raises and then sells.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 800 new sols to buy fertilizer to improve her fields for her crops and balanced feed for her animals so that her harvest gets the best prices for her family.  Despite the difficulties that present themselves to Genoveva in her life, she continues working with a lot of effort to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve her fields for her crops and to purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material and provide maintenance for his machine.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario de 37 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en su casa propia, cuentan con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan, una zona agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra situada en el departamento de La Libertad.

Mario brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior (máximo 3 personas), la actividad que realiza lo hace durante todo el día hasta las 6 de la tarde, a pesar de la competencia en el rubro trata de obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar su necesidades familiares.

Desea solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para usarlo en el mantenimiento y cambio de repuestos a su mototaxi. Necesita mantener sus mototaxi en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario, who is 37 years old, lives with his family in his own house which has plumbing and electricity.  It is located in the district of Paijan, an agricultural and ranching zone which is situated in the department of La Libertad.

Mario offers transportation services to passengers in his motor rickshaw, a vehicle that consists of a motor and a cabin for transporting people in its interior (maximum of 3 people). He does this activity all day until 6 in the evening. In spite of the competition in the area he tries to obtain the necessary earnings to meet his family's needs.

He is asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to use for maintaining and changing spare parts on his motor rickshaw. He needs to keep his motor rickshaw in good condition in order to continue offering good service to his customers. With the help of the loan, he hopes to increase his earnings and continue helping his family economically.

loans.use: To maintain and to change spare parts on his motor rickshaw in order to continue offering good service to his customers.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a 55-year-old married mother of five children aged 25, 19, 13, 12 and 5, all of whom attend school. In 1999, she established a business selling dishes, bowls and other utensils and now earns about Le 1,000,000 each month by working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day.

Having already received and repaid two loans, Kadiatu is now requesting a new one in the amount of Le 4,000,000 in order to purchase a variety of dishes, bowls and bathing buckets. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000, and in the future plans to open a big shop to earn a larger income.

Hard-working, dedicated and assisted by her family, Kadiatu wants to fully educate her children for a better life. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of dishes, bowls and bathing buckets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to continue constructing his come with concrete walls in the front part of the house.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Granda conocida por sus estructuras coloniales y artesanía precolombinas, vive doña María Auxiliadora, una comerciante de 51 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 26 años de edad, independiente. Ella se dedica a vender artesanías, anteriormente trabajaba como secretaria para una empresa en la ciudad de Managua, y fue ahí que una adquirió conocimiento, experiencia que la motivo a tener su propio negocio además a ella le gusta nuestra cultura y riqueza artesanal que posee el país, esto le ayuda a identificarse con el tipo de negocio que ella quería tener, ya lleva 6 años con su venta de artesanías, hamacas y cuadros pintorescos que por cierto son muy buscados por los turistas. Ella nos cuenta que su negocio le ha permitido conocer y aprender de nuestra propia cultura y entender porque los visitantes les gustan mucho las artesanías además este negocio le  ha proveído alimentación y pagar gastos de su hogar.
Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar artesanías tales como hamacas tejidas, cuadros, jarrones, hoyas.  Esta inversión le ayudara a tener más inventario ya que se acerca una época fuerte  donde viene  al país bastantes turistas  y quiere aprovechar a vender. Ella desea tener un local propio y es por ello que trabaja fuerte y duro todos los días.
texts.en:
In the city of Granada, known for its colonial buildings and pre-Columbian handicrafts, lives María Auxiliadora, a 51-year-old merchant. She is a single mother with a son who is 26 years old and independent. She works selling handicrafts. Previously, she worked as a secretary for a company in the city of Managua, and there she acquired knowledge and experience which motivated her to have her own business. In addition, she likes our culture and the country's rich tradition of handicrafts -- this helped her to decide on the type of business she wanted to operate. She has now worked for 6 years selling handicrafts, hammocks and picturesque paintings which are in great demand among tourists. She reports that her business has allowed her to learn about and get to know our own culture and to understand why visitors are very fond of handicrafts. In addition, this business has provided her with her daily bread and covered her household expenses. 

She applied for this loan to buy handicrafts such as woven hammocks, paintings, pots and jewelry. This investment will help her expand her inventory, since a high season is approaching when many tourists come to the country, and she would like to take advantage of this to sell to them. She would like to have her own building for her shop, and for this reason she is working long and hard every day.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell such as woven hammocks, paintings, pots and jewelry.

loans.name: Javier Sebastian

texts.es:
Javier de 41 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Javier maneja su propia mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la competencia, él trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, porque está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas, con la finalidad de seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela.  Javier es una persona con muchas ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante en la vida para seguir ayudando a su familia a mejorar y alcanzar sus metas en la vida.
texts.en:
Javier, 41, lives with his family in his own home with water and electricity located in the rural area of the district of Chepén in the department of La Libertad.  The inhabitants of this area work in agriculture and livestock.

Javier has been driving his own mototaxi for several years.  (This transportation is used to go short distances, with a maximum of three people.)  He works in the same area in which he lives, in spite of the competition.  He tries as hard as possible and from very early to move a large number of passengers to their various destinations so he can have a higher income to pay for his expenses and family necessities.

The loan of 500 PEN that he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa will be for maintenance on his mototaxi, because it is showing some mechanical flaws.  His goal is to continue offering his customers good service.

Javier is a person who wants to work and get ahead in life to be able to continue helping his family improve and reach their goals in life.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi to continue offering his customers good service.

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es: Douglas ,31 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Granada, el es zapatero. El inicio en sociedad este negocio con su suegra hace dos años, pero se independizo de ella, lleva dos años administrando por si solo su zapatería , el vende zapatos que el mismo elabora en la ciudad de Granada y Masaya  es en base a este negocio que mantiene su hogar , paga el colegio a sus hijos. A el le gusta y siente orgullo de ver sus zapatos son muy demandados ya que son fruto de su trabajo y elaborados por sus propias manos. El requiere el préstamo para comprar materia prima tales como cuero, mostasia, cambreyon, suelas, clavos que son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para elaborar sus zapatos de cuero. Con la inversión podrá comprar con más facilidad a un buen precio la materia prima que necesita. Sus planes según nos cuenta es expandirse en departamentos del país tales como Matagalpa, Chinandega , lograr tener una pequeña tienda donde pueda dar empleos , tener estabilidad económica para darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Douglas, 31, is married and has two children, ages 8 and 10.  A native of the city of Granada, he is a cobbler.  He began this business with his mother-in-law two years ago but became independent from her.  For two years he has been running his shoe business by himself.

He sells shoes that he makes himself in the city of Granada and Masaya.  With this business he supports his household and pays his children's school expenses.

Douglas enjoys and feels proud of seeing his shoes in high demand, since they are the fruit of his work and made with his own hands.

He needs the loan to buy materials such as leather, beads, shanks, soles, and nails, which are part of the materials he uses to make his leather shoes.

With the investment he will be able to buy the materials he needs more easily at a good price.  According to what he tells us, his plans are to expand into other departments in the country like Matagalpa and Chinadega, get a small store where he can give jobs, and have economic stability to give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, beads, shanks, soles, and nails.

loans.name: Kenia Lizeth

texts.es:
Kenia, de 28 años de edad, vive en una aldea  fuera de San Pedro Sula. Lleva 9 años de casada con su esposo y tienen 2 hijos de 6 y 7 años de edad.  

Llevan cuatro años trabajando duro. A Kenia siempre le ha gustado costurar y aprendió a elaborar sabanas para  camas. Ahora es su negocio que le genera los ingresos para vivir en mejores condiciones que antes.

Su esposo la apoya mucho con la venta de las sabanas quien sale a ovenderlas a varios lugares y aprovecha a vender también  accesorios para celulares como diversificación del negocio.

Ha solicitado un  quinto préstamo a ODEF  para compra de telas para elaborar sabanas y accesorios para teléfono celulares, ya que viene la temporada buena de navidad donde va expandir mas el negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Kenia, age 28, lives in a village outside of San Pedro Sula.  She has been married for nine years, and she has two children, ages six and seven.

She has been working hard for four years.  Kenia has always liked to sew, and she learned how to make bed sheets.  Now it is her business, and it generates the income for better living conditions than before.

Her husband supports her a lot with the sale of the sheets.  He goes to various places to offer them for sale.  He makes the most of it by also selling cell phone accessories to diversify the business.   

She has requested her fifth loan from ODEF.  The loan is to buy fabric to make sheets and to buy cell phone accessories.  The good Christmas season is coming up, and she will expand her business more and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make sheets and to buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa tiene 61 años y vive en un Barrio fuera de San Pedro Sula. Ella y su esposo Porfirio, llevan 40 años de casados. Don Porfirio es electricista. La pareja tienen cuatro hijos mayores de 43, 40, 38, y 37 años. Actualmente uno de los hijos vive en su casa. 

María Luisa siempre le encantó cocinar. Siempre le gustó hacer tamales. Hace diez años, empezó a vender tamales de su casa. Su familia le impulsó a comenzar debido a su talento como cocinera. Ella hace los tamales a diario y también los hace por encargo de cantidades grandes. Con las ganancias del negocio a logrado un aumento en los ingresos familiares. Una de las dificultades que enfrenta María Luisa es el transporte. La pareja no cuentan con vehículo propio, así que para salir de la aldea y entregar pedidos, tienen que utilizar el autobús. 

A través de 8 prestamos anteriores, María Luisa ha logrado crecer su negocio y su clientela. Este préstamo de L4,500 le va a ayudar a seguir aumentando sus ventas. Lo va a utilizar para la compra de 2 quintales de maíz, ollas, y platos
texts.en:
María Luisa, age 61, lives in a neighborhood outside of San Pedro Sula.  She and her husband, Porfirio, have been married for forty years.  Porfirio is an electrician.  The couple has four grown children; ages 43, 40, 38, and 37.  One of their children lives in their house.

María Luisa has always loved to cook.  She has always liked making tamales.  Ten years ago she started to sell tamales at her house.  Her family urged her to start because of her talent as a cook.  She makes the tamales every day, and she also makes large quantities by order.  With the earnings from the business she has managed to increase the family income.

One of the difficulties facing María Luisa is the transportation.  The pair does not have their own vehicle.  In order to leave the village and deliver orders they have to take the bus.

Through eight previous loans María Luisa has managed to make her business and her customer base grow.  This loan for 4,000 lempiras will help her to continue increasing her sales.  She will use the loan to buy two “quintales” (one quintal is about 100 lbs.) of corn, pots, and dishes.

loans.use: to buy two “quintales” (a quintal is about 100 lbs.) of corn, pots, and dishes.

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 pupil daughters in Ijevan city. His wife does not work and takes care of their children. Since 1995 till 2003 Rudik used to work in the Ijevan trade market as a scrutineer (market inspector).
